verses.ar_en: Now forgive my sin just this one time and plead with [before] Adonoy, your God, just to remove this death from me.”

verses.ar_he: וּנְפַק מִלְוָת פַּרְעֹה וְצַלִי קֳדָם יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: He [Moshe] left Pharaoh’s presence and prayed to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲפַךְ יְיָ רוּחָא מַעַרְבָא תַּקִיף לַחֲדָא וּנְטַל יָת גוֹבָא וּרְמָהִי לְיַמָא דְסוּף לָא אִשְׁתָּאַר גוֹבָא חַד בְּכֹל תְּחוּם מִצְרָיִם:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy turned a very strong westerly wind, that carried away the locusts, and plunged them into the Reed Sea. Not a single locust remained in all of Egypt’s borders.

verses.ar_he: וְאַתְקֵף יְיָ יָת לִבָּא דְפַרְעֹה וְלָא שַׁלַח יָת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he did not send out the B’nei Yisrael.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה אֲרֵים יְדָךְ עַל צֵית שְׁמַיָא וִיהֵי חֲשׁוֹכָא עַל אַרְעָא דְמִצְרָיִם בָּתַר דְיַעְדֵי קְבֵל לֵילְיָא:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe, “Stretch out your hand toward the sky, and there will be darkness over the land of Egypt [after the darkness of the night will be removed]. The darkness will be tangible.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵים משֶׁה יָת יְדֵהּ עַל צֵית שְׁמַיָא וַהֲוָה חֲשׁוֹךְ קְבֵל בְּכָל אַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם תְּלָתָא יוֹמִין:
verses.ar_en: Moshe stretched out his hand toward the sky, and there was total darkness in the entire land of Egypt for three days.

verses.ar_he: לָא חֲזוֹ אֱנָשׁ יָת אֲחוֹהִי וְלָא קָמוּ אֱנָשׁ מִתְּחוֹתוֹהִי תְּלָתָא יוֹמִין וּלְכָל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל הֲוָה נְהוֹרָא בְּמוֹתְבָנְהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Man could not see his fellow man, nor could anyone rise from his place for three days. But all the B’nei Yisrael had light in their dwellings.

verses.ar_he: וּקְרָא פַרְעֹה לְמשֶׁה וַאֲמַר אֱזִילוּ פְּלָחוּ קֳדָם יְיָ לְחוֹד עָנְכוֹן וְתוֹרְכוֹן שְׁבוּקוּ אַף טַפְלְכוֹן יֵזֵיל עִמְכוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Pharaoh called to Moshe, and he said, “Go! Worship [before] Adonoy. Just let your sheep and cattle stay behind. Even your little ones can go with you.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר משֶׁה אַף אַתְּ תִּמְסַר בִּידָנָא נִכְסַת קֻדְשִׁין וַעֲלָוָן וְנַעְבֵּד קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָנָא:
verses.ar_en: Moshe said, “You too will give us sacrifices and burnt-offerings that we will make [offer] to [before] our God.

verses.ar_he: וְאַף בְּעִירָנָא יֵזֵיל עִמָנָא לָא תִשְׁתָּאַר מִדַעַם אֲרֵי מִנֵהּ אֲנַחְנָא נָסְבִין לְמִפְלַח קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָנָא וַאֲנַחְנָא לֵית אֲנַחְנָא יָדְעִין מָה נִפְלַח קֳדָם יְיָ עַד מֵיתָנָא תַּמָן:
verses.ar_en: Our own flocks will also go with us. Not a single hoof [thing] will remain. We must take from them to worship [before] Adonoy our God; since we do not know with what [animals] we will worship [before] Adonoy until we get there.”

verses.ar_he: וְאַתְקֵיף יְיָ יָת לִבָּא דְפַרְעֹה וְלָא אָבָה לְשַׁלָחוּתְהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy hardened Pharaoh’s heart and he was [no longer] willing to send them away.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לֵּהּ פַּרְעֹה אִזֵיל מֵעִלָוָי אִסְתַּמַר לָךְ לָא תוֹסִיף לְמֶחֱזֵי אַפַּי אֲרֵי בְּיוֹמָא דְתֶחֱזֵי אַפַּי תְּמוּת:
verses.ar_en: Pharaoh said to him [Moshe] “Leave my presence. Beware! Do not see my face again; for on the day you see my face you will die.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר משֶׁה יָאוּת מַלֵילְתָּא לָא אוֹסִיף עוֹד לְמֶחֱזֵי אַפָּיךְ:
verses.ar_en: Moshe said, “As you say. [You have spoken well.] I will not see your face again.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה עוֹד מַכְתַּשׁ חַד אַיְתִי עַל פַּרְעֹה וְעַל מִצְרַיִם בָּתַר כֵּן יְשַׁלַח יָתְכוֹן מִכָּא כְּשַׁלָחוּתֵהּ גְמֵירָא תָּרָכָא יְתָרֵךְ יָתְכוֹן מִכָּא:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe, “There is one more plague that I will bring upon Pharaoh and upon Egypt. After that he will send you away from here. When he sends you away, he will actually drive you out from here completely.

verses.ar_he: מַלֵיל כְּעַן קֳדָם עַמָא וּשְׁאִילוּ גְבַר מִן חַבְרֵהּ וְאִתְּתָא מִן חַבְרָתַהּ מָנִין דִכְסַף וּמָנִין דִדְהָב:
verses.ar_en: Speak, please [now], in the ears of [before] the people, and let each man request [borrow] from his friend, and each woman from her friend, articles of silver and articles of gold.”

verses.ar_he: וִיהַב יְיָ יָת עַמָא לְרַחֲמִין בְּעֵינֵי מִצְרָיִם אַף גַבְרָא משֶׁה רַב לַחֲדָא בְּאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם בְּעֵינֵי עַבְדֵי פַרְעֹה וּבְעֵינֵי עַמָא:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy gave the people favor in the eyes of the Egyptians. Moshe too was very great in the land of Egypt, [both] in the eyes of Pharaoh’s servants and in the eyes of the people.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר משֶׁה כִּדְנַן אֲמַר יְיָ כְּפַלְגוּת לֵילְיָא אֲנָא מִתְגְלִי בְּגוֹ מִצְרָיִם:
verses.ar_en: Moshe said, “This is what Adonoy has said, About the time of midnight, I will go out [become revealed] in the midst of Egypt.

verses.ar_he: וִימוּת כָּל בּוּכְרָא בְּאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם מִבּוּכְרָא דְפַרְעֹה דְעָתִיד לְמִתַּב עַל כָּרְסֵי מַלְכוּתֵהּ עַד בּוּכְרָא דְאַמְתָא דִי בָּתַר רֵיחְיָא וְכֹל בּוּכְרָא דִבְעִירָא:
verses.ar_en: Every first-born in the land of Egypt will die, from the first-born of Pharaoh sitting on his [who is destined to sit upon the] throne [of his kingdom], to the first-born of the [Egyptian] slave girl, behind the mill-stones, and every first-born animal.

verses.ar_he: וּתְהֵי צְוַחְתָּא רַבָּא בְּכָל אַרְעָא דְמִצְרָיִם דִכְוָתֵהּ לָא הֲוַת וְדִכְוָתֵהּ לָא תוֹסֵף:
verses.ar_en: There will be a great cry [of anguish] throughout the entire land of Egypt, the likes of which there never was and like there never will be.

verses.ar_he: וּלְכֹל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לָא יַנְזֵק כַּלְבָּא בְּלִישְׁנֵהּ לְמִנְבַּח לְמֵאֲנָשָׁא וְעַד בְּעִירָא בְּדִיל דְתִדְעוּן דְיַפְרֵישׁ יְיָ בֵּין מִצְרַיִם וּבֵין יִשְׂרָאֵל:
verses.ar_en: But among all the B’nei Yisrael, a dog will not sharpen [cause damage with] its tongue [growl] at man or animal. You will then know that Adonoy distinguishes between Egypt and Yisrael.

verses.ar_he: וְיֶחֱתוּן כָּל עַבְדָיךְ אִלֵין לְוָתִי וְיִבְעוֹן מִנִי לְמֵימָר פּוּק אַתְּ וְכָל עַמָא דִי עִמָךְ וּבָתַר כֵּן אֶפּוֹק וּנְפַק מִלְוָת פַּרְעֹה בִּתְקוֹף רְגָז:
verses.ar_en: Then all these, your servants, will come down to me, and prostrate themselves [beseech me] saying, ‘Go! You and all the people that follow you [that are with you]. Then I will go out.” He [Moshe] then left Pharaoh in great anger.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה לָא יְקַבֵּל מִנְכוֹן פַּרְעֹה בְּדִיל לְאַסְגָאָה מוֹפְתַי בְּאַרְעָא דְמִצְרָיִם:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe, “Pharaoh will not listen to [accept] you. Thus I will multiply My wonders in the land of Egypt.”

verses.ar_he: וּמשֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן עֲבָדוּ יָת כָּל מוֹפְתַיָא הָאִלֵין קֳדָם פַּרְעֹה וְתַקַף יְיָ יָת לִבָּא דְפַרְעֹה וְלָא שַׁלַח יָת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מֵאַרְעֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: Moshe and Aharon had done all these wonders before Pharaoh. [However] Adonoy hardened Pharaoh’s heart and he did not send the B’nei Yisrael out of his land.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה וּלְאַהֲרֹן בְּאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם לְמֵימָר:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe and Aharon in the land of Egypt saying:

verses.ar_he: יַרְחָא הָדֵין לְכוֹן רֵישׁ יַרְחִין קַדְמַאי הוּא לְכוֹן לְיַרְחֵי שַׁתָּא:
verses.ar_en: “This month shall be [reckoned] to you [as] the head [beginning] of months. It shall be to you the first of the months of the year.

verses.ar_he: מַלִילוּ עִם כָּל כְּנִשְׁתָּא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל לְמֵימַר בְּעַסְרָא לְיַרְחָא הָדֵין וְיִסְבוּן לְהוֹן גְבַר אִמָר לְבֵית אַבָּא אִמָר לְבֵיתָא:
verses.ar_en: Speak to the entire community of Israel saying, ‘On the tenth [day] of this month they shall take—each man [shall take] a lamb for [his] family, a lamb for each household.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם יִזְעֵיר בֵּיתָא מִלְאִתְמְנָאָה עַל אִמְרָא וְיִסַב הוּא וְשֵׁיבָבֵהּ דְקָרִיב לְבֵיתֵהּ בְּמִנְיַן נַפְשָׁתָא גְבַר לְפוּם מֵיכְלֵהּ תִּתְמְנוּן עַל אִמְרָא:
verses.ar_en: If the [members of the] household are too few for the [numbering of the] [eating of a] lamb then he shall take [a lamb] [together] with his neighbor, close by his house, according to the number of individuals. According to what the person eats shall you make your count regarding the lamb.

verses.ar_he: אִמַר שְׁלִים דְכַר בַּר שַׁתֵּהּ יְהֵי לְכוֹן מִן אִמְרַיָא וּמִן עִזַיָא תִּסְבוּן:
verses.ar_en: A flawless lamb, a yearling male must be in your possession. You may take it from sheep or goats.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי לְכוֹן לְמַטְרָא עַד אַרְבְּעָא עַסְרָא יוֹמָא לְיַרְחָא הָדֵין וְיִכְּסוּן יָתֵהּ כֹּל קְהָלָא כְנִשְׁתָּא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל בֵּין שִׁמְשַּׁיָא:
verses.ar_en: You shall hold it in safekeeping until the fourteenth day of this month, they shall slaughter it—the entire community of Yisrael—between evenings [in the afternoon].

verses.ar_he: וְיִסְבוּן מִן דְמָא וְיִתְּנוּן עַל תְּרֵין סִפַּיָא וְעַל שַׁקְפָא עַל בָּתַּיָא דְיֵכְלוּן יָתֵהּ בְּהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: They shall take of its blood and place it on the side of the doorposts and on the lintel of the houses in which they will eat [the lamb].

verses.ar_he: וְיֵכְלוּן יָת בִּסְרָא בְּלֵילָא הַהוּא טְּוֵי נוּר וּפַטִיר עַל מְרָרִין יֵכְלֻנֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: They shall eat the meat during this night. It shall be roasted over fire. They shall eat it with matzos [matzoh] and bitter herbs.

verses.ar_he: לָא תֵיכְלוּן מִנֵהּ כַּד חַי וְאַף לָא בַשָׁלָא מְבֻשָׁל בְּמַיָא אֱלָהֵן טְוֵי נוּר רֵישֵׁיה עַל כְּרָעוֹהִי וְעַל גַוֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: You must not eat it half-cooked or [even] boiled in water, but only roasted over fire, its head with its knees and its inner organs.

verses.ar_he: וְלָא תַשְׁאֲרוּן מִנֵהּ עַד צַפְרָא וּדְיִשְׁתָּאַר מִנֵהּ עַד צַפְרָא בְּנוּרָא תוֹקְדוּן:
verses.ar_en: You must not leave any of it over until morning. Any of it left over until morning must be burned in fire.

verses.ar_he: וּכְדֵין תֵּיכְלוּן יָתֵהּ חַרְצֵיכוֹן יְהוֹן אֲסִירִין מְסָנֵיכוֹן בְּרִגְלֵיכוֹן וְחוּטְרֵיכוֹן בִּידֵיכוֹן וְתֵיכְלוּן יָתֵהּ בִּבְהִילוּ פִּסְחָא הוּא קֳדָם יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: This is how you must eat it: with your waist belted, your shoes on your feet, and your staff in your hand. You must eat it in haste, it is a Pesach-offering to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְגְלֵיתִי בְאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם בְּלֵילְיָא הָדֵין וְאֶקְטוֹל כָּל בּוּכְרָא בְּאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם מֵאֲנָשָׁא וְעַד בְּעִירָא וּבְכָל טַעֲוַת מִצְרַיִם אַעְבֵּד דִינִין אֲנָא יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: I will pass through [become revealed in] the land of Egypt on that night, and I will strike [kill] every first-born in the land of Egypt, from man to beast; and against all the gods of Egypt, I will execute judgments, I am Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי דְמָא לְכוֹן לְאָת עַל בָּתַּיָא דִי אַתּוּן תַּמָן וְאֶחֱזֵי יָת דְמָא וְאֵיחוֹס עֲלֵיכוֹן וְלָא יְהֵי בְכוֹן מוֹתָא לְחַבָּלָא בְּמִקְטְלִי בְּאַרְעָא דְמִצְרָיִם:
verses.ar_en: The blood will be for you as a sign on the houses where you are [staying]. I will see the blood and I will pass over [have mercy upon] you. There will be no plague against you when I strike the land of Egypt.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי יוֹמָא הָדֵין לְכוֹן לְדוּכְרָנָא וּתְחַגוּן יָתֵהּ חַגָא קָדָם יְיָ לְדָרֵיכוֹן קְיָם עָלָם תְּחַגֻנֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: This day shall be for you a [day of] remembrance. You shall celebrate it as a festival to [before] Adonoy, throughout your generations. It is an eternal statute that you must celebrate it.

verses.ar_he: שִׁבְעַת יוֹמִין פַּטִיר תֵּיכְלוּן בְּרַם בְּיוֹמָא קַדְמָאָה תְּבַטְלוּן חֲמִיעַ מִבָּתֵּיכוֹן אֲרֵי כָּל דְיֵכוּל חֲמִיעַ וְיִשְׁתֵּצֵי אֱנָשָׁא הַהוּא מִיִשְׂרָאֵל מִיוֹמָא קַדְמָאָה עַד יוֹמָא שְׁבִיעָאָה:
verses.ar_en: You must eat matzos [matzoh] for seven days, but before the first day you must remove [nullify] [all] leaven from your homes; for anyone who eats chametz, that soul will be cut off from Yisrael. [Chametz is forbidden] from the first day [of Pesach] until [after] the seventh day.

verses.ar_he: וּבְיוֹמָא קַדְמָאָה מְעָרַע קַדִישׁ וּבְיוֹמָא שְׁבִיעָאָה מְעָרַע קַדִישׁ יְהֵי לְכוֹן כָּל עִיבִידָא לָא יִתְעֲבֵד בְּהוֹן בְּרַם דִי מִתְאֲכֵל לְכָל נְפַשׁ הוּא בִלְחוֹדוֹהִי יִתְעֲבֵד לְכוֹן:
verses.ar_en: The first day shall be a holy assembly and the seventh day shall be a holy assembly to you. No work shall be done on them, only for [the preparation of food] which will be eaten by every person, that alone may be done for you.

verses.ar_he: וְתִטְרוּן יָת פַּטִירָא אֲרֵי בִּכְרַן יוֹמָא הָדֵין אַפֵּיקִית יָת חֵילֵיכוֹן מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרָיִם וְתִטְּרוּן יָת יוֹמָא הָדֵין לְדָרֵיכוֹן קְיָם עָלָם:
verses.ar_en: You must be vigilant regarding the matzos [matzoh], for on this very day I brought out your hosts from the land of Egypt. You must preserve this day for your generations, it is an eternal statute.

verses.ar_he: בְּנִיסָן בְּאַרְבְּעָא עַסְרָא יוֹמָא לְיַרְחָא בְּרַמְשָׁא תֵּיכְלוּן פַּטִירָא עַד יוֹמָא עֶסְרִין וְחַד לְיַרְחָא בְּרַמְשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: In the first [month] [Nisan] on the fourteenth day of the month, in the evening you shall eat matzos [matzoh]; until the twenty-first day of the month in the evening.

verses.ar_he: שִׁבְעַת יוֹמִין חֲמִיר לָא יִשְׁתְּכַח בְּבָתֵּיכוֹן אֲרֵי כָּל דְיֵכוּל מַחְמְעָא וְיִשְׁתֵּצֵי אֱנָשָׁא הַהוּא מִכְּנִשְׁתָּא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל בְּגִיוֹרָא וּבְיַצִיבָא דְאַרְעָא:
verses.ar_en: For seven days leaven may not be found in your homes, for whoever eats chametz that soul shall be cut off from the community of Israel, whether a proselyte or a native born in the land.

verses.ar_he: כָּל מַחְמְעָא לָא תֵיכְלוּן בְּכֹל מוֹתְבָנֵיכוֹן תֵּיכְלוּן פַּטִירָא:
verses.ar_en: You must not eat anything that is chametz. In all your dwellings you shall eat matzos [matzoh].

verses.ar_he: וּקְרָא משֶׁה לְכָל סָבֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וַאֲמַר לְהוֹן אִתְנְגִידוּ וְסִיבוּ לְכוֹן (מִן בְּנֵי) עָנָא לְזַרְעֲיָתְכוֹן וְכוּסוּ פִסְחָא:
verses.ar_en: Moshe called to all the elders of Yisrael, and he said to them, “Draw [from your flocks] or purchase for yourselves a lamb for your families and slaughter it as a Pesach offering.

verses.ar_he: וְתִסְבּוּן אֱסָרַת אֵזוֹבָא וְתִטְבְּלוּן בִּדְמָא דִבְמָנָא וְתַדוּן לְשַׁקְפָא וְלִתְרֵין סִפַּיָא מִן דְמָא דִבְמָנָא וְאַתּוּן לָא תִפְּקוּן אֱנַשׁ מִתְּרַע בֵּיתֵהּ עַד צַפְרָא:
verses.ar_en: Take a bunch of hyssop, and dip it in the blood that is in the basin. Touch [Sprinkle] the lintel and the two side [door] posts with some of the blood in the basin. And all of you, let no man go out the door of his house until morning.

verses.ar_he: וְיִתְגְלֵי יְיָ לְמִמְחֵי יָת מִצְרַיִם וְיֶחֱזֵי יָת דְמָא עַל שַׁקְפָא וְעַל תְּרֵין סִפַּיָא וְיֵחוֹס יְיָ עַל תַּרְעָא וְלָא יִשְׁבּוֹק לְחַבָּלָא לְמֵיעַל לְבָתֵּיכוֹן לְמִמְחֵי:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy will pass through [become revealed] to plague the Egyptians and He will see the blood on the lintel and on the two side [door] posts. Adonoy will then pass over [have mercy upon] that door and will not allow the destroyer to enter your houses to plague you.

verses.ar_he: וְתִטְרוּן יָת פִּתְגָמָא הָדֵין לִקְיָם לָךְ וְלִבְנָיךְ עַד עָלָם:
verses.ar_en: You must preserve this [ritual] as a statute for you and your children forever.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי אֲרֵי תֵעֲלוּן לְאַרְעָא דְיִתֵּן יְיָ לְכוֹן כְּמָא דִי מַלִיל וְתִטְּרוּן יָת פָּלְחָנָא הָדֵין:
verses.ar_en: When you come to the land that Adonoy will give to you, as He spoke, you must preserve this service.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי אֲרֵי יֵימְרוּן לְכוֹן בְּנֵיכוֹן מָא פָּלְחָנָא הָדֵין לְכוֹן:
verses.ar_en: When your children will ask you, “What is this service of yours?”

verses.ar_he: וְתֵימְרוּן דַבַּח חֲיָס הוּא קֳדָם יְיָ דִי חָס עַל בָּתֵּי בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּמִצְרַיִם כַּד הֲוָה מָחֵי יָת מִצְרָאֵי וְיָת בָּתָּנָא שֵׁזִיב וּכְרַע עַמָא וּסְגִידוּ:
verses.ar_en: You shall say, “It is the Pesach-offering [of compassion] to [before] Adonoy Who passed over [had mercy upon] the houses of the B’nei Yisrael in Egypt when He struck the Egyptians and saved our homes. The people then bowed and prostrated themselves.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲזָלוּ וַעֲבָדוּ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל כְּמָא דְפַקִיד יְיָ יָת משֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן כֵּן עֲבָדוּ:
verses.ar_en: The B’nei Yisrael went and did as Adonoy commanded Moshe and Aharon. They [also] did so.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה בְּפַלְגוּת לֵילְיָא וַיְיָ קְטַל כָּל בּוּכְרָא בְּאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם מִבּוּכְרָא דְפַרְעֹה דְעָתִיד לְמִתַּב עַל כָּרְסֵי מַלְכוּתֵהּ עַד בּוּכְרָא דְשִׁבְיָא דִי בְּבֵית אֲסִירֵי וְכֹל בּוּכְרָא דִבְעִירָא:
verses.ar_en: It was [exactly] midnight and Adonoy struck down [killed] every first-born son in the land of Egypt, from the first-born son of Pharaoh sitting on his [who is destined to sit upon the] throne [of his kingdom], to the first-born son of the captive [prisoner] who was in the dungeon, as well as every first-born animal.

verses.ar_he: וְקָם פַּרְעֹה לֵילְיָא הוּא וְכָל עַבְדוֹהִי וְכָל מִצְרַיִם וַהֲוַת צְוַחְתָּא רַבְּתָא בְּמִצְרָיִם אֲרֵי לֵית בֵּיתָא דִי לֵית הֲוָה בֵהּ תַּמָן מֵתָא:
verses.ar_en: Pharaoh arose at night, he and all his servants and all the Egyptians, and there was a great cry in Egypt, for there was no house where there were no dead.

verses.ar_he: וּקְרָא לְמשֶׁה וּלְאַהֲרֹן לֵילְיָא וַאֲמַר קוּמוּ פּוּקוּ מִגוֹ עַמִי אַף אַתּוּן אַף בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וֶאֱזִילוּ פְלָחוּ קֳדָם יְיָ כְּמָא דִהֲוֵתוּן אָמְרִין:
verses.ar_en: [Pharaoh] called for Moshe and Aharon that night and said, “Set out! Get out from among my people, both you and the B’nei Yisrael. Go worship [before] Adonoy as you have said [requested].

verses.ar_he: אַף עַנְכוֹן אַף תּוֹרְכוֹן דְבָרוּ כְּמָא דִי מַלֵלְתֻּן וֶאֱזִילוּ וְצַלוֹ אַף עָלָי:
verses.ar_en: Take your sheep and cattle too, as you have said and go; bless [pray for] me too.

verses.ar_he: וּתְקֵיפַת מִצְרַיִם עַל עַמָא לְאוֹחָאָה לְשַׁלָחוּתְהוֹן מִן אַרְעָא אֲרֵי אֲמָרוּ כֻּלָנָא מָיְתִין:
verses.ar_en: The Egyptians pressed the people to hurry them—to send them out of the land, for they said, “We are all dead men.”

verses.ar_he: וּנְטַל עַמָא יָת לַיְשֵׁיהוֹן עַד לָא חֲמָע מוֹתַר אַצְוָתְהוֹן צְרִיר בִּלְבָשֵׁהוֹן עַל כַּתְפֵּיהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: The people took their dough before it was leavened. Their [The] leftovers [of their dough] were wrapped in their clothing, [and carried] on their shoulders.

verses.ar_he: וּבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל עֲבָדוּ כְּפִתְגָמָא דְמשֶׁה וּשְׁאִילוּ מִמִצְרַיִם מָנִין דִכְסַף וּמָנִין דִדְהַב וּלְבוּשִׁין:
verses.ar_en: The B’nei Yisrael did as Moshe said, and they requested of the Egyptians silver articles and gold articles and clothing.

verses.ar_he: וַייָ יְהַב יָת עַמָא לְרַחֲמִין בְּעֵינֵי מִצְרַיִם וּשְׁאֵילִנוּן וְרוֹקִינוּ יָת מִצְרַיִם:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy granted the people favor in the eyes of the Egyptians, and they granted their request. They [B’nei Yisrael thus] drained Egypt of its wealth.

verses.ar_he: וּנְטָלוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מֵרַעְמְסֵס לְסֻכּוֹת כְּשִׁתְּ מֵאָה אַלְפִין רִגְלָאִין גֻבְרַיָא בַּר מִטַפְלָא:
verses.ar_en: The B’nei Yisrael traveled from Ramseis to Sukkos. There were about six hundred thousand males on foot besides the children.

verses.ar_he: וְאַף נוּכְרָאִין סַגִיאִין סְלִיקוּ עִמְהוֹן וְעָנָא וְתוֹרִין בְּעִירָא סַגִי לַחֲדָא:
verses.ar_en: A great mixture [of nationalities] [multitude of strangers] also went up with them. There were [also] sheep and cattle, a huge amount of livestock.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲפוֹ יָת לַיְשָׁא דִי אַפִּיקוּ מִמִצְרַיִם גְרִיצָן פַּטִירָן אֲרֵי לָא חֲמָע אֲרֵי אִתָּרָכוּ מִמִצְרַיִם וְלָא יָכִילוּ לְאִתְעַכָּבָא וְאַף זְוָדִין לָא עֲבָדוּ לְהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: They baked the dough that they had brought out of Egypt into matzoh cakes, for it was not leavened. Since they were driven out of Egypt and could not delay, they had also not prepared provisions for themselves.

verses.ar_he: וּמוֹתַב בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל דִי יְתִיבוּ בְּמִצְרָיִם אַרְבַּע מְאָה וּתְלָתִין שְׁנִין:
verses.ar_en: The habitation of the B’nei Yisrael living in Egypt lasted four hundred and thirty years.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה מִסוֹף אַרְבַּע מְאָה וּתְלָתִין שְׁנִין וַהֲוָה בִּכְרַן יוֹמָא הָדֵין נְפָקוּ כָּל חֵילַיָא דַיְיָ מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרָיִם:
verses.ar_en: It was at the end of the four hundred and thirty years, and on that very day all of Adonoy’s multitudes went out of the land of Egypt.

verses.ar_he: לֵילֵי נְטִּיר הוּא קֳדָם יְיָ לְאַפָּקוּתְהוֹן מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם הוּא לֵילְיָא הָדֵין קֳדָם יְיָ נְטִירִין לְכָל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְדָרֵיהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: This was a night of vigil for [before] Adonoy, to bring them out of the land of Egypt. This night remains a night of vigil to [before] Adonoy for all the B’nei Yisrael for [all] their generations.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה וּלְאַהֲרֹן דָא גְזֵירַת פִּסְחָא כָּל בַּר יִשְׂרָאֵל דְיִשְׁתַּמַד לָא יֵכוּל בֵּהּ:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe and Aharon, “This is the statute of the Pesach offering: No alien [Jew who renounces his religion] may eat it.

verses.ar_he: וְכָל עָבֵד גְבַר זְבִינֵי כַסְפָּא וְתִגְזַר יָתֵהּ בְּכֵן יֵכוּל בֵּהּ:
verses.ar_en: However each man’s slave [if he was]purchased with money, you must circumcise him and then he may eat it.

verses.ar_he: תּוֹתָבָא וַאֲגִירָא לָא יֵכוּל בֵּהּ:
verses.ar_en: An [alien] sojourner or hired worker may not eat it.

verses.ar_he: בַּחֲבוּרָא חֲדָא יִתְאָכֵל לָא תַפֵּיק מִן בֵּיתָא מִן בִּסְרָא לְבָרָא וְגַרְמָא לָא תִתְבְּרוּן בֵּהּ:
verses.ar_en: It must be eaten in one house [group]. You must not remove from the house any of its flesh, to the outdoors, and you must not break any of its bones.

verses.ar_he: כָּל כְּנִשְׁתָּא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל יַעְבְדוּן יָתֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: The entire community of Yisrael must make this [offering].

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי יִתְגַיַר עִמָךְ גִיוֹרָא וְיַעְבֵּד פִּסְחָא קֳדָם יְיָ מִגְזַר לֵהּ כָּל דְכוּרָא וּבְכֵן יִקְרַב לְמֶעְבְּדֵהּ וִיהֵי כְּיַצִיבָא דְאַרְעָא וְכָל עַרְלָא לָא יֵכוּל בֵּהּ:
verses.ar_en: When a proselyte dwells with you and wants to make the Pesach-offering to [before] Adonoy, every male must be circumcised. He may then come near [join] to make it, and be like the native born. But no uncircumcised male may eat of it.

verses.ar_he: אוֹרַיְתָא חֲדָא יְהֵא לְיַצִיבָא וּלְגִיוֹרָא דְיִתְגַיְרוּן בֵּינֵיכוֹן:
verses.ar_en: There shall be one law for the native born and for the proselyte who dwells among you.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבָדוּ כָּל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָת משֶׁה וְיָת אַהֲרֹן כֵּן עֲבָדוּ:
verses.ar_en: All the B’nei Yisrael did as Adonoy commanded Moshe and Aharon. They [Moshe and Aharon] also did so.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה בִּכְרַן יוֹמָא הָדֵין אַפֵּיק יְיָ יָת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם עַל חֵילֵיהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: On that very day, Adonoy took the B’nei Yisrael out of Egypt in their multitudes.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלֵיל יְיָ עִם משֶׁה לְמֵימָר:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying,

verses.ar_he: אַקְדֵשׁ קֳדָמַי כָּל בּוּכְרָא פָּתַח כָּל וַלְדָא בִּבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בֶּאֱנָשָׁא וּבִבְעִירָא דִילִי הוּא:
verses.ar_en: “Sanctify to [before] Me all the first-born, that [is the first to] open the womb among the B’nei Yisrael, both of man and beast, it is Mine.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר משֶׁה לְעַמָא הֲווֹ דְכִירִין יָת יוֹמָא הָדֵין דִי נְפַקְתּוּן מִמִצְרַיִם מִבֵּית עַבְדוּתָא אֲרֵי בִּתְקוֹף יְדָא אַפֵּיק יְיָ יָתְכוֹן מִכָּא וְלָא יִתְאֲכֵל חֲמִיעַ:
verses.ar_en: Moshe said to the people, “Remember this day [as the day] on which you came out of Egypt, from the house of slavery, for with a strong hand Adonoy brought you out from this. You must not eat chametz.

verses.ar_he: יוֹמָא דֵין אַתּוּן נָפְקִין בְּיַרְחָא דְאַבִּיבָא:
verses.ar_en: On this day you went out, in the month of Aviv [Nissan].

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי אֲרֵי יָעֵלִנָךְ יְיָ לְאַרְעָא דִכְנַעֲנָאֵי וְחִתָּאֵי וֶאֱמוֹרָאֵי וְחִוָאֵי וִיבוּסָאֵי דִי קַיִים לַאֲבָהָתָךְ לְמִתַּן לָךְ אַרְעָא עַבְדָא חֲלָב וּדְבָשׁ וְתִפְלַח יָת פָּלְחָנָא הָדָא בְּיַרְחָא הָדֵין:
verses.ar_en: When Adonoy brings you to the land of the Canaanite, the Chittites, the Emorites, the Chivites and the Yevusites, which He swore to your fathers [that He would] give to you—a land flowing with [producing] milk and honey—you must conduct this service in this month.

verses.ar_he: שִׁבְעָה יוֹמִין תֵּיכוּל פַּטִירָא וּבְיוֹמָא שְׁבִיעָאָה חַגָא קֳדָם יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: For seven days you must eat matzos [the matzoh], and the seventh day is a festival to Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: פַּטִיר יִתְאֲכֵל יָת שִׁבְעַת יוֹמִין וְלָא יִתְחֲזֵי לָךְ חֲמִיעַ וְלָא יִתְחֲזֵי לָךְ חֲמִיר בְּכָל תְּחוּמָךְ:
verses.ar_en: Matzos [Matzoh] must be eaten these seven days. No chametz may be seen in your possession, and no leaven may be seen in all your boundaries.

verses.ar_he: וּתְחַוֵי לִבְנָךְ בְּיוֹמָא הַהוּא לְמֵימָר בְּדִיל דֵין עֲבַד יְיָ לִי בְּמִפְּקִי מִמִצְרָיִם:
verses.ar_en: You must tell your son [child] on that day saying, ‘Because of this, Adonoy did [this] for me when I came out of Egypt.’

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי לָךְ לְאָת עַל יְדָךְ וּלְדָכְרָנָא בֵּין עֵינָיךְ בְּדִיל תְּהֵי אוֹרַיְתָא דַיְיָ בְּפוּמָךְ אֲרֵי בִּידָא תַקִיפָא אַפְּקָךְ יְיָ מִמִצְרָיִם:
verses.ar_en: It shall be to you as a sign on your hand, and for a reminder between your eyes, so that Adonoy’s teachings will be in your mouth, for with a strong hand Adonoy brought you out of Egypt.

verses.ar_he: וְתִטַּר יָת קְיָמָא הָדָא לְזִמְנַהּ מִזְמַן לִזְמָן:
verses.ar_en: You must preserve this statute in its appointed time, from year to year.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי אֲרֵי יָעֵלִנָךְ יְיָ לְאַרְעָא דִכְנַעֲנָאֵי כְּמָא דִי קַיִים לָךְ וְלַאֲבָהָתָךְ וְיִתְּנִנַהּ לָךְ:
verses.ar_en: When Adonoy brings you to the land of the Canaanites as He swore to you and to your fathers; and He will have given it to you.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבַּר כָּל פָּתַח וַלְדָא קֳדָם יְיָ וְכָל פָּתַח וְלַד בְּעִירָא דִי יְהֵי לָךְ דִכְרִין תַּקְדֵשׁ קֳדָם יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: [At that time] you must pass on, [set aside] every one that [is first to] open the womb, to [before] Adonoy. Every firstling that is dropped [born] by animals that belong to you, the males shall belong to [be consecrated before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְכָל פָּתַח (בּוּכְרָא) דַחֲמָרָא תִּפְרוֹק בְּאִמְרָא וְאִם לָא תִפְרוֹק וְתִנְקְפֵהּ וְכָל בּוּכְרָא דַאֲנָשָׁא בִּבְנָיךְ תִּפְרוֹק:
verses.ar_en: Redeem each firstling donkey with a sheep. If it is not redeemed, you must break its neck. Redeem every first-born male among your sons.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי אֲרֵי יִשְׁאֲלִנָךְ בְּנָךְ מְחָר לְמֵימַר מָא דָא וְתֵימַר לֵהּ בִּתְקוֹף יְדָא אַפְּקָנָא יְיָ מִמִצְרַיִם מִבֵּית עַבְדוּתָא:
verses.ar_en: When your son asks you at a later time saying ‘What is this?’ You should say to him, “With a strong hand Adonoy brought us out of Egypt from the house of slavery.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה אֲרֵי אַקְשֵׁי פַרְעֹה לְשַׁלָחוּתָנָא וּקְטַל יְיָ כָּל בּוּכְרָא בְּאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם מִבּוּכְרָא דַאֲנָשָׁא וְעַד בּוּכְרָא דִבְעִירָא עַל כֵּן אֲנָא דָבַח קֳדָם יְיָ כָּל פָּתַח וַלְדָא דִכְרִין וְכָל בּוּכְרָא דִבְנַי אֶפְרוֹק:
verses.ar_en: When Pharaoh stubbornly refused to send us out, Adonoy killed every first-born in the land of Egypt, from the first-born of man to the first-born of beast. I am therefore sacrificing to [before] Adonoy all that [is first to] open the womb which are male, and the first-born of my sons I redeem.’

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי לְאָת עַל יְדָךְ וְלִתְפִלִין בֵּין עֵינָיךְ אֲרֵי בִּתְקוֹף יְדָא אַפְּקָנָא יְיָ מִמִצְרָיִם: ססס:
verses.ar_en: [These words] shall be a sign on your hand and for totafos [phylacteries] between your eyes, for with a strong hand Adonoy brought us out of Egypt.”

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה כַּד שַׁלַח פַּרְעֹה יָת עַמָא וְלָא דַבָּרִינוּן יְיָ אֹרַח אַרְעָא פְלִשְׁתָּאֵי אֲרֵי קָרִיבָא הוּא אֲרֵי אֲמַר יְיָ דִילְמָא יְזוּעוּן עַמָא בְּמֶחֱזֵיהוֹן קְרָבָא וִיתוּבוּן לְמִצְרָיִם:
verses.ar_en: When Pharaoh sent away the people Elohim did not lead them by way of the land of the Philistines because it was the shortest route; for Elohim said, “The people might change their minds [tremble ] should they encounter war, and return to Egypt.

verses.ar_he: וְאַסְחַר יְיָ יָת עַמָא אֹרַח מַדְבְּרָא יַמָא דְסוּף וּמְזָרְזִין סְלִיקוּ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרָיִם:
verses.ar_en: And so Elohim led the people round-about by way of the Reed Sea Desert, and the B’nei Yisrael went up armed from the land of Egypt.

verses.ar_he: וְאַסִיק משֶׁה יָת גַרְמֵי יוֹסֵף עִמֵהּ אֲרֵי אוֹמָאָה אוֹמִי יָת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמֵימָר מִדְכַּר דְכִיר יְיָ יָתְכוֹן וְתַסְקוּן יָת גַרְמַי מִכָּא עִמְכוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Moshe took [carried up] the bones of Yoseif with him, for [Yoseif] had bound the B’nei Yisrael by oath saying, “Elohim will surely remember you, and [then] you must carry up my bones out of here with you.

verses.ar_he: וּנְטָלוּ מִסֻכּוֹת וּשְׁרוֹ בְאֵתָם בִּסְטַר מַדְבְּרָא:
verses.ar_en: They journeyed from Sukkos and camped at Eisom at the edge of the desert.

verses.ar_he: וַיְיָ מְדַבַּר קָדָמֵיהוֹן בִּימָמָא בְּעַמוּדָא דַעֲנָנָא לְדַבָּרוּתְהוֹן בְּאוֹרְחָא וְלֵילְיָא בְּעַמוּדָא דְאֶשָׁתָא לְאַנְהָרָא לְהוֹן לְמֵיזַל בִּימָמָא וּבְלֵילְיָא:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy went before them by day in a pillar of cloud to lead them on the way, and at night in a pillar of fire to provide them with light, so that they could travel by day and by night.

verses.ar_he: לָא יַעֲדֵי עַמוּדָא דַעֲנָנָא בִּימָמָא וְאַף לָא עַמוּדָא דְאֶשָׁתָא בְּלֵילְיָא קֳדָם עַמָא:
verses.ar_en: He did not remove the pillar of cloud by day, or [even] the pillar of fire at night, from before the people.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלֵיל יְיָ עִם משֶׁה לְמֵימָר:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe saying:

verses.ar_he: מַלֵיל עִם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וִיתוּבּוּן וְיִשְׁרוּן קֳדָם פּוּם חִירָתָא בֵּין מִגְדוֹל וּבֵין יַמָא קֳדָם בְּעֵיל צְפוֹן לְקִבְלֵהּ תִּשְׁרוּן עַל יַמָא:
verses.ar_en: “Speak to the B’nei Yisrael and have them turn back and camp before Pi haChiros, between Migdol and the sea, facing Ba’al Tzephon. Camp opposite it, near the sea.”

verses.ar_he: וְיֵימַר פַּרְעֹה עַל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מְעַרְבְּלִין אִנוּן בְּאַרְעָא אֲחַד עֲלֵיהוֹן מַדְבְּרָא:
verses.ar_en: Pharaoh will then say of the B’nei Yisrael, “They are confused in the land, the desert has shut [trapped] them in.

verses.ar_he: וְאַתְקֵף יָת לִבָּא דְפַרְעֹה וְיִרְדַף בַּתְרֵיהוֹן וְאֶתְיַקַר בְּפַרְעֹה וּבְכָל מַשִׁרְיָתֵהּ וְיִדְעוּן מִצְרָאֵי אֲרֵי אֲנָא יְיָ וַעֲבָדוּ כֵן:
verses.ar_en: I will harden Pharaoh’s heart and he will pursue them. and I will be glorified through Pharaoh and his entire army. Egypt will [then] know that I am Adonoy.” They [the B’nei Yisrael] did just that.

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְחַוָא לְמַלְכָּא דְמִצְרַיִם אֲרֵי אֲזַל עַמָא וְאִתְהֲפִיךְ לִבָּא דְפַרְעֹה וְעַבְדוֹהִי לְעַמָא וַאֲמָרוּ מָא דָא עֲבַדְנָא אֲרֵי שַׁלַחְנָא יָת יִשְׂרָאֵל מִפָּלְחָנָנָא:
verses.ar_en: The king of Egypt was told that the people had fled [gone]. Pharaoh and his servants had a change of heart regarding the people, and they said, “What have we done? [How did] we release Israel from serving us?

verses.ar_he: וְטַקִיס יָת רְתִכֵּהּ וְיָת עַמֵהּ דַבַּר עִמֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: He [Pharaoh] harnessed his chariot and he took his people with him.

verses.ar_he: וּדְבַר שִׁתְּ מְאָה רְתִכִּין בְּחִירָן וְכֹל רְתִכֵּי מִצְרָאֵי וְגִבָּרִין מְמַנָן עַל כֻּלְהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: He took six hundred elite chariots [and crews], and all the [other] chariots of Egypt, and commanders [mighty men were appointed] over all of them.

verses.ar_he: וְתַקִיף יְיָ יָת לִבָּא דְפַרְעֹה מַלְכָּא דְמִצְרַיִם וּרְדַף בָּתַר בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וּבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל נְפָקוּ בְּרֵישׁ גְלִי:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy hardened the heart of Pharaoh, king of Egypt, and he pursued the B’nei Yisrael. The B’nei Yisrael went out high handedly [in triumph] [publicly].

verses.ar_he: וּרְדָפוּ מִצְרָאֵי בַּתְרֵיהוֹן וְאַדְבִּיקוּ יָתְהוֹן כַּד שָׁרָן עַל יַמָא כָּל סוּסָוַת רְתִכֵּי פַרְעֹה וּפָרָשׁוֹהִי וּמַשִׁרְיָתֵהּ עַל פּוּם חִירָתָא קֳדָם בְּעֵיל צְפוֹן:
verses.ar_en: The Egyptians pursued them and overtook them as they were encamped by the sea. There were all Pharaoh’s chariot horses, his cavalry and his army [infantry], at Pi haChiros, facing Ba’al Tzephon.

verses.ar_he: וּפַרְעֹה קְרֵיב וּזְקָפוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל יָת עֵינֵיהוֹן וְהָא מִצְרָאֵי נַטְלִין בַּתְרֵיהוֹן וּדְחִילוּ לַחֲדָא וּזְעִיקוּ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל קֳדָם יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: Pharaoh drew near, and the B’nei Yisrael looked up, and beheld the Egyptians coming after them. They were very frightened, and the B’nei Yisrael cried out to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמָרוּ לְמשֶׁה הֲמִדְלֵית קְבָרִין בְּמִצְרַיִם דְבַרְתָּנָא לִמְמַת בְּמַדְבְּרָא מָא דָא עֲבַדְתָּא לָנָא לְאַפָּקוּתָנָא מִמִצְרָיִם:
verses.ar_en: They said to Moshe, “Were there not enough graves in Egypt that you took us out to die in the desert? What have you done to us, bringing us out of Egypt?

verses.ar_he: הֲלָא דֵין פִּתְגָמָא דִי מַלֵלְנָא עִמָךְ בְמִצְרַיִם לְמֵימַר שְׁבוֹק מִנָנָא וְנִפְלַח יָת מִצְרָאֵי אֲרֵי טַב לָנָא דְנִפְלַח יָת מִצְרָאֵי מִדִנְמוּת בְּמַדְבְּרָא:
verses.ar_en: This is the [exact] thing that we told you in Egypt saying, ‘Leave us alone and let us serve the Egyptians.’ It would have been better for us to serve the Egyptians than we should die in the desert.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר משֶׁה לְעַמָא לָא תִדְחֲלוּן אִתְעַתָּדוּ וַחֲזוֹ יָת פּוּרְקָנָא דַיְיָ דְיַעְבֵּד לְכוֹן יוֹמָא דֵין אֲרֵי כְּמָא דִחֲזֵיתוּן יַת מִצְרָאֵי יוֹמָא דֵין לָא תוֹסְפוּן לְמֶחֱזֵיהוֹן עוֹד עַד עָלְמָא:
verses.ar_en: Moshe said to the people, “Do not be afraid, stand firm and you will see the deliverance of Adonoy, which He will perform for you this day, for the Egyptians you have seen this day you will never again see them, even to eternity.

verses.ar_he: יְיָ יְגִיחַ לְכוֹן קְרָב וְאַתּוּן תִּשְׁתְּקוּן:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy will fight [the war] for you, and you [must] remain silent.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה קַבֵּלִית צְלוֹתָךְ מַלֵיל עִם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְיִטְלוּן:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe, “Why do you cry to Me? [I have accepted your prayer.] Speak to the B’nei Yisrael and let them move on.

verses.ar_he: וְאַתְּ טוֹל יָת חֻטְרָךְ וַאֲרֵים יָת יְדָךְ עַל יַמָא וּבְזָעוֹהִי וְיֵעֲלוּן בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּגוֹ יַמָא בְּיַבֶּשְׁתָּא:
verses.ar_en: And you [do as follows], raise your staff and extend your hand over the sea and split it. The B’nei Yisrael will then come [across] in the midst of the sea on dry land.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲנָא הָא אֲנָא מְתַקֵף יָת לִבָּא דְמִצְרָאֵי וְיֵעֲלוּן בַּתְרֵיהוֹן וְאֶתְיַקַר בְּפַרְעֹה וּבְכָל מַשִׁרְיָתֵהּ בִּרְתִכּוֹהִי וּבְפָרָשׁוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: I will harden the heart of the Egyptians and they will follow after them. I will be glorified through Pharaoh and his entire army, his chariots and his cavalry.

verses.ar_he: וְיִדְּעוּן מִצְרָאֵי אֲרֵי אֲנָא יְיָ בְּאִתְיַקָרוּתִי בְּפַרְעֹה בִּרְתִכּוֹהִי וּבְפָרָשׁוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: The Egyptians will know that I am Adonoy when I am glorified through Pharaoh, his chariots and cavalry.

verses.ar_he: וּנְטַל מַלְאֲכָא דַיְיָ דִמְדַבַּר קֳדָם מַשְׁרִיתָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל וַאֲתָא מִבַּתְרֵיהוֹן וּנְטַל עַמּוּדָא דַעֲנָנָא מִן קֳדָמֵיהוֹן וּשְׁרָא מִבַּתְרֵיהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: The angel of Elohim moved [from its position] when it traveled in front of the camp of Israel, and went behind them. The pillar of cloud moved from in front of them and it stood behind them.

verses.ar_he: וְעַל בֵּין מַשְׁרִיתָא דְמִצְרָאֵי וּבֵין מַשְׁרִיתָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל וַהֲוָה עֲנָנָא וְקַבְלָא לְמִצְרָאֵי וּלְיִשְׂרָאֵל נְהַר כָּל לֵילְיָא וְלָא אִתְקְרִיבוּ דֵין לְוָת דֵין כָּל לֵילְיָא:
verses.ar_en: It came between the Egyptian camp and the camp of Yisrael. There was the cloud and darkness [for the Egyptians] and [the pillar of fire] lit up the night [for Yisrael]. The camps did not approach each other all that night.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵים משֶׁה יָת יְדֵהּ עַל יַמָּא וְדַבַּר יְיָ יָת יַמָּא בְּרוּחַ קִדוּמָא תַקִיף כָּל לֵילְיָא וְשַׁוִי יָת יַמָּא לְיַבֶּשְׁתָּא וְאִתְבְּזָעוּ מַיָּא:
verses.ar_en: Moshe extended his hand over the sea and Adonoy turned back the sea with a strong east wind [blowing] all through the night. He made the sea into dry land, and the waters were divided.

verses.ar_he: וְעַלוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּגוֹ יַמָא בְּיַבֶּשְׁתָּא וּמַיָּא לְהוֹן שׁוּרִין מִיַּמִינֵהוֹן וּמִסְמָאלֵהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: The B’nei Yisrael went into the midst of the sea on dry land. The waters were like a wall [walls] to them, to their right and to their left.

verses.ar_he: וּרְדָפוּ מִצְרָאֵי וְעַלוּ בַתְרֵיהוֹן כֹּל סוּסָוַת פַּרְעֹה רְתִכּוֹהִי וּפָרָשׁוֹהִי לְגוֹ יַמָא:
verses.ar_en: The Egyptians pursued and followed them—all of Pharaoh’s horses, his chariots and his cavalry—into the middle of the sea.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה בְּמַטְרַת צַפְרָא וְאִסְתְּכֵי יְיָ לְמַשְׁרִיתָא דְמִצְרָאֵי בְּעַמוּדָא דְאֶשָׁתָא וַעֲנָנָא וְשַׁגִישׁ יָת מַשְׁרִיתָא דְמִצְרָאֵי:
verses.ar_en: It was the morning watch [the end of the night] Adonoy gazed down at the Egyptians camp through the pillar of fire and cloud, and He caused panic in the Egyptian camp.

verses.ar_he: וְאַעְדִי יָת גַלְגַלֵי רְתִכּוֹהִי וּמְדַבְּרִין לְהוֹן בִּתְקוֹף וַאֲמַר מִצְרָאֵי נֵעִירוֹק מִן קֳדָם יִשְׂרָאֵל אֲרֵי דָא הִיא גְבֻרְתָּא דַיְיָ דַעֲבֵד לְהוֹן קְרָבִין בְּמִצְרָיִם:
verses.ar_en: He removed the wheels of their chariots and made them move heavily [clumsily]. The Egyptians said, “Let us flee the [B’nei] Yisrael, for [this is the might of] Adonoy [that] is fighting [wars] for them against Egypt.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה אֲרֵים יָת יְדָךְ עַל יַמָא וִיתוּבוּן מַיָא עַל מִצְרָאֵי עַל רְתִכֵּיהוֹן וְעַל פָּרָשֵׁיהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe, “Extend your hand over the sea, and the water will come back over the Egyptians, [over] their chariots and their cavalry.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵים משֶׁה יָת יְדֵהּ עַל יַמָא וְתָב יַמָא לְעִדַן צַפְרָא לְתָקְפֵּהּ וּמִצְרָאֵי עָרְקִין לְקַדָמוּתֵהּ וְשַׁנִיק יְיָ יָת מִצְרָאֵי בְּגוֹ יַמָא:
verses.ar_en: Moshe extended his hand over the sea, and, toward morning, the sea returned to its strength while the Egyptians were fleeing toward it. Adonoy overturned [stirred] the Egyptians in the midst of the sea.

verses.ar_he: וְתָבוּ מַיָא וַחֲפוֹ יָת רְתִכַּיָא וְיָת פָּרָשַׁיָא לְכֹל מַשִׁרְיַת פַּרְעֹה דְעַלוּ בַתְרֵיהוֹן בְּיַמָא לָא אִשְׁתָּאַר בְּהוֹן עַד חָד:
verses.ar_en: The waters returned and covered the chariots, and the cavalry, including Pharaoh’s entire army which had followed them into the sea. Not one of them remained [alive].

verses.ar_he: וּבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל הַלִיכוּ בְיַבֶּשְׁתָּא בְּגוֹ יַמָא וּמַיָא לְהוֹן שׁוּרִין מִיַמִינֵהוֹן וּמִסְמָאלֵהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: The B’nei Yisrael walked on dry land in the midst of the sea. For them the waters were a wall [walls] to their right and to their left.

verses.ar_he: וּפְרַק יְיָ בְּיוֹמָא הַהוּא יָת יִשְׂרָאֵל מִידָא דְמִצְרָאֵי וַחֲזוֹ יִשְׂרָאֵל יָת מִצְרָאֵי מַיְתִין עַל כֵּיף יַמָא:
verses.ar_en: On that day Adonoy delivered [B’nei] Yisrael from the hand of Egypt. [B’nei] Yisrael saw the Egyptians dead on the seashore.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזָא יִשְׂרָאֵל יָת גְבוּרְתָּא יְדָא רַבְּתָא דִי עֲבַד יְיָ בְּמִצְרַיִם וּדְחִילוּ עַמָא מִן קֳדָם יְיָ וְהֵמִינוּ בְּמֵימְרָא דַיְיָ וּבִנְבִיאוּת משֶׁה עַבְדֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: [B’nei] Yisrael saw the [might of the] great hand which Adonoy wielded against Egypt. The people feared [from before] Adonoy, and believed in [the Word of] Adonoy and [that] [in the prophecy of] Moshe [was] His servant.

verses.ar_he: בְּכֵן שַׁבַּח משֶׁה וּבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל יָת תִּשְׁבַּחְתָּא הָדָא קֳדָם יְיָ וַאֲמָרוּ לְמֵימָר נְשַׁבַּח וְנוֹדֶה קָדָם יְיָ אֲרֵי אִתְגָאֵי עַל גֵוְתָנַיָא וְגֵאוּתָא דִילֵהּ הִיא סוּסְיָא וְרָכְבֵהּ רְמָא בְיַמָא:
verses.ar_en: Then Moshe and the B’nei Yisrael sang this song to [exalted this praise before] Adonoy and they said, I [We] will sing to [praise and we will give thanks before] Adonoy for He is most high [exalted Himself above those who are exalted, and exaltation is His], horse and its rider He threw into the sea.

verses.ar_he: תָּקְפִּי וְתִשְׁבַּחְתִּי דְחִילָא יְיָ וַאֲמַר בְּמֵימְרֵהּ וַהֲוָה לִי לְפָרָק דֵין אֱלָהַי וְאֶבְנֵי לֵהּ מַקְדְשָׁא אֱלָהָא דַאֲבָהָתַי וְאֶפְלַח קֳדָמוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: The strength and retribution [The awesomeness] of God [is my strength and my praise] was the cause of my deliverance. [He said with His Word and He has been a savior for me.] This is my Almighty and I will glorify [build a Temple for] Him; the God of my father and I will exalt [worship before] Him.

verses.ar_he: יְיָ מָרֵי נִצְחָן קְרָבַיָא יְיָ שְׁמֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy is the master of [victory of] war[s], Adonoy is His Name.

verses.ar_he: רְתִכֵּי פַּרְעֹה וּמַשִׁרְיָתֵהּ שְׁדִי בְיַמָא וּשְׁפַר גִבָּרוֹהִי אִטְבָּעוּ בְּיַמָא דְסוּף:
verses.ar_en: Pharaoh’s chariots and army He hurled into the sea; his elite officers were sunk in the Reed Sea.

verses.ar_he: תְּהוֹמַיָא חֲפוֹ עֲלֵיהוֹן נְחָתוּ לְעוּמְקַיָא כְּאַבְנָא:
verses.ar_en: The depths covered them, they sank into the shadowy depths like stone.

verses.ar_he: יַמִינָךְ יְיָ אַדִיר בְּחֵילָא יַמִינָךְ יְיָ תְּבָּרַת סָנְאָה:
verses.ar_en: Your right hand Adonoy, is adorned with power, Your right hand Adonoy, crushes the enemy.

verses.ar_he: וּבִסְגֵי תָקְפָּךְ תְּבַרְתָּנוּן לִדְקָמוּ עַל עַמָךְ שַׁלַחְתָּ רוּגְזָךְ שֵׁיצִנוּן כְּנוּרָא לְקַשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: In Your great majesty [might], You destroy [crush] Your opponents [those who rise up against Your people]; You send forth Your fury, it consumes them like [fire consumes] straw.

verses.ar_he: וּבְמֵימַר פּוּמָךְ חַכִּימוּ מַיָא קָמוּ כְשׁוּר אֲזָלַיָא קָפוּ תְהוֹמִין בְּלִבָּא דְיַמָא:
verses.ar_en: Through the wind [breath] of Your nostrils [Word of Your mouth], the waters were heaped up [became wise], flowing water stood like a wall; the deep waters congealed in the heart of the sea.

verses.ar_he: דַהֲוָה אֲמַר סָנְאָה אֶרְדוֹף אַדְבֵּק אֲפַלֵג בִּזְתָא תִּשְׂבַּע מִנְהוֹן נַפְשִׁי אֶשְׁלוֹף חַרְבִּי תְּשֵׁיצִינוּן יְדִי:
verses.ar_en: The enemy [had] said, “I will pursue [them], I will overtake [them], I will divide the spoils, I will satisfy myself [My soul will be satisfied from them]; I will draw my sword, my hand will destroy them.”

verses.ar_he: אֲמַרְתָּ בְּמֵימְרָךְ חֲפָא עֲלֵיהוֹן יַמָא אִשְׁתְּקָעוּ כַּאֲבָרָא בְּמַיִן תַּקִיפִין:
verses.ar_en: You made Your wind blow [said with Your Word], the sea covered them; they sank like lead in the mighty waters.

verses.ar_he: לֵית בַּר מִנָךְ דְאַתְּ הוּא אֱלָהָא יְיָ לֵית בַּר מִנָךְ אֱלָהָא אַתְּ אַדִיר בְּקוּדְשָׁא דָחֵל תֻּשְׁבְּחָן עָבֵד פָּרִישָׁן:
verses.ar_en: Who is like You among the mighty, Adonoy! Who is like You, adorned in holiness, Awesome in praise, doing wonders? [There is none besides You, for You are God, Adonoy! There is none besides You, O God, You are adorned in holiness, Awesome in praise, doing wonders!]

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵמְתָּ יַמִינָךְ בְּלַעְתְּנוּן אַרְעָא:
verses.ar_en: You extended Your right hand, the earth swallowed them.

verses.ar_he: דַבַּרְהִי בְטַבְוָתָךְ עַמָא דְנַן דִפְרָקְתָּ סוֹבַרְהִי בְתָקְפָּךְ לְדִירָא דְקֻדְשָׁךְ:
verses.ar_en: In Your kindliness [goodness] You led the people [who] You redeemed; with Your might You guided [carried] them to Your holy dwelling place.

verses.ar_he: שְׁמָעוּ עַמְמַיָא וְזָעוּ דַחֲלָא אַחֲדָתְנוּן דַהֲווֹ יָתְבִין בִּפְלָשֶׁת:
verses.ar_en: Peoples heard and they tremble, terror gripped the inhabitants of [those who inhabited] Philistia.

verses.ar_he: בְּכֵן אִתְבְּהִילוּ רַבְרְבֵי אֱדוֹם תַּקִיפֵי מוֹאָב אֲחַדָתְנוּן רְתֵיתָא אִתְבָּרוּ כֹּל דַהֲווֹ יָתְבִין בִּכְנָעַן:
verses.ar_en: Then the chiefs of Edom panicked, the mighty men of Moav were seized with trembling; all the inhabitants of [those who inhabited] Canaan melted away [were crushed].

verses.ar_he: תַּפִּיל עֲלֵיהוֹן אֵימְתָא וְדַחַלְתָּא בִּסְגֵי תָקְפָּךְ יִשְׁתְּקוּן כְּאַבְנָא עַד דְיֵעִבַּר עַמָךְ יְיָ יָת אַרְנוֹנָא עַד דְיֵעִבַּר עַמָא דְנַן דִי פְרַקְתָּא יָת יַרְדְנָא:
verses.ar_en: Horror and dread [will] fall upon them, at the greatness of Your arm [power], they [will be] are still [silent] as stone; until Your people [will] cross over [the stream of Arnon], Adonoy, until Your [this] people [who] You acquired [redeemed will] cross over [the Jordan].

verses.ar_he: תָּעֵלִנוּן וְתַשְׁרִינוּן בְּטוּרָא דְאַחְסַנְתָּךְ אֲתַר מְתַקֵן לְבֵית שְׁכִנְתָּךְ אַתְקֵנְתָּא יְיָ מַקְדְשָׁא יְיָ אַתְקְנוֹהִי יְדָיךְ:
verses.ar_en: You will bring them and plant them [cause them to dwell] on the mountain of Your inheritance, the place [prepared] for [the house of] Your habitation [Shechina], which You, Adonoy have made [established]; the Sanctuary—my Master—[which] Your hands established.

verses.ar_he: יְיָ מַלְכוּתֵהּ קָאֵם לְעָלַם וּלְעָלְמֵי עָלְמַיָא:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy will reign[, His kingdom is established] forever and ever.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי עַלוּ סוּסָוַת פַּרְעֹה בִּרְתִכּוֹהִי וּבְפָרָשׁוֹהִי בְּיַמָא וַאֲתֵיב יְיָ עֲלֵיהוֹן יָת מֵי יַמָא וּבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל הַלִיכוּ בְיַבֶּשְׁתָּא בְּגוֹ יַמָא:
verses.ar_en: When Pharaoh came with his horse and chariot and his cavalry into the sea, Adonoy returned the waters of the sea on them; and the B’nei Yisrael walked on dry land in the midst of the sea.

verses.ar_he: וּנְסֵיבַת מִרְיָם נְבִיאֲתָא אֲחָתֵהּ דְאַהֲרֹן יָת תֻּפָּא בִּידַהּ וּנְפָקוּ כָל נְשַׁיָא בַּתְרָהָא בְּתֻפִּין וּבְחִנְגִין:
verses.ar_en: Miriam the prophetess, sister of Aharon, took the drum in her hand; and all the women followed her with drums and dancing.

verses.ar_he: וּמְעַנְיָא לְהוֹן מִרְיָם שַׁבָּחוּ וְאוֹדוּ קֳדָם יְיָ אֲרֵי אִתְגָאֵי עַל גֵוְתָנַיָא וְגֵאוּתָא דִילֵהּ הִיא סוּסְיָא וְרָכְבֵהּ רְמָא בְיַמָא:
verses.ar_en: Miriam led them in the response: “Sing to [Praise and give thanks before] Adonoy for He is most high [exalted Himself above those who are exalted, and exaltation is His]; horse and its rider He hurled into the sea.”

verses.ar_he: וְאַטֵּל משֶׁה יָת יִשְׂרָאֵל מִיַמָא דְסוּף וּנְפָקוּ לְמַדְבְּרָא דְחַגְרָא וַאֲזָלוּ תְלָתָא יוֹמִין בְּמַדְבְּרָא וְלָא אַשְׁכָּחוּ מַיָא:
verses.ar_en: Moshe led [B’nei] Yisrael away from the Reed Sea, and they went out into the desert of Shur [Cheger], they traveled for three days in the desert and they did not find any water.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתוֹ לְמָרָה וְלָא יְכִילוּ לְמִשְׁתֵּי מַיָא מִמָרָה אֲרֵי מְרִירִין אִנוּן עַל כֵּן קְרָא שְׁמַהּ מָרָה:
verses.ar_en: They came to Marah but they could not drink the water of Marah because it was bitter. The place was therefore called Marah [bitter].

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְרָעָמוּ עַמָא עַל משֶׁה לְמֵימַר מָה נִשְׁתֵּי:
verses.ar_en: The people complained to Moshe saying, “What shall we drink?”

verses.ar_he: וְצַלִי קֳדָם יְיָ וְאַלְפֵהּ יְיָ אָעָא וּרְמָא לְמַיָא וּבַסִימוּ מַיָא תַּמָן גְזַר לֵהּ קְיָם וְדִין וְתַמָן נַסְיֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: He [Moshe] cried out to [prayed before] Adonoy, Adonoy showed him [instructed him concerning] a tree and he threw it into the water, and the water became sweet [pleasing]. There He set before [established for] them statutes and ordinances, and there He tested them.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר אִם קַבָּלָא תְקַבֵּל לְמֵימְרָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ וּדְכָשַׁר קֳדָמוֹהִי תַעְבֵּד וְתַצֵית לִפִקוּדוֹהִי וְתִטַר כָּל קְיָמוֹהִי כָּל מַרְעִין דִי שַׁוֵיתִי בְמִצְרַיִם לָא אֲשַׁוִנוּן עֲלָךְ אֲרֵי אֲנָא יְיָ אַסָךְ:
verses.ar_en: He said [to them,] “If you vigilantly obey the voice [Word] of Adonoy, your God, and do what is upright in His eyes [before Him], give ear to His commandments, and preserve all His statutes; [then], every sickness that I brought upon Egypt, I will not bring upon you, for I am Adonoy, Who heals you.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתוֹ לְאֵילִם וְתַמָן תְּרֵי עֲסַר מַבּוּעִין דְמַיִן וְשִׁבְעִין דִקְלִין וּשְׁרוֹ תַמָן עַל מַיָא:
verses.ar_en: Then they came to Eilim, where there were twelve springs of water and seventy date palms. and they camped the by the water.

verses.ar_he: וּנְטָלוּ מֵאֵילִם וַאֲתוֹ כָּל כְּנִשְׁתָּא דִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְּמַדְבְּרָא דְסִין דִי בֵין אֵילִם וּבֵין סִינָי בְּחַמְשַׁת עַסְרָא יוֹמָא לְיַרְחָא תִנְיָנָא לְמִפָּקְהוֹן מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם:
verses.ar_en: They journeyed from Eilim, and the entire community of the B’nei Yisrael came to the desert of Sin, which is between Eilim and Sinai. It was the fifteenth day of the second month after they went out of the land of Egypt.

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְרָעָמוּ כָּל כְּנִשְׁתָּא דִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל עַל משֶׁה וְעַל אַהֲרֹן בְּמַדְבְּרָא:
verses.ar_en: The entire community of the B’nei Yisrael complained against Moshe and Aharon in the desert.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמָרוּ לְהוֹן בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְוַי דְמִיתְנָא קֳדָם יְיָ בְּאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם כַּד הֲוֵינָא יָתְבִין עַל דוּדֵי בִסְרָא כַּד הֲוֵינָא אָכְלִין לַחְמָא וְשָׂבְעִין אֲרֵי אַפֶּקְתּוּן יָתָנָא לְמַדְבְּרָא הָדֵין לְקַטָּלָא יָת כָּל קְהָלָא הָדֵין בְּכַפְנָא:
verses.ar_en: The B’nei Yisrael said to them, “If only we had died by the hand of [before] Adonoy in the land of Egypt, when we sat by pots of meat and ate our fill of bread, for you have brought us out to this desert to cause this entire congregation to die of starvation.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה הָא אֲנָא מָחֵית לְכוֹן לַחְמָא מִן שְׁמַיָא וְיִפְקוּן עַמָא וְיִלְקְטוּן פִּתְגַם יוֹם בְּיוֹמֵהּ בְּדִיל דַאֲנַסִנוּן הַיְהָכוּן בְּאוֹרַיְתִי אִם לָא:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe, “Behold, I will make bread rain [come down] from heaven for you, and the people shall go out and gather enough for each day, that I may test them [to see] if they will walk in [the way of] My teaching or not.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי בְּיוֹמָא שְׁתִיתָאָה וִיתַקְנוּן יָת דְיַיְתוּן וִיהֵי עַל חַד תְּרֵין עַל דְיִלְקְטוּן יוֹם יוֹם:
verses.ar_en: On the sixth day [when] they prepare what they bring [home], it will be twice as much as they gather every [other] day.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר משֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן לְכָל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּרַמְשָׁא וְתִדְעוּן אֲרֵי יְיָ אַפֵּיק יָתְכוֹן מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרָיִם:
verses.ar_en: Moshe and Aharon said to all the B’nei Yisrael, “In the evening you will know that [it is] Adonoy [Who] brought you out from the land of Egypt.

verses.ar_he: וּבְצַפְרָא וְתֶחֱזוּן יָת יְקָרָא דַיְיָ כַּד שְׁמִיעַ (קֳדָמוֹהִי) יָת תֻּרְעֲמוּתְכוֹן עַל מֵימְרָא דַיְיָ וְנַחְנָא מָא אֲרֵי אַתְרַעַמְתּוּן עֲלָנָא:
verses.ar_en: And in the morning you will see the glory of Adonoy, for He has heard your complaints [are heard (before Him)] against [regarding the Word of] Adonoy. But what are we that you cause complaints against us?”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר משֶׁה בִּדְיִתֵּן יְיָ לְכוֹן בְּרַמְשָׁא בִּסְרָא לְמֵיכַל וְלַחְמָא בְּצַפְרָא לְמִסְבַּע בְּדִשְׁמִיעַן קֳדָם יְיָ יָת תֻּרְעֲמוּתְכוֹן דִי אַתּוּן מִתְרַעֲמִין עֲלוֹהִי וְנַחְנָא מָא לָא עֲלָנָא תֻּרְעֲמוּתְכוֹן אֶלָהֵן עַל מֵימְרָא דַיְיָ:
verses.ar_en: [Then] Moshe said, “When Adonoy gives you meat to eat in the evening, and a filling meal of bread in the morning, Adonoy will have heard your complaints [will have been heard before Adonoy], that you cause complaints against Him. What are we? Your complaints are not against us but against [the Word of] Adonoy.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר משֶׁה לְאַהֲרֹן אֱמַר לְכָל כְּנִשְׁתָּא דִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל קְרִיבוּ קֳדָם יְיָ אֲרֵי שְׁמִיעַן קֳדָמוֹהִי יָת תֻּרְעֲמוּתְכוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Then Moshe said to Aharon, “Say to the entire community of the B’nei Yisrael: Come near before Adonoy, for He has heard your complaints [have been heard before Him].”

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה כַּד מַלִיל אַהֲרֹן עִם כָּל כְּנִשְׁתָּא דִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵלּ וְאִתְפְּנִיוּ לְמַדְבְּרָא וְהָא יְקָרָא דַיְיָ אִתְגְלִי בַּעֲנָנָא:
verses.ar_en: As Aharon spoke to the entire community of the B’nei Yisrael, they turned toward to the desert, and behold the glory of Adonoy was visible [revealed] in the cloud.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלֵיל יְיָ עִם משֶׁה לְמֵימָר:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe saying,

verses.ar_he: שְׁמִיעַ קֳדָמַי יָת תֻּרְעֲמַת בְּנֵי יִשְּׂרָאֵל מַלֵיל עִמְהוֹן לְמֵימַר בֵּין שִׁמְשַׁיָא תֵּיכְלּוּן בִּסְרָא וּבְצַפְרָא תִּשְׂבְּעוּן לַחְמָא וְתִדְעוּן אֲרֵי אֲנָא יְיָ אֱלָהָכוֹן:
verses.ar_en: “I have heard the complaints of the B’nei Yisrael [have been heard before Me]. Speak to them saying, ‘Between evenings [afternoon] you will eat meat, and in the morning you will have your fill of bread, and you will know that I am Adonoy, your God.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה בְרַמְשָׁא וּסְלֵיקַת סְלָיו וַחֲפַת יָת מַשְׁרִיתָא וּבְצַפְרָא הֲוַת נְחָתַת טַלָא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר לְמַשְׁרִיתָא:
verses.ar_en: It was evening and quails rose up and covered the camp. In the morning there was a layer of dew [descended] around the camp.

verses.ar_he: וּסְלֵיקַת נְחָתַת טַלָא וְהָא עַל אַפֵּי מַדְבְּרָא דַעְדַק מְקַלַף דַעְדַק כְּגִיר כִּגְלִידָא עַל אַרְעָא:
verses.ar_en: The layer of dew [that had fallen] had risen, and behold, on the surface of the desert were thin [uncovered] [peeled away] flakes. It was as fine as [gir, like] frost on the ground.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזוֹ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וַאֲמָרוּ גְבַר לַאֲחוּהִי מַנָא הוּא אֲרֵי לָא יְדָעוּ מָא הוּא וַאֲמַר משֶׁה לְהוֹן הוּא לַחְמָא דִי יְהַב יְיָ לְכוֹן לְמֵיכַל:
verses.ar_en: The B’nei Yisrael saw it and said to one another, “It is a food,” for they did not know [exactly] what [kind] it was. Moshe said to them, “This is the bread that Adonoy is giving you to eat.

verses.ar_he: דֵין פִּתְגָמָא דִי פַקֵיד יְיָ לְקוּטוּ מִנֵהּ גְבַר לְפוּם מֵיכְלֵהּ עֻמְרָא לְגֻלְגַלְתָּא מִנְיַן נַפְשָׁתֵיכוֹן גְבַר לְדִי בְמַשְׁכְּנֵהּ תִּסְבוּן:
verses.ar_en: This is what Adonoy has commanded: Each man shall gather his requirement of food. An omer per person, according to the number of your people. shall each man take for those in his tent.”

verses.ar_he: וַעַבָדוּ כֵן בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וּלְקָטוּ דְאַסְגֵי וּדְאַזְעֵר:
verses.ar_en: The B’nei Yisrael did so. They gathered it, some more, some less.

verses.ar_he: וּכְלוֹ בְעוּמְרָא וְלָא אוֹתַר דְאַסְגֵי וּדְאַזְעֵר לָא חַסִיר גְבַר לְפוּם מֵיכְלֵהּ לְקָטוּ:
verses.ar_en: However when they measured it with an omer, the one who had taken more had no extra, and the one who had taken less, was not lacking. They had gathered exactly enough for each one to eat.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר משֶׁה לְהוֹן אֱנַשׁ לָא יַשְׁאַר מִנֵהּ עַד צַפְרָא:
verses.ar_en: Moshe said to them, “Let no man leave any over until morning.”

verses.ar_he: וְלָא קַבִּילוּ מִן משֶׁה וְאַשְׁאָרוּ גֻבְרַיָא מִנֵה עַד צַפְרָא וּרְחֵשׁ רִיחֲשָׁא וּסְרִי וּרְגַז עֲלֵיהוֹן משֶׁה:
verses.ar_en: They did not listen to [accept] Moshe, and some men left some over until morning. It became wormy and putrid, and Moshe was angry with them.

verses.ar_he: וּלְקָטוּ יָתֵהּ בִּצְפַר בִּצְפָר גְבַר לְפוּם מֵיכְלֵהּ וּמָא דְמִשְׁתָּאַר מִנֵהּ עַל אַפֵּי חַקְלָא כַּד חֲמָא עֲלוֹהִי שִׁמְשָׁא פָּשָׁר:
verses.ar_en: They gathered it each morning, each man according to what he would eat. [When] the sun became hot [on that which remained from it upon the face of the field], it melted.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה בְּיוֹמָא שְׁתִיתָאָה לְקָטוּ לַחְמָא עַל חַד תְּרֵין תְּרֵין עֻמְרִין לְחָד וַאֲתוֹ כָּל רַבְרְבֵי כְנִשְׁתָּא וְחַוִיאוּ לְמשֶׁה:
verses.ar_en: When the sixth day came, what they had gathered [was a] double [portion of] bread, two omers for each individual. All the leaders of the community came and told Moshe [about it].

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לְהוֹן הוּא דִי מַלִיל יְיָ שְׁבָתָא שְׁבַת קוּדְשָׁא קֳדָם יְיָ מְחָר יָת דִי אַתּוּן עֲתִידִין לְמֵפָא אֲפוֹ וְיָת דִי אַתּוּן עֲתִידִין לְבַשָׁלָא בַּשִׁילוּ וְיָת כָּל מוֹתָרָא אַצְנָעוּ לְכוֹן לְמַטְּרַת עַד צַפְרָא:
verses.ar_en: He said to them, “This is what Adonoy has said: Tomorrow is a [day of] rest, Adonoy’s [a] holy Shabbos [before Adonoy]. Bake what you want to bake, and cook what you want to cook, and whatever is left over, put aside for yourselves, to preserve it until the morning.”

verses.ar_he: וְאַצְנָעוּ יָתֵהּ עַד צַפְרָא כְּמָא דְפַקִיד משֶׁה וְלָא סְרִי וְרִיחֲשָׁא לָא הֲוָה בֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: They put it aside until morning as Moshe had commanded. It did not turn putrid and there were no worms in it.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר משֶׁה אִכְלוּהִי יוֹמָא דֵין אֲרֵי שַׁבְּתָא יוֹמָא דֵין קֳדָם יְיָ יוֹמָא דֵין לָא תַשְׁכְּחֻנֵהּ בְּחַקְלָא:
verses.ar_en: Moshe said, “Eat it today, for today is Shabbos to [before] Adonoy. Today you will not find it [manna] in the field.

verses.ar_he: שִׁתָּא יוֹמִין תִּלְקְטֻנֵהּ וּבְיוֹמָא שְׁבִיעָאָה שַׁבְּתָא לָא יְהֵי בֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: Six days you shall gather it, but the seventh day is Shabbos, there will be none on [that day].”

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה בְּיוֹמָא שְׁבִיעָאָה נְפָקוּ מִן עַמָא לְמִלְקָטּ וְלָא אַשְׁכָּחוּ:
verses.ar_en: When the seventh day came some of the people went out to gather, but they found none.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה עַד אֵימָתַי אַתּוּן מְסָרְבִין לְמִטַר פִּקוּדַי וְאוֹרָיָתַי:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe, “How long will you refuse to keep My commandments and My teachings.”

verses.ar_he: חֲזוֹ אֲרֵי יְיָ יְהַב לְכוֹן שַׁבְּתָא עַל כֵּן הוּא יָהֵב לְכוֹן בְּיוֹמָא שְׁתִיתָאָה לְחֵם תְּרֵין יוֹמִין תִּיבוּ אֲנַשׁ תְּחוֹתוֹהִי לָא יִפּוֹק אֲנַשׁ מֵאַתְרֵהּ בְּיוֹמָא שְׁבִיעָאָה:
verses.ar_en: See, because Adonoy gave you the Shabbos, therefore He gave you on the sixth day bread for two days. Every man must remain in his place. No man may go out of his place on the seventh day.

verses.ar_he: וְנָחוּ עַמָא בְּיוֹמָא שְׁבִיעָאָה:
verses.ar_en: The people rested on the seventh day.

verses.ar_he: וּקְרוֹ בֵית יִשְׂרָאֵל יָת שְׁמֵהּ מָן וְהוּא כְּבַר זְרַע גִדָא חִוָר וְטַעְמֵה כְּאִסְקְרֵיטָוָן בִּדְבָשׁ:
verses.ar_en: The House of Yisrael named it [the food] man[na]. It was like white coriander seed, and it tasted like wafers in honey.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר משֶׁה דֵין פִּתְגָמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ מִלֵי עֻמְרָא מִנֵהּ לְמַטְרָא לְדָרֵיכוֹן בְּדִיל דְיֶחְזוּן יָת לַחְמָא דִי אוֹכָלִית יָתְכוֹן בְּמַדְבְּרָא בְּאַפָּקוּתִי יָתְכוֹן מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרָיִם:
verses.ar_en: Moshe said, “This is what Adonoy has commanded: Fill an omer [measure] with it to preserve it for your generations. That they may see the bread with which I fed you in the desert when I brought you out of the land of Egypt.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר משֶׁה לְאַהֲרֹן סַב צְלוֹחִית חֲדָא וְהַב תַמָן מְלֵי עֻמְרָא מָן וְאַצְנַע יָתֵהּ קֳדָם יְיָ לְמַטְרָא לְדָרֵיכוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Moshe said to Aharon, “Take a jar and put an omer full of manna in it, and place it before Adonoy to be preserved for your generations.”

verses.ar_he: כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ לְמשֶׁה וְאַצְנְעֵהּ אַהֲרֹן קֳדָם סַהֲדוּתָא לְמַטְרָא:
verses.ar_en: As Adonoy commanded Moshe, Aharon placed it before the Testimony for preservation.

verses.ar_he: וּבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֲכָלוּ יָת מַנָא אַרְבְּעִין שְׁנִין עַד דְמֵיתֵיהוֹן לְאַרְעָא יָתְבָתָא יָת מַנָא אֲכָלוּ עַד דְאָתוֹ לִסְיָפֵי אַרְעָא דִכְנָעַן:
verses.ar_en: The B’nei Yisrael ate the manna for forty years, until they came to an inhabited land. They ate the manna until they came to the edge of the land of Canaan.

verses.ar_he: וְעֻמְרָא חַד מִן עַסְרָא בִּתְלָת סְאִין הוּא:
verses.ar_en: The omer is a tenth of an eiphoh [which is three se’in].

verses.ar_he: וּנְטָלוּ כָּל כְּנִשְׁתָּא דִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מִמַדְבְּרָא דְסִין לְמַטְלָנֵיהוֹן עַל מֵימְרָא דַיְיָ וּשְׁרוֹ בִּרְפִידִים וְלֵית מַיָא לְמִשְׁתֵּי עַמָא:
verses.ar_en: The entire community of B’nei Yisrael journeyed from the wilderness of Sin, traveling according to the word of Adonoy. They camped in Rephidim, and there was no water for the people to drink.

verses.ar_he: וּנְצָא עַמָא עִם משֶׁה וַאֲמָרוּ הָבוּ לָנָא מַיָא וְנִשְׁתֵּי וַאֲמַר לְהוֹן משֶׁה מָא אַתּוּן נָצָן עִמִי מָא מְנַסוּן אַתּוּן קֳדָם יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: The people quarreled with Moshe, and said, “Give us water to drink.” Moshe said to them, “Why are you quarreling with me? Why are you testing [before] Adonoy?”

verses.ar_he: וּצְחִי תַמָן עַמָא לְמַיָא וְאִתְרַעַם עַמָא עַל משֶׁה וַאֲמַר לְמָא דְנַן אַסֶקְתָּנָא מִמִצְרַיִם לְקַטָלָא יָתִי וְיָת בָּנַי וְיָת בְּעִירַי בְּצָחוּתָא:
verses.ar_en: The people were suffering thirst for [the lack of] water, and the people complained against Moshe and said, “Why did you bring us up from Egypt—to kill me and my children, and my livestock with thirst?”

verses.ar_he: וְצַלִי משֶׁה קֳדָם יְיָ לְמֵימַר מָא אֶעְבֵּד לְעַמָא הָדֵין עוֹד זְעֵיר פּוֹן וְיִרְגְמֻנִי:
verses.ar_en: Moshe cried out to [prayed before] Adonoy saying, “What shall I do for this people? Before long they will stone me.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה עִבַּר קֳדָם עַמָא וּדְבַר עִמָךְ מִסָבֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְחֻטְרָךְ דִי מָחֵיתָא בֵהּ יָת נַהֲרָא סַב בִּידָךְ וְתֵיזִל:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe, “Pass to the front of the people and take with you the elders of the [B’nei] Yisrael. The staff with which you struck the river; take in to your hand, and go.

verses.ar_he: הָא אֲנָא קָאֵם קֳדָמָךְ תַּמָן עַל טִנָרָא בְּחוֹרֵב וְתִמְחֵי בְטִנָרָא וְיִפְּקוּן מִנֵהּ מַיָא וְיִשְׁתֵּי עַמָא וַעֲבַד כֵּן משֶׁה לְעֵינֵי סָבֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל:
verses.ar_en: Behold, I will stand before you there on the rock in Choreiv. You shall strike the rock and water will come out of it, and the people [will be able] to drink. Moshe did this in the sight [presence] of the elders of the [B’nei] Yisrael.

verses.ar_he: וּקְרָא שְׁמָא דְאַתְרָא נִסֵיתָא וּמַצוּתָא עַל דִנְצוֹ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְעַל דְנַסִיאוּ קֳדָם יְיָ לְמֵימַר הֲאִית שְׁכִינְתָּא דַיְיָ בֵּינָנָא אִם לָא:
verses.ar_en: He [Moshe] named the place Massah and Merivah because the B’nei Yisrael had quarreled [Merivah] and because they had tested [Massah] [before] Adonoy, saying, “Is [the Shechina of] Adonoy among us or not?”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתָא עֲמָלֵק וַאֲגַח קְרָבָא עִם יִשְׂרָאֵל בִּרְפִידִם:
verses.ar_en: Amaleik came and fought [a war] with [B’nei] Yisrael in Rephidim.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר משֶׁה לִיהוֹשֻׁעַ בְּחַר לָנָא גֻבְרַיָא וּפוּק אֲגַח קְרָבָא בַּעֲמָלֵק מְחָר אֲנָא קָאֵם עַל רֵישׁ רָמָתָא וְחוּטְרָא דְאִתְעֲבִידוּ בֵהּ נִסִין מִן קֳדָם יְיָ בִּידִי:
verses.ar_en: Moshe said to Yehoshua, “Choose men for us and go out to battle [fight a war with] Amaleik. Tomorrow, I will stand on top of the hill with the staff [with which miracles were performed from before] of God in my hand.”

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד יְהוֹשֻׁעַ כְּמָא דְאֲמַר לֵהּ משֶׁה לְאַגָחָא קְרָבָא בַּעֲמָלֵק וּמשֶׁה אַהֲרֹן וְחוּר סְלִיקוּ לְרֵישׁ רָמָתָא:
verses.ar_en: Yehoshua did as Moshe told him—to battle [fight a war with] Amaleik. Moshe, Aharon and Chur went up to the top of the hill.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוִי כַּד יְרִים משֶׁה יְדוֹהִי וּמִתְגַבְּרִין דְבֵית יִשְׂרָאֵל וְכַד מַנַח יְדוֹהִי וּמִתְגַבְּרִין דְבֵית עֲמָלֵק:
verses.ar_en: When Moshe raised his hand, [(the fighters) of the House of] [B’nei] Yisrael prevailed; but when he let his hand down [to rest] [(the fighters) of the House of] Amaleik prevailed.

verses.ar_he: וִידֵי משֶׁה יְקָרָן וּנְסִיבוּ אַבְנָא וְשַׁוִיאוּ תְחוֹתוֹהִי וִיתֵב עֲלַהּ וְאַהֲרֹן וְחוּר סַעְדָן בִּידוֹהִי מִכָּא חַד וּמִכָּא חַד וַהֲוָה יְדוֹהִי פְּרִיסָן בִּצְלוֹ עַד דְעַל שִׁמְשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: Moshe’s hands became heavy. They took a stone and placed it under him and he sat upon it. Aharon and Chur supported his hands, one of them on one side and one on the other side. His hands remained an expression of faith [as he prayed] [were spread in prayer] until sunset.

verses.ar_he: וְתַבַּר יְהוֹשֻׁעַ יָת עֲמָלֵק וְיָת עַמֵהּ לְפִתְגָם דְחָרֶב:
verses.ar_en: Yehoshua weakened [crushed] Amaleik and his people with the edge [word] of the sword.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה כְּתָב דָא דוּכְרָנָא בְּסִפְרָא וְשַׁוִי קֳדָם יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אֲרֵי מִמְחָא אֶמְחֵי יָת דוּכְרָנָא דַעֲמָלֵק מִתְּחוֹת שְׁמַיָא:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe, “Write this as a remembrance in the Book, [the Torah] and repeat it in [before] Yehoshua’s ears, for I will totally obliterate the memory of Amaleik from under the heavens.

verses.ar_he: וּבְנָא משֶׁה מַדְבְּחָא וּפְלַח עֲלוֹהִי קֳדָם יְיָ דַעֲבַד לֵהּ נִסִין:
verses.ar_en: Moshe built an altar and called it [worshiped on it before] Adonoy nissi [Adonoy is my miracle] [Who had performed miracles for him].

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר בִּשְׁבוּעָה אֲמִירָא דָא מִן קֳדָם דְחֵילָא דִשְׁכִנְתֵּהּ עַל כָּרְסֵהּ יְקָרֵהּ דְעָתִיד דְאִתָּגַח קְרָבָא קֳדָם יְיָ בִּדְבֵית עֲמָּ לֵק לְשֵׁצָיוּתְהוֹן מִדָרֵי עָלְמָא:
verses.ar_en: He said [with an oath, this saying from before the Awesome one, whose Shechina is upon His glorious throne, that in the future a war will be waged before God against the house of Amaleik to destroy them for generations forever.] , “The hand is on God’s throne, Adonoy will be at war with Amaleik for all generations.”

verses.ar_he: וּשְׁמַע יִתְרוֹ רַבָּא דְמִדְיָן חֲמוּהִי דְמשֶׁה יַת כָּל דִי עֲבַד יְיָ לְמשֶׁה וּלְיִשְׂרָאֵל עַמֵהּ אֲרֵי אַפִּיק יְיָ יָת יִשְׂרָאֵל מִמִצְרָיִם:
verses.ar_en: Yisro heard—priest [minister] of Midian, Moshe’s father-in-law—about all that Elohim had done for Moshe and for His people Yisrael, that Adonoy brought Yisrael out of Egypt.

verses.ar_he: וּדְבַר יִתְרוֹ חֲמוּהִי דְמשֶׁה יָת צִפֹּרָה אִתַּת משֶׁה בָּתַר דְפַטְרַהּ:
verses.ar_en: Moshe’s father-in-law, Yisro took Moshe’s wife, Tzipporah, after he had sent her back [home],

verses.ar_he: וְיָת תְּרֵין בְּנָהָא דִי שׁוּם חַד גֵרְשֹׁם אֲרֵי אֲמַר דַיָר הֲוֵיתִי בְּאַרְעָא נוּכְרָאָה:
verses.ar_en: along with her two sons. The name of one was Gershom, because he [Moshe] had said, “I was a stranger in an alien land.”

verses.ar_he: וְשׁוּם חַד אֱלִיעֶזֶר אֲרֵי אֱלָהָא דְאַבָּא הֲוָה בְסַעְדִי וְשֵׁזְבַנִי מֵחַרְבָּא דְפַרְעֹה:
verses.ar_en: The name of the [other] one was Eliezer, because the God of my father was my help, and rescued me from the sword of Pharaoh.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתָא יִתְרוֹ חֲמוּהִי דְמשֶׁה וּבְנוֹהִי וְאִתְּתֵהּ לְוָת משֶׁה לְמַדְבְּרָא דִי הוּא שָׁרֵי תַמָן לְטוּרָא דְאִתְגְלֵי עֲלוֹהִי יְקָרָא דַיְיָ:
verses.ar_en: Moshe’s father-in-law, Yisro came, along with his [Moshe’s] sons, and wife, to Moshe, to the desert where he was camped near the mountain [upon which the Glory] of God [was revealed].

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לְמשֶׁה אֲנָא חֲמוּךְ יִתְרוֹ אָתֵי לְוָתָךְ וְאִתְּתָךְ וּתְרֵין בְּנָהָא עִמַהּ:
verses.ar_en: He said to Moshe, “I, your father-in-law, Yisro, am coming to you along with your wife; her two sons are with her.”

verses.ar_he: וּנְפַק משֶׁה לְקַדָמוּת חֲמוּהִי וּסְגִיד וּנְשִׁיק לֵהּ וּשְׁאִילוּ גְבַר לְחַבְרֵהּ לִשְׁלָם וְעַלוּ לְמַשְׁכְּנָא:
verses.ar_en: Moshe went out to greet his father-in-law. He prostrated himself and [then] kissed him. They asked after each other’s well being, and went into the tent.

verses.ar_he: וְאִשְׁתָּעִי משֶׁה לַחֲמוּהִי יָת כָּל דִי עֲבַד יְיָ לְפַרְעֹה וּלְמִצְרָאֵי עַל עֵסַק יִשְׂרָאֵל יָת כָּל עַקְתָא דִי אַשְׁכַּחְתִּנוּן בְּאָרְחָא וְשֵׁזְבָנוּן יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: Moshe told his father-in-law all that Adonoy had done to Pharaoh and to Egypt for the sake of Yisrael; including all the hardship that had befallen them on the way, and [how] Adonoy had rescued them.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲדִי יִתְרוֹ עַל כָּל טַבְתָא דִי עֲבַד יְיָ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל דִי שֵׁזְבָנוּן מִידָא דְמִצְרָאֵי:
verses.ar_en: Yisro rejoiced over all the good that Adonoy had done for Yisrael; that He had rescued them from the hand of Egypt.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יִתְרוֹ בְּרִיךְ יְיָ דִי שֵׁזִיב יָתְכוֹן מִידָא דְמִצְרָאֵי וּמִידָא דְפַרְעֹה דִי שֵׁזִיב יָת עַמָא מִתְּחוֹת מַרְוַת מִצְרָאֵי:
verses.ar_en: Yisro said, “Blessed is Adonoy Who rescued you from the hand of Egypt, and from the hand of Pharaoh; Who rescued the people from under the hand [domination] of Egypt [the Egyptians].

verses.ar_he: כְּעַן יְדַעְנָא אֲרֵי רַב יְיָ וְלֵית אֱלָּהּ בַּר מִנֵהּ אֲרֵי בְּפִתְגָמָא דִי חַשִׁיבוּ מִצְרָאֵי לְמִדַן יָת יִשְׂרָאֵל בֵּהּ דָנִנוּן:
verses.ar_en: Now I know that Adonoy is greater than all the gods, [great, and there is no god besides Him,] because [with] the very thing [through which the Egyptians] they plotted [to punish Yisrael] came upon them [they themselves were punished].”

verses.ar_he: וְקָרִיב יִתְרוֹ חֲמוּהִי דְמשֶׁה עֲלָוָן וְנִכְסַת קוּדְשִׁין קֳדָם יְיָ וַאֲתָא אַהֲרֹן וְכֹל סָבֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמֵיכַל לַחְמָא עִם חֲמוּהִי דְמשֶׁה קֳדָם יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: [Then] Yisro, Moshe’s father-in-law, brought [offered] a burnt-offering and [peace]-offerings to [before] God. Aharon and all the elders of Yisrael came to eat bread with [Yisro,] Moshe’s father-in-law, before God.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה מִיוֹמָא דְבַתְרוֹהִי וִיתֵיב משֶׁה לְמִדַן יָת עַמָא וְקָם עַמָא עִלָוֹהִי דְמשֶׁה מִן צַפְרָא עַד רַמְשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: It was on the following day [that] Moshe sat to judge the people and the people stood around Moshe from morning until evening.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזָא חֲמוּהִי דְמשֶׁה יָת כָּל דִי הוּא עָבֵד לְעַמָא וַאֲמַר מָא פִתְגָמָא הָדֵין דִי אַתְּ עָבֵד לְּעַמָא מָה דֵין אַתְּ יָתֵב בִּלְחוֹדָךְ וְכָל עַמָא קָיְמִין עִלָוָךְ מִן צַפְרָא עַד רַמְשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: When Moshe’s father-in-law saw all that he did for the people, he said, “What is this that you are doing for the people? Why are you sitting by yourself and [letting] the people stand around you from morning until evening?”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר משֶׁה לַחֲמוּהִי אֲרֵי אָתָן לְוָתִי עַמָא לְמִתְבַּע אוּלְפַן מִן קֳדָם יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: Moshe said to his father-in-law, “Because the people come to me to seek [instruction from] God.

verses.ar_he: כַּד הֲוֵי לְהוֹן דִינָא אָתָן לְוָתִי וְדָאִינְנָא בֵּין גַבְרָא וּבֵין חַבְרֵהּ וּמְהוֹדַעְנָא לְהוֹן יָת קְיָמַיָא דַיְיָ וְיָת אוֹרָיָתֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: Whenever they have a problem, they come to me, and I judge between man and his neighbor. I impart to them God’s statutes and His laws.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר חֲמוּהִי דְמשֶׁה לֵהּ לָא תַקִין פִּתְגָמָא דְאַתְּ עָבֵד:
verses.ar_en: Moshe’s father-in-law said to him, “What you are doing is not good.

verses.ar_he: מִלְאָה תִלְאֶה אַף אַתְּ אַף עַמָא הָדֵין דִעִמָךְ אֲרֵי יַקִיר מִנָךְ פִּתְגָמָא לָא תִכּוֹל לְמֶעְבְּדֵהּ בִּלְחוֹדָךְ:
verses.ar_en: You are going to wear yourself out, you too and this people that is with you. This [activity] is too heavy for you. You cannot do it alone.

verses.ar_he: כְּעַן קַבֵּל מִנִי אֲמַלְכִנָךְ וִיהֵי מֵימְרָא דַיְיָ בְּסַעְדָךְ הֱוֵי אַתְּ לְעַמָא (תְּבַע) אוּלְפַן מִן קֳדָם יְיָ וּתְהֵי מַיְתִי אַתְּ יָת פִּתְגָמַיָא לִקֳדָם יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: Now listen to my voice [obey me]. I will give you advice and [the Word of] God [will] be with you [your support]. You must be God’s representative [ask instruction from before God] for the people, and bring the[ir] problems to [before] God.

verses.ar_he: וְתַזְהַר יָתְהוֹן יָת קְיָמַיָא וְיָת אוֹרַיְתָא וּתְהוֹדַע לְהוֹן יָת אוֹרְחָא דִיְהָכוּן בַּהּ וְיָת עוֹבָדָא דִיַעְבְּדוּן:
verses.ar_en: You shall enlighten them as to the statutes and laws, and impart to them the path in which they must walk, and the deeds they must do.

verses.ar_he: וְאַתְּ תֶּחֶזֵי מִכָּל עַמָא גֻבְרִין דְחֵילָא דַחֲלַיָא דַיְיָ גֻבְרִין דִקְשׁוֹט דְסָנָן לְקַבָּלָא מָמוֹן וּתְמַנֵי עֲלֵיהוֹן רַבָּנֵי אַלְפִין רַבָּנֵי מָאוָתָא רַבָּנֵי חַמְשִׁין וְרַבָּנֵי עִשׂוֹרְיָתָא:
verses.ar_en: You must seek out from among all the people capable, God-fearing men, men of truth, who despise [accepting] gain. You must then appoint them over [the people] as officers of thousands, officers of hundreds, officers of fifties and officers of tens.

verses.ar_he: וִידוּנוּן יָת עַמָא בְּכָל עִדַן וִיהֵי כָּל פִּתְגַם רַב יַיְתוּן לְוָתָךְ וְכָל פִּתְגַם זְעֵיר יְדוּנוּן אִנוּן וְיִקְלוּן מִנָךְ וִיסוֹבְרוּן עִמָךְ:
verses.ar_en: Let them [They shall] judge the people at all times. Every major problem they will bring to you, and every minor problem they shall judge by themselves. It will [thus] be easier for you since they will bear the burden with you.

verses.ar_he: אִם יָת פִּתְגָמָא הָדֵין תַּעְבֵּד וִיפַקְדִנָךְ יְיָ וְתִכּוֹל לְמֵיקָם וְאַף כָּל עַמָא הָדֵין עַל אַתְרֵהּ יְהַךְ בִּשְׁלָם:
verses.ar_en: If you do this and God commands you [to do so], you will be able to survive, and also this entire people will come [go] to their place in peace.”

verses.ar_he: וְקַבִּיל משֶׁה לְמֵימְרָא דַחֲמוּהִי וַעֲבַד כֹּל דִי אֲמָר:
verses.ar_en: Moshe listened to [accepted] the voice [word] of his father-in-law and he did all that he said.

verses.ar_he: וּבְחַר משֶׁה גֻבְרִין דְחֵילָא מִכָּל יִשְׂרָאֵל וּמַנִי יָתְהוֹן רֵישִׁין עַל עַמָא רַבָּנֵי אַלְפִין רַבָּנֵי מָאוָתָא רַבָּנֵי חַמְשִׁין וְרַבָּנֵי עִשׂוֹרְיָתָא:
verses.ar_en: Moshe chose capable men from among all Yisrael, and appointed them leaders over the people; officers of thousands, officers of hundreds, officers of fifties and officers of tens.

verses.ar_he: וְדַיְנִין יָת עַמָא בְּכָל עִדָן יָת פִתְגַם קָשֵׁי מַיְתִין לְוָת משֶׁה וְכָל פִּתְגַם זְעֵיר דָיְנִין אִנוּן:
verses.ar_en: They judged [would judge] the people at all times. The difficult problems, they would bring to Moshe, and the simple problems they would judge by themselves.

verses.ar_he: וְשַׁלַח משֶׁה יָת חֲמוּהִי וַאֲזַל לֵהּ לְאַרְעֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: Moshe sent his father-in-law off, and he [Yisro] went on his way to his land.

verses.ar_he: בְּיַרְחָא תְּלִיתָאָה לְמִפַּק בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרָיִם בְּיוֹמָא הָדֵין אֲתוֹ לְמַדְבְּרָא דְסִינָי:
verses.ar_en: In the third month of the Bnei Yisrael’s departure from the land of Egypt, on that very day they came to the desert of Sinai.

verses.ar_he: וּנְטָלוּ מֵרְפִידִים וַאֲתוֹ לְמַדְבְּרָא דְסִינָי וּשְׁרוֹ בְּמַדְבְּרָא וּשְׁרָא תַמָן יִשְׂרָאֵל לָקֳבֵל טוּרָא:
verses.ar_en: They had journeyed from Rephidim and had come to the desert of Sinai, and camped in the desert. Yisrael camped there opposite the mountain.

verses.ar_he: וּמשֶׁה סְלֵק לִקֳדָם יְיָ וּקְרָא לֵהּ יְיָ מִן טוּרָא לְמֵימַר כִּדְנַן תֵּימַר לְבֵית יַעֲקֹב וּתְחַוִי לִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל:
verses.ar_en: Moshe went up to [before] [the Presence of] God, and Adonoy called to him from the mountain, saying, “This is what you shall say to the House of Yaakov, and tell to the Bnei Yisrael.

verses.ar_he: אַתּוּן חֲזִתּוּן דִי עֲבָדִית לְמִצְרָיִם וּנְטָלִית (נ״‎א וְאַטְּלִית) יָתְכוֹן כִּדְעַל גַדְפֵי נִשְׁרִין וְקָרֵבִית יָתְכוֹן לְפָלְחָנִי:
verses.ar_en: ‘You saw what I did to Egypt; and [how] I carried [transported] you [as if] on wings of eagles, and brought you [close] to Me [My worship].

verses.ar_he: וּכְעַן אִם קַבָּלָא תְקַבְּלוּן לְמֵימְרִי וְתִטְרוּן יָת קְיָמִי וּתְהוֹן קֳדָמַי חַבִּיבִין מִכָּל עַמְמַיָא אֲרֵי דִי לִי כָּל אַרְעָא:
verses.ar_en: And now if you listen diligently [obey] to My voice [Word], and preserve My covenant; you shall be [more] beloved before Me than My special treasure among all the peoples, for all the earth is Mine.

verses.ar_he: וְאַתּוּן תְּהוֹן קֳדָמַי מַלְכִין כָּהֲנִין וְעַם קַדִישׁ אִלֵין פִּתְגָמַיָא דִי תְמַלֵל עִם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל:
verses.ar_en: You will be to [before] Me a kingdom of [kings and] kohanim, and a holy nation.’ These are the words that you shall speak to the Bnei Yisrael.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתָא משֶׁה וּקְרָא לְסָבֵי עַמָא וְסַדַר קֳדָמֵיהוֹן יָת כָּל פִּתְגָמַיָא הָאִלֵין דִפַקְדֵיהּ יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: Moshe came [back] and called for the elders of the people. He presented to them all these words which Adonoy had commanded him.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתִיבוּ כָל עַמָא כַּחֲדָא וַאֲמָרוּ כֹּל דִי מַלִיל יְיָ נַעְבֵּד וַאֲתֵיב משֶׁה יָת פִּתְגָמֵי עַמָא קֳדָם יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: All the people responded in unison, and said, “All that Adonoy has spoke, we will do.” Moshe brought the words of the people to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה הָא אֲנָא מִתְגְלִי לָךְ בְּעֵיבָא דַעֲנָנָא בְּדִיל דְיִשְׁמַע עַמָא בְּמַלָלוּתִי עִמָךְ וְאַף בָּךְ יְהֵימְנוּן לְעָלָם וְחַוִי משֶׁה יָת פִּתְגָמֵי עַמָא קֳדָם יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe, “Behold, I will come [become revealed] to you in a thick cloud, so that the people will hear when I speak to you, and they will also believe in you forever.” Moshe told Adonoy the words of the people [before (Adonoy)].

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה אִזֵיל לְוָת עַמָא וּתְזַמִנוּן יוֹמָא דֵין וּמְחָר וִיחַוְרוּן לְבוּשֵׁיהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe, “Go to the people, and sanctify [prepare] them today and tomorrow, and let them cleanse their clothing.

verses.ar_he: וִיהוֹן זְמִינִין לְיוֹמָא תְלִיתָאָה אֲרֵי בְּיוֹמָא תְלִיתָאָה יִתְגְלִי יְיָ לְעֵינֵי כָל עַמָא עַל טוּרָא דְסִינָי:
verses.ar_en: Let them be ready for the third day, for on the third day, Adonoy will descend [become revealed] on Mount Sinai in the sight of all the people.

verses.ar_he: וּתְתַחֵם יָת עַמָא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר לְמֵימַר אִסְתַּמָרוּ לְכוֹן מִלְמִסַק בְּטוּרָא וּלְמִקְרַב בְּסוֹפֵהּ כָּל דְיִקְרַב בְּטוּרָא אִתְקְטָלָא יִתְקְטֵל:
verses.ar_en: Set bounds for the people around [the mountain], saying [to them], ‘Be careful not to go up the mountain, or [even] to touch its edge. Whoever touches the mountain will be put to death.

verses.ar_he: לָא תִקְרַב בֵּהּ יְדָא אֲרֵי אִתְרְגָמָא יִתְרְגֵם אוֹ אִשְׁתְּדָאָה יִשְׁתְּדִי אִם בְּעִירָא אִם אֱנָשָׁא לָא יִתְקַיָם בְּמֵיגַד שׁוֹפָרָא אִנוּן מְרָשָׁן לְמִסַק בְּטוּרָא:
verses.ar_en: Do not touch him [with your] hand, for he will be stoned or cast down. Neither man or beast will be allowed to live. When the [ram’s] horn is sounded with a long blast, they will [then] be permitted to go up on the mountain.”

verses.ar_he: וּנְחַת משֶׁה מִן טוּרָא לְוָת עַמָא וְזַמִין יָת עַמָא וְחַוָרוּ לְבוּשֵׁיהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Moshe went down from the mountain to the people. He sanctified the people, and they immersed [washed] [themselves and] their clothing.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לְעַמָא הֱווֹ זְמִינִין לִתְלָתָא יוֹמִין לָא תִקְרְבוּן לְצַד אִתְּתָא:
verses.ar_en: He said to the people, “Be ready by the end of three days. Do not come near a woman.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה בְיוֹמָא תְלִיתָאָה בְּמֶהֱוֵי צַפְרָא וַהֲוָה קָלִין וּבַרְקִין וַעֲנָנָא תַקִיף עַל טוּרָא וְקַל שׁוֹפָרָא תַּקִיף לַחֲדָא וְזָע כָּל עַמָא דִי בְמַשְׁרִיתָא:
verses.ar_en: It was on the third day, in the morning, that there was thunder and lightning. A heavy cloud was on the mountain, and there was a very loud sound of the shofar. All the people in the camp trembled.

verses.ar_he: וְאַפֵיק משֶׁה יָת עַמָא לְקַדָמוּת מֵימְרָא דַיְיָ מִן מַשְׁרִיתָא וְאִתְעַתָּדוּ בְּשִׁפּוֹלֵי טוּרָא:
verses.ar_en: Moshe brought the people toward [the Divine Presence of] [the Word of] God, [leading them] out of the camp. They stood at the foot of the mountain.

verses.ar_he: וְטוּרָא דְסִינַי תָּנַן כֻּלֵהּ מִן קֳדָם דְאִתְגְלִי עֲלוֹהִי יְיָ בְּאֶשָׁתָא וּסְלִיק תְּנָנֵהּ כִּתְנָנָא דְאַתּוּנָא וְזָע כָּל טוּרָא לַחֲדָא:
verses.ar_en: The entire Mount Sinai was enveloped with smoke, for Adonoy had descended [become revealed] upon it in fire. Its smoke rose like the smoke of a [lime] furnace and the entire mountain trembled violently.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה קַל שׁוֹפָרָא אָזֵל וְתָקֵף לַחֲדָא משֶׁה מְמַלֵל וּמִן קֳדָם יְיָ מִתְעֲנֵי לֵהּ בְקָל:
verses.ar_en: The sound of the shofar grew louder and louder. Moshe spoke and [from before] God responded to him [he was answered] with [His] voice.

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְגְלִי יְיָ עַל טוּרָא דְסִינַי לְרֵישׁ טוּרָא וּקְרָא יְיָ לְמשֶׁה לְרֵישׁ טוּרָא וּסְלִיק משֶׁה:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy descended [became revealed] on Mount Sinai, to the top of the mountain, and Adonoy called to Moshe to come up to the top of the mountain, and Moshe went up.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה חוּת אַסְהֵיד בְּעַמָא דִילְמָא יְפַגְרוּן קֳדָם יְיָ לְמֶחֱזֵי וְיִפֵּל מִנְהוֹן סַגִי:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe, “Go down and warn the people lest they break through [the boundary] toward [before] [the Presence of] Adonoy in order to see; and many [of them] will die.

verses.ar_he: וְאַף כָּהֲנַיָא דִקְרִיבִין לְשַׁמָשָׁא קֳדָם יְיָ יִתְקַדְשׁוּן דִילְמָא יִקְטוֹל בְּהוֹן יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: Even the kohanim who [usually] come near to [serve before] Adonoy’s Presence, must be sanctified, lest Adonoy send destruction among [kill] them.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר משֶׁה קֳדָם יְיָ לָא יִכּוֹל עַמָא לְמִסַק לְטוּרָא דְסִינַי אֲרֵי אַתְּ אַסְהֵדְתָּ בָּנָא לְמֵימַר תַּחִים יָת טוּרָא וְקַדְשֵׁהּ:
verses.ar_en: Moshe said to [before] Adonoy, “The people can not go up to Mount Sinai, for You have warned us saying, ‘Set a boundary around the mountain and sanctify it.’”
