verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לֵהּ יְיָ אִזֵיל חוּת וְתִסַק אַתְּ וְאַהֲרֹן עִמָךְ וְכָהֲנַיָא וְעַמָא לָא יְפַגְרוּן לְמִסַק לִקֳדָם יְיָ דִילְמָא יִקְטוֹל בְּהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to him, “Go down. You will then come up [again], along with Aharon. The kohanim and the people, [however,] must not break through to go up toward [before] [the Presence of] Adonoy, lest He send destruction among [kill] them.”

verses.ar_he: וּנְחַת משֶׁה לְעַמָא וַאֲמַר לְהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Moshe went down to the people, and he said [this] to them.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ יָת כָּל פִּתְגָמַיָא הָאִלֵין לְמֵימָר:
verses.ar_en: Elohim spoke all these words, saying:

verses.ar_he: אֲנָא יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ דִי אַפֵּיקְתָּךְ מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם מִבֵּית עַבְדוּתָא:
verses.ar_en: I am Adonoy, your God, Who brought you out of the land of Egypt, from the house of slaves [slavery].

verses.ar_he: לָא יְהֵי לָךְ אֱלָהּ אָחֳרָן בַּר מִנִי:
verses.ar_en: You must not have any other gods before My Presence [besides Me].

verses.ar_he: לָא תַעְבֵּד לָךְ צֶלֶם וְכָל דְמוּת דִי בִשְׁמַיָא מִלְעֵלָא וְדִי בְאַרְעָא מִלְרָע וְדִי בְמַיָא מִלְרַע לְאַרְעָא:
verses.ar_en: You must not make for yourself any carved image, or picture of anything that is in the heaven above, or on the earth below, or in the water below the earth.

verses.ar_he: לָא תִסְגֻד לְהוֹן וְלָא תִפְלְחִנוּן אֲרֵי אֲנָא יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ אֵל קַנָא מַסְעַר חוֹבֵי אֲבָהָן עַל בְּנִין מָרָדִין עַל דַר תְּלִיתַי וְעַל דַר רְבִיעַי לְשָׂנְאָי כַּד מְשַׁלְמִין בְּנַיָא לְמֶחֱטֵי בָּתַר אֲבָהָתְהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: You must not prostrate yourself to them, and you must not worship them. For I, Adonoy your God, am a jealous Almighty. I am cognizant of the sins of fathers for [their] [rebellious] children, to the third and fourth [generations] of My enemies [when the children complete the sinning after their fathers].

verses.ar_he: וְעָבֵד טִּיבוּ לְאַלְפֵי דָרִין לְרַחֲמַי וּלְנָטְרֵי פִקוֹדָי:
verses.ar_en: But I do [acts of] loving kindness [goodness] for thousands [of generations] to those who love Me and preserve My commandments.

verses.ar_he: לָא תֵימֵי יָת שְׁמָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לְמַגָנָא אֲרֵי לָא יִזַכֵּי יְיָ יָת דִיֵימֵי בִשְׁמֵהּ לְשִׁקְרָא:
verses.ar_en: Do not take [swear in] the Name of Adonoy, your God in vain. For Adonoy will not acquit the one who takes [swears in] His Name in vain [falsely].

verses.ar_he: הֲוֵי דְכִיר יָת יוֹמָא דְשַׁבְּתָא לְקַדָשׁוּתֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: Remember the Shabbos day to sanctify it.

verses.ar_he: שִׁתָּא יוֹמִין תִּפְלָח וְתַעְבֵּד כָּל עִבִדְתָּךְ:
verses.ar_en: You may work six days, and do all your work.

verses.ar_he: וְיוֹמָא שְׁבִיעָאָה שַׁבְּתָא קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לָא תַעְבֵּד כָּל עִבִדְתָּא אַתְּ וּבְרָךְ וּבְרַתָּךְ עַבְדָךְ וְאַמְתָךְ וּבְעִירָךְ וְגִיוֹרָךְ דִי בְקִרְוָךְ:
verses.ar_en: But the seventh day is Shabbos to [before] Adonoy, your God. You must not do any manner of work—you, your son, your daughter, your slave, your maid, your animal, and the foreigner within your gates.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי שִׁתָּא יוֹמִין עֲבַד יְיָ יָת שְׁמַיָא וְיָת אַרְעָא יָת יַמָא וְיָת כָּל דִי בְהוֹן וְנָח בְּיוֹמָא שְׁבִיעָאָה עַל כֵּן בָּרִיךְ יְיָ יָת יוֹמָא דְשַׁבְּתָא וְקַדְשֵׁהּ:
verses.ar_en: For in six days Adonoy made the heaven and the earth, the sea and all that is in them, and He rested on the seventh day. Therefore Adonoy blessed the Shabbos and made it holy.

verses.ar_he: יַקַר יָת אָבוּךְ וְיָת אִמָךְ בְּדִיל דְיוֹרְכוּן יוֹמָיךְ עַל אַרְעָא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ יָהֵב לָךְ:
verses.ar_en: Honor your father and your mother so that your days may be lengthened upon the land that Adonoy, your God, is giving you.

verses.ar_he: לָא תִקְטוֹל נְפָשׁ לָא תְגוּף לָא תִגְנוּב לָא תַסְהֵד בְּחַבְרָךְ סַהֲדוּתָא דְשִׁקְרָא:
verses.ar_en: Do not commit murder. Do not commit adultery. Do not steal [by kidnapping human beings]. Do not testify as a false witness [testimony] against your neighbor.

verses.ar_he: לָא תַחְמֵד בֵּית חַבְרָךְ לָא תַחְמֵד אִתַּת חַבְרָךְ וְעַבְדֵהּ וְאַמְתֵהּ וְתוֹרֵהּ וַחֲמָרֵהּ וְכֹל דִי לְחַבְרָךְ:
verses.ar_en: Do not covet your neighbor’s house. Do not covet your neighbor’s wife, his slave, his maid, his ox, his donkey, or anything else that belongs to your neighbor.

verses.ar_he: וְכָל עַמָא חָזָן יָת קָלַיָא וְיָת בָּעוֹרַיָא וְיָת קַל שׁוֹפָרָא וְיָת טוּרָא תָּנֵן וַחֲזָא עַמָא וְזָעוּ וְקָמוּ מֵרָחִיק:
verses.ar_en: All the people saw the sounds, the flames, the sound of the shofar, and the mountain emitting smoke. The people saw [all this] and they trembled, and stood far off.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמָרוּ לְמשֶׁה מַלֵל אַתְּ עִמָנָא וּנְקַבֵּל וְלָא יִתְמַלֵל עִמָנָא מִן קֳדָם יְיָ דִילְּמָא נְמוּת:
verses.ar_en: They said to Moshe, “You speak to us and we will listen [obey]. Let [it not be spoken to us from before] Elohim not speak with us [anymore] lest we die.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר משֶׁה לְעַמָא לָא תִדְחֲלוּן אֲרֵי בְּדִיל לְנַסָאָה יָתְכוֹן אִתְגְלִי לְכוֹן יְקָרָא דַיְיָ וּבְדִיל דִתְהֵי דַחַלְתֵּהּ עַל אַפֵּיכוֹן בְּדִיל דְלָא תְחוּבוּן:
verses.ar_en: Moshe said to the people, “Do not be afraid. It was to exalt [test] you that [the Glory of] Elohim [became revealed to you] came [in this manner], so that the fear of Him be on your faces that you not sin.”

verses.ar_he: וְקָם עַמָא מֵרָחִיק וּמשֶׁה קָרֵב לְצַד אַמִיטְּתָא דִתַמָן יְקָרָא דַיְיָ:
verses.ar_en: The people stood far off. Moshe drew near to the dense cloud where [the Glory of] [the Divine Presence of] God was.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה כִּדְנַן תֵּימַר לִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אַתּוּן חֲזִיתּוּן אֲרֵי מִן שְׁמַיָא מַלֵילִית עִמְכוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe, “This is what you must say to the Bnei Yisrael. ‘You have seen that I have spoken to you from heaven.

verses.ar_he: לָא תַעְבְּדוּן קֳדָמָי דַחֲלָן דִכְסַף וְדַחֲלָן דִדְהַב לָא תַעְבְּדוּן לְכוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Do not make[an image of anything that is] with [before] Me, gods of silver or gods of gold you must not make for yourselves.

verses.ar_he: מַדְבַּח אַדְמְתָא תַּעְבֵּד קֳדָמַי וּתְהֵי דַבָּח עֲלוֹהִי יָת עֲלָוָתָךְ וְיָת נְכַס קוּדְשָׁךְ מִן עָנָךְ וּמִן תּוֹרָךְ בְּכָל אַתְרָא דִי אַשְׁרֵי יָת שְׁכִנְתִּי לְתַמָן אֶשְׁלַח בִּרְכְּתִי לָךְ וֶאֱבָרֵכִנָךְ:
verses.ar_en: Make an earthen altar for [before] Me and slaughter your burnt-offerings near it, your peace-offerings, your sheep and your cattle. In every place wherever I permit My Name to be mentioned [rest My Shechina], I will come [there I will send my blessing] to you and bless you.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם מַדְבַּח אַבְנִין תַּעְבֵּד קֳדָמַי לָא תִבְנֵי יָתְהוֹן פְּסִילָן לָא תְרִים חַרְבָּךְ עֲלַהּ וּתְחַלְלִנַהּ:
verses.ar_en: When you build a stone altar for [before] Me, do not build it out of hewn stone, lest you lift your sword on it, you will [therewith] have profaned it.

verses.ar_he: וְלָא תִסַק בְּדַרְגִין עַל מַדְבְּחִי דְלָא תִתְגְלֵי עֶרְיְתָךְ עֲלוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: Do not go up to My altar with steps, so that your nakedness not be revealed on it.’”

verses.ar_he: וְאִלֵין דִינַיָא דִי תַסְדַר קֳדָמֵיהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: And these are the laws that you shall set before them.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי תִזְבַּן עַבְדָא בַר יִשְׂרָאֵל שִׁתְּ שְׁנִין יִפְלָח וּבַשְׁבִיעֵתָא יִפּוֹק לְבַר חוֹרִין מַגָן:
verses.ar_en: If you buy a Hebrew slave [who is a son of a Hebrew], he shall serve [you] for six years, but in the seventh [year] he is to go out free, for naught [without liability].

verses.ar_he: אִם בִּלְחוֹדוֹהִי יֵיעוֹל בִּלְחוֹדוֹהִי יִפּוֹק אִם בְּעֵל אִתְּתָא הוּא וְתִפּוֹק אִתְּתֵהּ עִמֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: If he came by himself [unmarried], he shall go out by himself. If he was married, his wife shall go out with him.

verses.ar_he: אִם רִבּוֹנֵהּ יִתֶּן לֵהּ אִתְּתָא וּתְלִיד לֵהּ בְּנִין אוֹ בְנָן אִתְּתָא וּבְנָהָא תְּהֵי לְרִבּוֹנָהָא וְהוּא יִפּוֹק בִּלְחוֹדוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: If his master should give him a wife, and she bears him sons or daughters, then the woman and her children belong to her master, and he shall go out by himself.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם מֵימַר יֵימַר עַבְדָא רָחֵימְנָא יָת רִבּוֹנִי יָת אִתְּתִי וְיָת בְּנָי לָא אֶפּוֹק לְבַר חוֹרִין:
verses.ar_en: If the slave explicitly says, “I have come to love my master, my wife and my children, I do not want to go out free.”

verses.ar_he: וִיקָרְבִנֵהּ רִבּוֹנֵהּ לִקֳדָם דַיָנַיָא וִיקָרְבִנֵהּ לְוָת דָשָׁא אוֹ לְוָת (נ״‎א דִילְוָת) מְזְזֶתָּא וְיַרְצַע רִבּוֹנֵהּ יָת אוּדְנֵהּ בְּמַרְצְעָא וִיהֵי לֵהּ עֲבַד פָּלַח לְעָלָם:
verses.ar_en: His master must bring him to [before] the judges. He must then bring him next to the door, or to the doorpost, and his master shall pierce his ear with an awl. He then serves his master [will be a working servant for him,] forever.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי יְזַבֵּן גְבַר יָת בְּרַתֵּהּ לְאַמְהוּ לָא תִפּוֹק כְּמַפְקָנוּת עַבְדַיָא:
verses.ar_en: If a man sells his daughter to be a maidservant, she shall not go out [free] in the manner of male slaves.

verses.ar_he: אִם בִּישָׁא בְּעֵינֵי רִבּוֹנַהּ דִיקַיְמַהּ לֵהּ וְיִפְרְקִנַהּ לִגְבַר אָחֳרָן לֵית לֵהּ רְשׁוּ לְזַבּוֹנַהּ בְּמִשְׁלְטֵהּ בַהּ:
verses.ar_en: If she is displeasing to her master, who had not designated [for otherwise he would have designated] her as his wife, he must allow her to be redeemed. He has no power [right] to sell her to an alien people [another man] for he has dealt deceitfully with [controlled] her.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם לִבְרֵהּ יְקַיְמִנַהּ כְּהִלְכַת בְּנַת יִשְׂרָאֵל יַעְבֵּד לַהּ:
verses.ar_en: If he has designated her as a wife for his son, he must grant her exactly the same rights as daughters [of Yisrael].

verses.ar_he: אִם אָחֳרַנְתָּא יִסַב לֵהּ זִיוּנַהּ כְּסוּתַהּ וְעוֹנָתַהּ לָא יִתְמְנָע:
verses.ar_en: If he takes himself another [wife], her sustenance, her clothing and her conjugal rights he must not diminish.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם תְּלָת אִלֵין לָא יַעְבֵּד לַהּ וְתִפּוֹק מַגָן בְּלָא כְסַף:
verses.ar_en: If he does not do these three things to her, she goes out free with no repayment of money.

verses.ar_he: דְיִמְחֵי לֶאֱנַשׁ וְיִקְטְלִנֵהּ אִתְקְטָלָא יִתְקְטֵל:
verses.ar_en: If one strikes a man and he [the victim] dies, he shall be put to death.

verses.ar_he: וּדְלָא כְמַן לֵהּ וּמִן קֳדָם יְיָ אִתִּמְסַר לִידֵהּ וֶאֱשַׁוִי לָךְ אֲתַר דִי יֵעִרוֹק לְתַמָן:
verses.ar_en: But if he did not lie in wait [to ambush him] but [from before] God [he was] brought it to his hand, then I will designate for you a place, to which he can flee [and find refuge].

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי יַרְשַׁע גְבַר עַל חַבְרֵהּ לְמִקְטְלֵהּ בִנְכִילוּ מִן מַדְבְּחִי תִּדְבְּרִנֵהּ לִמְמָת:
verses.ar_en: But if a man plots against his neighbor to kill him intentionally, you may [even] take him from My altar to put him to death.

verses.ar_he: וּדְיִמְחֵי אֲבוּהִי וְאִמֵהּ אִתְקְטָלָא יִתְקְטֵל:
verses.ar_en: Whoever strikes his father or his mother shall be put to death.

verses.ar_he: וְדִיִגְנוּב נַפְשָׁא מִן בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וִיזַבְּנִנֵהּ וְיִשְׁתְּכַח בִּידֵהּ אִתְקְטָלָא יִתְקְטֵל:
verses.ar_en: Whoever steals [kidnaps] a man [person from B’nei Yisrael] and sells him, if he is found in his hand, he shall be put to death.

verses.ar_he: וְדִיְלוּט אֲבוּהִי וְאִמֵהּ אִתְקְטָלָא יִתְקְטֵל:
verses.ar_en: Whoever curses his father or his mother shall be put to death.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי יִנְצוּן גֻבְרִין וְיִמְחֵי גְבַר יָת חַבְרֵהּ בְּאַבְנָא אוֹ בְכוּרְמֵיזָא וְלָא יְמוּת וְיִפּוֹל לְבוּטְלָן:
verses.ar_en: When men quarrel and one man hits his fellow with a stone or with [his] fist; and he [the victim] does not die but becomes bedridden [falls to idleness],

verses.ar_he: אִם יְקוּם וִיהַלִיךְ בְּבָרָא עַל בּוּרְיֵהּ וִיהֵי זַכָּאָה מָחַיָא לְחוֹד בּוּטְּלָנֵהּ יִתֵּן וַאֲגַר אַסְיָא יְשַׁלֵם:
verses.ar_en: If he gets up and is able to walk on the outside on his own power, the one who struck him shall be acquitted. Still he must pay for his loss of work, and must pay for his complete cure [the doctor’s fee].

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי יִמְחֵי גְבַר יָת עַבְדֵהּ אוֹ יָת אַמְתֵהּ בְּשָׁלְטָּן וִימוּת תְּחוֹת יְדֵהּ אִתְדָנָא יִתְּדָן:
verses.ar_en: If a man strikes his male or female slave with a rod [power], and [the slave] dies under his hand, [the death] must be avenged [judged].

verses.ar_he: בְּרַם אִם יוֹמָא אוֹ תְרֵין יוֹמִין יִתְקַיָם לָא יִתְּדָן אֲרֵי כַסְפֵּהּ הוּא:
verses.ar_en: However if he [the slave] survives for a day or two, [his death] is not avenged [judged], for he [the slave] is his [master’s] property.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי יִנְצוּן גֻבְרִין וְיִמְחוּן אִתְּתָא מַעַדְיָא וְיִפְּקוּן וַלְדָהָא וְלָא יְהֵי מוֹתָא אִתְגְבָאָה יִתְגְבֵי כְּמָא דִי יְשַׁוִי עֲלוֹהִי בַּעֲלַהּ דְאִתְּתָא וְיִתֵּן עַל מֵימַר דַיָנַיָא:
verses.ar_en: If men will fight and they strike a pregnant woman, causing her to miscarry, but there is no fatal injury [to the woman], he [the guilty one] is to be punished with a [monetary] penalty when the husband demands compensation. He shall pay as determined by the judges.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם מוֹתָא יְהֵא וְתִתֵּן נַפְשָׁא חֳלָף נַפְשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: However if there is a fatal injury, you shall give [up] a life for a life.

verses.ar_he: עֵינָא חֳלָף עֵינָא שִׁנָא חֳלָף שִׁנָא יְדָא חֳלָף יְדָא רַגְלָא חֳלָף רַגְלָא:
verses.ar_en: [Compensation of] an eye for an eye, [of] a tooth for a tooth, [of] a hand for a hand, [of] a foot for a foot.

verses.ar_he: כְּוָאָה חֳלָף כְּוָאָה פִּדְעָא חֳלָף פִּדְעָא מַשְׁקוֹפֵי חֳלָף מַשְׁקוֹפֵי:
verses.ar_en: [Compensation of] a burn for a burn, [of] a wound for a wound, [of] a bruise [beating] for a bruise [beating].

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי יִמְחֵי גְבַר יָת עֵינָא דְעַבְדֵהּ אוֹ יָת עֵינָא דְאַמְתֵהּ וִיחַבְּלִנַהּ לְבַר חוֹרִין יִפְטְּרִנֵהּ חֳלָף עֵינֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: If a man strikes the eye of his slave, or the eye of his female slave, and destroys [blinds] it, he shall set him [the slave] free as compensation for the eye.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם שִׁנָא דְעַבְדֵהּ אוֹ שִּׁנָא דְאַמְתֵהּ יַפֵּל לְבַר חוֹרִין יִפְטְרִנֵהּ חֳלָף שִׁנֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: If [he knocks out] the tooth of his slave, or knocks out the tooth of his female slave, he shall set him [the slave] free as compensation for the tooth.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי יַגַח תּוֹרָא יָת גַבְרָא אוֹ יָת אִתְּתָא וִימוּת אִתְרְגְמָא יִתְרְגֵם תּוֹרָא וְלָא יִתְאָכֵל יָת בִּסְרֵהּ וּמָרֵהּ דְתוֹרָא יְהֵי זַכָּאָה:
verses.ar_en: If an ox gores a man or woman and the victim dies, the ox shall be stoned [to death], and its flesh may not be eaten. The owner of the ox shall go unpunished.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם תּוֹר נַגַח הוּא מֵאִתְּמַלֵי וּמִדְקַמוֹהִי וְיִתַּסְהֵד בְּמָרֵהּ וְלָא נַטְרֵהּ וְיִקְטוֹל גַבְרָא אוֹ אִתְּתָא תּוֹרָא יִתְרְגֵם וְאַף מָרֵהּ יִתְקְטֵל:
verses.ar_en: But if the ox had gored yesterday and the day before, and a warning was given to its owner, but he had not taken proper precautions to guard it, and kills a man or a woman, the ox must be stoned, and the owner also shall die [by Divine decree].

verses.ar_he: אִם מָמוֹן יְשַׁווּן עֲלוֹהִי וְיִתֵּן פּוּרְקַן נַפְשֵׁהּ כְּכֹל דִי יְשַׁווּן עֲלוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: When an atonement fine shall be imposed on him, he must give for the redemption of his soul whatever sum is imposed on him.

verses.ar_he: אוֹ לְבַר יִשְׂרָאֵל יַגַח תּוֹרָא אוֹ לְבַת יִשְׂרָאֵל יַגָח כְּדִינָא הָדֵין יִתְעֲבֵד לֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: Whether it is a son [a minor lad] [of Yisrael] that is gored [by the ox] or a daughter [a minor girl] [of Yisrael] that it gored, this law shall apply to it.

verses.ar_he: אִם לְעַבְדָא יַגַח תּוֹרָא אוֹ לְאַמְתָא כְּסַף תְּלָתִין סִלְעִין יִתֵּן לְרִבּוֹנֵהּ וְתוֹרָא יִתְרְגֵם:
verses.ar_en: If the ox gored a male or female slave, he must give thirty silver shekalim [selaim] to their master, and the ox must be stoned.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי יִפְתַּח גְבַר גוֹב אוֹ אֲרֵי יִכְרֶה גְבַר גוֹב וְלָא יְכַסִנֵהּ וְיִפֵּל תַּמָן תּוֹרָא אוֹ חֲמָרָא:
verses.ar_en: If a man uncovers a pit, or if a man digs a pit, and does not cover it, and an ox or a donkey falls into it;

verses.ar_he: מָרֵי דְגֻבָּא יְשַׁלֵם כַּסְפָּא יָתִיב לְמָרוֹהִי וּמֵיתָא יְהֵי דִילֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: The owner of the pit must pay. He must compensate its owner with money, and the dead [animal] remains his [its original owner’s] possesion.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי יִגוֹף תּוֹר דִגְבַר יָת תּוֹרָא דְחַבְרֵהּ וִימוּת וִזַבְּנוּן יָת תּוֹרָא חַיָא וִיפַלְגוּן יָת כַּסְפֵּהּ וְאַף יָת דְמֵי מֵיתָא יְפַלְגוּן:
verses.ar_en: If a man’s ox injures his neighbor’s ox and it dies, they shall sell the live ox and divide the money received for it. They shall also divide [the value of] the dead animal.

verses.ar_he: אוֹ אִתְיְדַע אֲרֵי תוֹר נַגַח הוּא מֵאִתְּמַלֵי וּמִדְקַמוֹהִי וְלָא נָטְרֵהּ מָרֵהּ שַׁלָמָא יְשַׁלֵם תּוֹרָא חֲלַף תּוֹרָא וּמֵיתָא יְהֵא דִילֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: If it was known that it was a goring ox from yesterday and the day before, but he had not taken proper precaution to guard it, then he must pay full compensation, an ox for an ox. The dead [animal] remains in the possession [of its owner].

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יִגְנוּב גְבַר תּוֹר אוֹ אִמָר וְיִכְּסִנֵהּ אוֹ זַבְּנִנֵהּ חַמְשָׁא תוֹרִין יְשַׁלֵם חָלָף תּוֹרָא וְאַרְבַּע עָנָא חֳלָף אִמְרָא:
verses.ar_en: If a man steals an ox or a sheep, and then slaughters or sells it, he must pay five oxen for each ox, and four sheep for each sheep.

verses.ar_he: אִם בְּמַחְתַּרְתָּא יִשְׁתְּכַח גַנָבָא וְיִתְמְחֵי וִימוּת לֵית לֵהּ דָם:
verses.ar_en: If the thief is found [caught] while breaking in, and is struck and killed, there is no liability for his blood.

verses.ar_he: אִם עֵינָא דְסַהֲדַיָא נְפָלַת עֲלוֹהִי דְמָא לֵהּ שַׁלָמָא יְשַׁלֵם אִם לֵית לֵהּ וְיִזְדַבַּן בִּגְנֻבְתֵּהּ:
verses.ar_en: If the sun shone on him [eyes of witnesses fell upon him], there is liability for his blood. He must make full restitution. If he does not have [the means to do so], he shall be sold [as a slave to pay] for his theft.

verses.ar_he: אִם אִשְׁתְּכָחָא יִשְׁתְּכַח בִּידֵהּ גְנֻבְתָּא מִתּוֹר עַד חֲמַר עַד אִמַר דְאִנוּן חַיִין עַל חַד תְּרֵין יְשַׁלֵם:
verses.ar_en: If the stolen article is found in his hand [possession], whether it is an ox, donkey or sheep [that is alive], he must pay two live animals.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יאכִיל גְבַר חֲקַל אוֹ כְרָם וִישַׁלַח יָת בְּעִירֵהּ וְיֵיכוּל בַּחֲקַל אָחֳרָן שְׁפַר חַקְלֵהּ וּשְׁפַר כַּרְמֵהּ יְשַׁלֵם:
verses.ar_en: If he damages a field or vineyard with his animal—he lets his livestock loose, and [or] it feeds in another’s field—from his [own] prime field and prime vineyard he must compensate [the owner].

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי תִתַּפַּק נוּר וְיַשְׁכַּח כּוּבִין וְיֵיכוּל גְדִישִׁין אוֹ קֳמָא אוֹ חַקְלָא שַׁלָמָא יְשַׁלֵם דְאַדְלֵק יָת דְלֶקְתָּא:
verses.ar_en: If a fire goes out of control and finds [catches on] thorns, and then consumes bound or standing grain or a field, full restitution must be made by the one who started the fire.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יִתֵּן גְבַר לְחַבְרֵהּ כְּסַף אוֹ מָנִין לְמִטַר וְיִתְגַנְבוּן מִבֵּית גַבְרָא אִם יִשְׁתְּכַח גַנָבָא יְשַׁלֵם עַל חַד תְּרֵין:
verses.ar_en: If a man gives his neighbor money or articles to safeguard and they are stolen from the house of the [watch]man, if the thief is found, he must pay double.

verses.ar_he: אִם לָא יִשְׁתְּכַח גַנָבָא וְיִתְקָרֵב מָרֵי דְבֵיתָא לִקֳדָם דַיָנַיָא אִם לָא אוֹשִׁיט יְדֵהּ בְּמָא דִמְסַר לֵהּ חַבְרֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: If the thief is not found, the owner of the house [the watchman] must come before the judges [Beis Din], [to swear] that he did not lay a hand on his neighbor’s possessions [for his personal use] [that which his neighbor handed over to him].

verses.ar_he: עַל כָּל פִּתְגַם דְחוֹב עַל תּוֹר עַל חֲמַר עַל אִמָר עַל כְּסוּ עַל כָּל אֲבֶדְתָּא דִי יֵימַר אֲרֵי הוּא דֵין לִקֳדָם דַיָנַיָא יֵיעוֹל דִין תַּרְוֵיהוֹן דִי יְחַיְבוּן דַיָנַיָא יְשַׁלֵם עַל חַד תְּרֵין לְחַבְרֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: In every question of dishonesty whether it involves an ox, a donkey, a sheep, a garment, or anything that was [allegedly] lost of which [a witness] says, “This is it!” the claims of both parties must be brought to [before] the judges. The one whom the judges find guilty, must pay double restitution to his neighbor.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יִתֵּן גְבַר לְחַבְרֵהּ חֲמַר אוֹ תוֹר אוֹ אִמָר וְכָל בְּעִירָא לְמִטָּר וּמִית אוֹ אִתְּבַר אוֹ אִשְׁתְּבִי לֵית דְחָזֵי:
verses.ar_en: If a man gives his neighbor, a donkey, an ox, a sheep, or any animal for safeguarding; and it dies, or is injured, or is captured, and there is no eyewitness,

verses.ar_he: מוֹמָתָא דַיְיָ תְּהֵי בֵּין תַּרְוֵיהוֹן אִם לָא אוֹשִׁיט יְדֵהּ בְּמָא דִמְסַר לֵהּ חַבְרֵהּ וִיקַבֵּל מָרֵהּ מִנֵהּ מוֹמָתָא וְלָא יְשַׁלֵם:
verses.ar_en: an oath to Adonoy shall be between them, that he [the watcher] did not lay his hand on his neighbor’s possession [for his personal use] [that which his neighbor handed over to him]. The owner must accept it [the oath], and [the watcher] need not make restitution.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם אִתְגְנָבָא יִתְגְנֵב מֵעִמֵהּ יְשַׁלֵם לְמָרוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: But if it was indeed stolen from him, he must make restitution to its owner.

verses.ar_he: אִם אִתְּבָרָא יִתְּבַר יַיְתִי סַהֲדִין דִתְבִירָא לָא יְשַׁלֵם:
verses.ar_en: If it was torn apart [killed by wild beasts], he [the watcher] must provide witnesses [that is was torn apart]. He then need not pay for that which was torn apart.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי יִשְׁאַל גְבַר מִן חַבְרֵהּ וְיִתְּבַר אוֹ מִית מָרֵהּ לֵית עִמֵהּ שַׁלָמָא יְשַׁלֵם:
verses.ar_en: If a man borrows something from his neighbor, and it becomes broken or dies; if the owner is not [involved] with him, he [the borrower] must make full restitution.

verses.ar_he: אִם מָרֵהּ עִמֵהּ לָא יְשַׁלֵם אִם אֲגִירָא הוּא עַל בְּאַגְרֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: If the owner is [involved] with him, then he [the borrower] need not make restitution. If it was hired, it [the ox] comes in its rental price.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲרֵי יְשַׁדֵל גְבַר בְּתֻלְתָּא דִּי לָא מְאַרְסָא וְיִשְׁכּוּב עִמַהּ קַיָמָא יְקַיְמִנַהּ לֵהּ לְאִנְתּוּ:
verses.ar_en: If a man seduces a virgin who is not betrothed, and lies with her; he must give the dowry to acquire [establish] her as his wife.

verses.ar_he: אִם מִצְבָּא לָא יִצְבֵּי אֲבוּהָא לְמִתְּנַהּ לֵהּ כַּסְפָּא יִתְקוֹל כְּמוֹהֲרֵי בְּתֻלְתָּא:
verses.ar_en: If her father utterly refuses to give her to him, he must give [the father] the weight of silver equal to the dowry usually given to virgins.

verses.ar_he: חָרָשָׁא לָא תָחֵי:
verses.ar_en: You shall not allow a witch to live.

verses.ar_he: כָּל דְיִשְׁכּוּב עִם בְּעִירָא אִתְקְטָלָא יִתְקְטֵל:
verses.ar_en: Whoever lies with an animal must be put to death.

verses.ar_he: דְדַבַּח לְטַעְוַת עַמְמַיָא יִתְקְטֵל אֶלָהֵן לִשְׁמָא דַיְיָ בִּלְחוֹדוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: Whoever slaughters to a god [false gods of the peoples] must be condemned [to die]. [Sacrifices may be offered] to [the Name of] Adonoy alone.

verses.ar_he: וְגִיוֹרָא לָא תוֹנוּן וְלָא תְעִיקוּן לֵהּ אֲרֵי דַיָרִין הֱוֵיתוּן בְּאַרְעָא דְמִצְרָיִם:
verses.ar_en: You must not abuse or oppress a stranger, for you were strangers in the land of Egypt.

verses.ar_he: כָּל אַרְמְלָא וְיִתָּם לָא תְעַנוּן:
verses.ar_en: You must not mistreat any widow or orphan.

verses.ar_he: אִם עַנָאָה תְעַנֵי יָתֵהּ אֲרֵי אִם מִקְבַל יִקְבֵל קֳדָמַי קַבָּלָא אֱקַבֵּל קְבִלְתֵּהּ:
verses.ar_en: If you do mistreat him [them], when he cries out to [before] Me, I will indeed hear [obey] his cry.

verses.ar_he: וְיִתְקֵף רוּגְזִי וְאֶקְטוֹל יָתְכוֹן בְּחַרְבָּא וִיהֶוְיָן נְשֵׁיכוֹן אַרְמְלִין וּבְנֵיכוֹן יַתְמִין:
verses.ar_en: Then I will cause My anger to flare, and I will kill you by the sword. Your wives will become widows and your children will be orphans.

verses.ar_he: אִם כַּסְפָּא תּוֹזֵף בְּעַמִי לְּעַנְיָא דִי עִמָךְ לָא תְהֵי לֵהּ כְּרַשְׁיָא לָא תְשַׁוּוֹן עֲלוֹהִי חִבּוּלְיָא:
verses.ar_en: When you lend money to My people, to the poor person who is with [among] you, do not act toward him as a [demanding] creditor. Do not place the burden of interest [an injury] upon him.

verses.ar_he: אִם מַשְׁכּוֹנָא תִסַב כְּסוּתָא דְחַבְרָךְ עַד מֵעַל שִׁמְשָׁא תְּתִיבִנֵהּ לֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: If you take your neighbor’s garment as security, you must return it to him till sunset;

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי הִיא כְסוּתֵהּ בִּלְחוֹדַהּ הִיא תוֹתְבֵהּ לְמַשְׁכֵּיהּ בְּמָא יִשְׁכּוּב וִיהֵי אֲרֵי יִקְבֵל קֳדָמַי וֶאֱקַבֵּל קְבִלְתֵּהּ אֲרֵי חַנָנָא אֲנָא:
verses.ar_en: For this alone is his covering, the garment [to cover] his skin. With what shall he lie down [to sleep]? If it happens that he cries out to [before] Me, I will hear [obey] [his cry] for I am gracious.

verses.ar_he: דַיָנָא לָא תְקִיל וְרַבָּא בְעַמָךְ לָא תְלוּט:
verses.ar_en: Do not curse judges. Do not curse a leader of your people.

verses.ar_he: בִּכּוּרָךְ וְדִמְעָךְ לָא תְאַחֵר בּוּכְרָא דִבְנָיךְ תַּפְרֵשׁ קֳדָמָי:
verses.ar_en: [Your offering of] the fullness [of your newly ripened produce] and of your terumah-offering’s you must not delay. The first-born of your sons, you shall give to [separate before] Me.

verses.ar_he: כֵּן תַּעְבֵּד לְתוֹרָךְ לְעָנָךְ שִׁבְעָא יוֹמִין יְהֵי עִם אִמֵהּ בְּיוֹמָא תְמִינָאָה תִּפְרְשִׁנֵהּ קֳדָמָי:
verses.ar_en: You must do likewise with your oxen and with your sheep. Seven days it shall remain with its mother. On the eighth day you must give it to [separate it before] Me.

verses.ar_he: וֶאֱנָשִׁין קַדִישִׁין תְּהוֹן קֳדָמָי וּבְשַׂר תְּלִישׁ מִן חֵיוָא חַיְתָא לָא תֵיכְלוּן לְכַלְבָּא תִּרְמוּן יָתֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: You shall be men of holiness to [before] Me, and you must not eat flesh that was torn off in the field [from a living animal]. Throw it to the dog.

verses.ar_he: לָא תְקַבֵּל שְׁמַע דִשְׁקָר לָא תְשַׁוִי יְדָךְ עִם חַיָבָא לְמֶהֱוֵי לֵהּ סָהִיד שְׁקָר:
verses.ar_en: Do not accept a false report. Do not join hands with a wicked man to be a corrupt [false] witness [for him].

verses.ar_he: לָא תְהֵי בָּתַר סַגִיאִין לְאַבְאָשָׁא וְלָא תִתִּמְנַע מִלְאַלָפָא מָא דִבְעֵינָךְ עַל דִינָא בָּתַר סַגִיאֵי שְׁלַם דִינָא:
verses.ar_en: Do not follow the majority to do evil. Do not respond with your opinion in a dispute [merely] to lean [toward one side] [(Do not) refrain from teaching what is proper in your eyes regarding a judgment]. It must be decided by the majority.

verses.ar_he: וְעַל מִסְכֵּינָא לָא תְרַחֵם בְּדִינֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: Do not show favor [even] to the poor in his dispute [judgment].

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי תִפְגַע תּוֹרָא דְסָנְאָךְ אוֹ חֲמָרֵהּ דְטָּעֵי אָתָבָא תְּתִיבִנֵהּ לֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: If you come across your enemy’s ox or his donkey going astray, bring it back to him.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי תֶחֱזֵי חֲמָרָא דְסָנְאָךְ רְבִיעַ תְּחוֹת טוֹעֲנֵיהּ וְתִתִּמְנַע מִלְמִשְׁבַּק לֵהּ מִשְׁבַּק תִּשְׁבּוֹק מָא דִבְלִבָּךְ עֲלוֹהִי וּתְפָרֵק עִמֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: If you see the donkey of your enemy lying under its burden, and you might not want to help him [stop yourself from abandoning him], [but you should] [[you should]] make every effort to help him [abandon what is in you heart against him and unload with him] .

verses.ar_he: לָא תַצְלֵי דִין מִסְכֵּינָךְ בְּדִינֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: Do not bend justice [even] for your needy in his dispute.

verses.ar_he: מִפִּתְגָמָא דְשִׁקְרָא הֱוֵי רָחִיק וְדִזְכֵי וְדִי נְפַק (דְכֵי) מִן דִינָא לָא תִקְטוֹל אֲרֵי לָא אֱזַכֵּי חַיָבָא:
verses.ar_en: Keep far away from anything false. Do not kill an [one who is] innocent [or one who goes out innocent from judgment] righteous man, for I will not acquit a wicked person.

verses.ar_he: וְשׁוֹחֲדָא לָא תְקַבֵּל אֲרֵי שׁוֹחֲדָא מְעַוֵר עֵינֵי חַכִּימִין וּמְקַלְקֵל פִּתְגָמִין תְּרִיצִין:
verses.ar_en: Do not accept bribery, for bribery blinds the clear-sighted [eyes of the wise], and perverts the words of justice.

verses.ar_he: וְגִיוֹרָא לָא תְעִיקוּן וְאַתּוּן יְדַעְתּוּן יָת נַפְשָׁא דְגִיוֹרָא אֲרֵי דַיָרִין הֲוֵיתוּן בְּאַרְעָא דְמִצְרָיִם:
verses.ar_en: Do not oppress a stranger. You [should] know the soul [feelings] of the stranger, for you were strangers in the land of Egypt.

verses.ar_he: וְשִׁית שְׁנִין תִּזְרַע יָת אַרְעָךְ וְתִכְנוֹשׁ יָת עֲלַלְתַּהּ:
verses.ar_en: You may sow your land for six years, and gather its crops.

verses.ar_he: וּשְׁבִעֵתָא תַּשְׁמְטִּנַהּ וְתַרְטְשִׁנַהּ וְיֵיכְלוּן מִסְכְּנֵי עַמָךְ וּשְׁאָרְהוֹן תֵּיכוּל חֵיוַת בָּרָא כֵּן תַּעְבֵּד לְכַרְמָךְ לְזֵיתָךְ:
verses.ar_en: But on the seventh [year] you must let it rest, and abandon it [by not eating its produce], and let the needy among your people eat it. What they leave over, the beasts of the field can eat. Do the same with your vineyard and your olive [trees].

verses.ar_he: שִׁתָּא יוֹמִין תַּעְבֵּד עוֹבָדָיךְ וּבְיוֹמָא שְׁבִיעָאָה תָּנוּחַ בְּדִיל דִינוּחַ תּוֹרָךְ וְחַמָרָךְ וְיִשְּׁקוֹט בַּר אַמְתָךְ וְגִיוֹרָא:
verses.ar_en: You may do your work six days, but on the seventh day you must cease; so that your ox and your donkey may rest, and the son of your female slave may be refreshed, and [also] the stranger.

verses.ar_he: וּבְכֹל דִי אֲמָרִית לְכוֹן תִּסְתַּמְרוּן וְשׁוּם טַעֲוַת עַמְמַיָא לָא תִדְכְּרוּן לָא יִשְׁתְּמַע עַל פּוּמְכוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Preserve everything that I have said to you. Do not mention the name of other [false] gods [of the peoples]. You must not cause it to be heard through your mouth.

verses.ar_he: תְּלַת זִמְנִין תֵּחוֹג קֳדָמַי בְּשַׁתָּא:
verses.ar_en: Three times a year you are to celebrate with [before] Me.

verses.ar_he: יָת חַגָא דְפַטִירַיָא תִּטַר שִׁבְעָא יוֹמִין תֵּיכוּל פַּטִירָא כְּמָא דִפַקֵידִתָּךְ לִזְמַן יַרְחָא דַאֲבִיבָא אֲרֵי בֵהּ נְפַקְתָּ מִמִצְרָיִם וְלָא יִתְחֲזוּן קֳדָמַי רֵיקָנוּן:
verses.ar_en: You must keep the festival of Matzos. You must eat matzos for seven days, as I have commanded you. [This festival must be celebrated] at the appointed time, during the month when the grain is ripened, for in it [at this time] you went out of Egypt. Do not appear before My Presence [Me] empty-handed.

verses.ar_he: וְחַגָא דַחֲצָדָא בִּכּוּרֵי עוֹבָדָיךְ דִי תִזְרַע בְּחַקְלָא וְחַגָא דִכְנָשָׁא בְּמִפְּקָא דְשַׁתָּא בְּמִכְנְשָׁךְ יָת עוֹבָדָיךְ מִן חַקְלָא:
verses.ar_en: [You must also keep] the Festival of Harvest, [with bringing bikurim] the first fruits of your labor, which you planted in the field; [also] the Festival of Ingathering, at the close of the year, when you gather in [the fruits of] your labor from the field.

verses.ar_he: תְּלַת זִמְנִין בְּשַׁתָּא יִתְחֲזוּן כָּל דְכוּרָךְ קֳדָם רִבּוֹן עָלְמָא יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: Three times a year, every male among you must appear before the Presence of the Master [of the world], Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: לָא תִכּוֹס עַל חֲמִיעַ דַם פִּסְחִי וְלָא יְבִיתוּן בַּר מִן מַדְבְּחָא תַּרְבֵּי נִכְסַת חַגָא עַד צַפְרָא:
verses.ar_en: You must not sacrifice—while chometz is present—My [Pesach] sacrifice. You must not allow to remain overnight [off the Altar]—the fat[s] of My [the] festival-offering—until morning.

verses.ar_he: רֵישׁ בִּכּוּרֵי אַרְעָךְ תַּיְתִי לְבֵית מִקְדְשָׁא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לָא תֵיכְלוּן בְּשַׂר בַּחֲלָב:
verses.ar_en: The beginning of the first fruits of your land must be brought to the House of [the Sanctuary of] Adonoy, your God. You must not cook a young animal in the milk of its mother [eat meat with milk].

verses.ar_he: הָא אֲנָא שָׁלַח מַלְאָכָא קֳדָמָךְ לְמִטְרָךְ בְּאָרְחָא וּלְאָעֳלוּתָךְ לְאַתְרָא דִאַתְקֵנִית:
verses.ar_en: Behold, I will send an angel before you, to guard you on the way, and to bring you to the place that I have prepared.

verses.ar_he: אִסְתַּמַּר מִן קֳדָמוֹהִי וְקַבֵּל לְמֵימְרֵהּ לָא תְסָרֵב לְקִבְלֵהּ אֲרֵי לָא יִשְׁבּוֹק לְחוֹבֵיכוֹן אֲרֵי בִשְׁמִי מֵימְרֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: Be careful in his presence and heed [obey] his voice [word]. Do not rebel against him; for he cannot bear [pardon] your transgression, as [in] My Name is in him [his word].

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי אִם קַבָּלָא תְקַבֵּל לְמֵימְרֵהּ וְתַעְבֵּד כֹּל דִאֱמַלֵל וְאֶסְנֵי יָת סָנְאָךְ וְאָעִיק לְדִמְעִיקִין לָךְ:
verses.ar_en: But if you truly listen to [obey] his voice [word], and do all that I speak, then I will be an enemy to your enemies, and attack those who attack you.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יְהַךְ מַלְאָכִי קֳדָמָךְ וְיָעֵלִנָךְ לְוָת אֱמוֹרָאֵי וְחִתָּאֵי וּפְרִיזָאֵי וּכְנַעֲנָאֵי חִוָאֵי וִיבוּסָאֵי וֶאֱשֵׁצִנוּן:
verses.ar_en: My messenger will go before you, and will bring you into [the land of] the Emorites, the Chittites, the Perizzites, the Canaanites, Chivites, and the Yevusites, and I will then annihilate them.

verses.ar_he: לָא תִסְגוּד לְטַעֲוָתְהוֹן וְלָא תִפְלְחִנוּן וְלָא תַעְבֵּד כְּעוֹבָדֵיהוֹן אֲרֵי פַגָרָא תְּפַגְרִנוּן וְתַבָּרָא תְתַבַּר קָמָתְהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: You must not prostrate yourself to their [false] gods, nor serve [sacrifice to] them. You must not adopt their customs. You must totally destroy [their idols] and completely break down their monuments.

verses.ar_he: וְתִפְלְחוּן קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהֲכוֹן וִיבָרֵךְ יָת מֵיכְלָךְ וְיָת מִשְׁתְּיָךְ וְאַעְדִי מַרְעִין בִּישִׁין מִבֵּינָךְ:
verses.ar_en: You must serve [before] Adonoy, your God, and He will bless your bread [food] and your water [drink]. I will eliminate [bad] sickness from your midst.

verses.ar_he: לָא תְהֵי מְתַכְּלָא וְעַקְרָא בְּאַרְעָךְ יָת מִנְיַן יוֹמָיךְ אַשְׁלִים:
verses.ar_en: No woman will suffer miscarriage or remain childless in your land. I will cause the number of your days to be full.

verses.ar_he: יָת אֵימְתִי אֲשַׁלַח קֳדָמָךְ ואֶתְּפַר (נ״‎א וֶאֱשַׁגֵשׁ) יָת כָּל עַמָא דְאַתְּ אָתֵי לַאֲגָחָא בְּהוֹן וְאֶמְסַר יָת כָּל בַּעֲלֵי דְבָבָךְ קֳדָמָךְ מְחַזְרֵי קְדָל:
verses.ar_en: I will send My dread ahead of you, and I will bring panic to all the people among whom you will come [to fight against]. I will make all your enemies turn their backs to [before] you.

verses.ar_he: וְאֶשְׁלַח יָת עֲרָעִיתָא קֳדָמָךְ וּתְתָרֵךְ יָת חִוָאֵי יָת כְּנַעֲנָאֵי וְיָת חִתָּאֵי מִן קֳדָמָךְ:
verses.ar_en: I will send [deadly] hornets ahead of you, and they will drive out the Chivites, the Canaanites, and the Chittites from before you.

verses.ar_he: לָא אֱתָרֵכִנוּן מִן קֳדָמָךְ בְּשַׁתָּא חֲדָא דִילְמָא תְהֵי אַרְעָא צַדְיָא וְתִסְגֵי עֲלָךְ חֵיוַת בָּרָא:
verses.ar_en: I will not drive them out in a single year, lest the land become desolate, and the beasts of the field multiply against you.

verses.ar_he: זְעֵיר זְעֵיר אֱתָרֵכִנוּן מִן קֳדָמָךְ עַד דְתִסְגֵי וְתַחְסֵן יָת אַרְעָא:
verses.ar_en: Little by little I will drive them from before you, until you have increased and occupy the land.

verses.ar_he: וֶאֱשַׁוֵי יָת תְּחוּמָךְ מִיַמָא דְסוּף וְעַד יַמָא דִפְלִשְׁתָּאֵי וּמִמַדְבְּרָא עַד פְּרָת אֲרֵי אֶמְסַר בִּידֵיכוֹן יָת יָתְבֵי אַרְעָא וּתְתָרֵכִנוּן מִן קֳדָמָךְ:
verses.ar_en: I will set your borders from the Reed Sea to the Philistine Sea, and from the desert to the [Euphrates] river, for I will deliver into your hands all the inhabitants of the land, and you will drive them away before you.

verses.ar_he: לָא תִגְזַר לְהוֹן וּלְּטַעֲוָתְהוֹן קְיָם:
verses.ar_en: Do not make a pact with them or with their [false] gods.

verses.ar_he: לָא יֵתְבוּן בְּאַרְעָךְ דִילְמָא יְחַיְבוּן יָתָךְ קֳדָמָי אֲרֵי תִפְלַח יָת טַעֲוָתְהוֹן אֲרֵי יְהוֹן לָךְ לְתַקְלָא:
verses.ar_en: Do not allow them to live in your land, since they may cause you to sin to [before] Me; that you [might] worship their [false] gods, and this would be a [fatal] trap to you.

verses.ar_he: וּלְמשֶׁה אֲמַר סַק לִקֳדָם יְיָ אַתְּ וְאַהֲרֹן נָדָב וַאֲבִיהוּא וְשִׁבְעִין מִסָבֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְתִסְגְדוּן מֵרָחִיק:
verses.ar_en: He [God] had said to Moshe, ‘Go up to [the Presence of] [before] Adonoy, you, Aharon, Nadav, Avihu, and seventy of the elders of [the B’nei] Yisrael, and prostrate yourselves at a distance.

verses.ar_he: וְיִתְקְרֵב משֶׁה בִלְחוֹדוֹהִי לִקֳדָם יְיָ וְאִנוּן לָא יִתְקָרְבוּן וְעַמָא לָא יִסְקוּן עִמֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: Moshe alone shall approach [the Presence of] [before] Adonoy, but they must not approach, and the people must not go up with him.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתָא משֶׁה וְאִשְׁתָּעִי לְעַמָא יָת כָּל פִּתְגָמַיָא דַיְיָ וְיָת כָּל דִינַיָא וַאֲתֵיב כָּל עַמָא קָלָא חַד וַאֲמָרוּ כָּל פִּתְגָמַיָא דִי מַלִיל יְיָ נַעְבֵּד:
verses.ar_en: Moshe came and told the people all the words of Adonoy, and all the laws. The people responded with one voice and said, “All the words that Adonoy has spoken, we will do.”

verses.ar_he: וּכְתַב משֶׁה יָת כָּל פִּתְגָמַיָא דַיְיָ וְאַקְדֵם בְּצַפְרָא וּבְנָא מַדְבְּחָא בְּשִׁפּוֹלֵי טוּרָא וְתַרְתָּא עֶשְׂרֵי קָמָן לִתְרֵי עֲסַר שִׁבְטַיָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל:
verses.ar_en: Moshe wrote down all the words of Adonoy. He arose early in the morning, and built an altar beneath [at the foot of] the mountain, and [also] twelve monuments [pillars] for the twelve tribes of [the B’nei] Yisrael.

verses.ar_he: וּשְׁלַח יָת בּוּכְרֵי בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאַסִיקוּ עֲלָוָן וְקָרִיבוּ נִכְסַת קוּדְשִׁין קֳדָם יְיָ תּוֹרִין:
verses.ar_en: He sent the youths [first-born] of B’nei Yisrael and they offered burnt-offerings, and sacrificed oxen as peace-offerings to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וּנְסִיב משֶׁה פַּלְגוּת דְמָא וְשַׁוִי בְּמִזְרְקַיָא וּפַלְגוּת דְמָא זְרַק עַל מַדְבְּחָא:
verses.ar_en: Moshe took half the blood and put it in the basins, and [the other] half the blood he sprinkled on the altar.

verses.ar_he: וּנְסִיב סִפְרָא דִקְיָמָא וּקְרָא קֳדָם עַמָא וַאֲמָרוּ כֹּל דִי מַלִיל יְיָ נַעְבֵּד וּנְקַבֵּל:
verses.ar_en: He then took the Book of the Covenant, and read it in the ears of [before] the people. They said, “All that Adonoy has spoken, we will do and we will listen [obey].”

verses.ar_he: וּנְסִיב משֶׁה יָת דְמָא וּזְרַק עַל מַדְבְּחָא לְכַפָּרָא עַל עַמָא וַאֲמַר הָא דֵין דָם קְיָמָא דִגְזַר יְיָ עִמְכוֹן עַל כָּל פִּתְגָמַיָא הָאִלֵין:
verses.ar_en: Moshe then took the blood and cast it on the [Altar to atone on behalf of the] people, and he said, “Behold, this is the blood of the covenant which Adonoy has made with you regarding all these words.”

verses.ar_he: וּסְלֵיק משֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן נָדָב וַאֲבִיהוּא וְשִׁבְעִין מִסָבֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל:
verses.ar_en: Moshe and Aharon then went up along with Nadav and Avihu, and seventy of the elders of [the B’nei] Yisrael.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזוֹ יָת יְקַר אֱלָהָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל וּתְחוֹת כָּרְסָא יְקָרֵהּ כְּעוֹבַד אֶבֶן טָבָא וּכְמֶחֱזֵי שְׁמַיָא לְבָרִירוּ:
verses.ar_en: They saw [a vision of] the [Glory of the] God of Yisrael, and under His feet [the throne of His Glory] [there was something] like a brickwork of sapphire [precious stone], and it was like the essence [image] of heaven in purity.

verses.ar_he: וּלְרַבְרְבֵי בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לָא הֲוָה נִזְקָא וַחֲזוֹ יָת יְקָרָא דַיְיָ וַהֲווֹ חָדָן בְּקָרְבָּנֵיהוֹן דְאִתְקַבָּלוּ בְּרַעֲוָא כְּאִלוּ אָכְלִין וְשָׁתָן:
verses.ar_en: But against the nobility of the B’nei Yisrael, He [God] did not send His hand [there was no damage]. They envisioned [saw the Glory of] God, and they [rejoiced in their sacrifices which were accepted graciously as if they] ate and drank.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה סַק לִקֳדָמַי לְטוּרָא וֶהֱוֵי תַמָן וְאֶתֵּן לָךְ יָת לוּחֵי אַבְנָא וְאוֹרַיְתָא וְתַפְקֶדְתָּא דִכְתָבִית לְאַלוּפֵיהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy then said to Moshe, “Come up to [before] Me to the mountain and remain there. I will give you the tablets of stone, the Torah and the commandment, which I have written [in order] to teach them.”

verses.ar_he: וְקָם משֶׁה וִיהוֹשֻׁעַ מְשֻׁמְשָׁנֵהּ וּסְלֵיק משֶׁה לְטוּרָא דְאִתְגְלִי עֲלוֹהִי יְקָרָא דַיְיָ:
verses.ar_en: Moshe and Yehoshua, his attendant, set out, but [only] Moshe went up to the mountain [upon which the Glory] of God [was revealed].

verses.ar_he: וּלְסָבַיָא אֲמַר אוֹרִיכוּ לָנָא הָכָא עַד דִנְתוּב לְוָתְכוֹן וְהָא אַהֲרֹן וְחוּר עִמְכוֹן מָן דְאִית לֵהּ דִינָא יִתְקְרֵב לִקֳדָמֵיהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: He [Moshe] said to the elders, “Wait here for us until we return to you, and Aharon and Chur will be with you. Whoever has a claim can approach [before] them.”

verses.ar_he: וּסְלֵק משֶׁה לְטוּרָא וַחֲפָא עֲנָנָא יָת טוּרָא:
verses.ar_en: Moshe went up to the mountain, and the cloud covered the mountain.

verses.ar_he: וּשְׁרָא יְקָרָא דַיְיָ עַל טוּרָא דְסִינַי וַחֲפָהִי עֲנָנָא שִׁתָּא יוֹמִין וּקְרָא לְמשֶׁה בְּיוֹמָא שְׁבִיעָאָה מִגוֹ עֲנָנָא:
verses.ar_en: The glory of Adonoy rested on Mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it for six days. On the seventh day, He called to Moshe from the midst of the cloud.

verses.ar_he: וְחֵיזוּ יְקָרָא דַיְיָ כְּחֵיזוּ אֶשָׁא אָכְלָא בְּרֵישׁ טוּרָא לְעֵינֵי בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל:
verses.ar_en: The appearance of Adonoy’s glory was like [the appearance of] a consuming flame at the top to the mountain; before the eyes of the B’nei Yisrael.

verses.ar_he: וְעַל משֶׁה בְּגוֹ עֲנָנָא וּסְלֵיק לְטוּרָא וַהֲוָה משֶׁה בְּטּוּרָא אַרְבְּעִין יְמָמִין וְאַרְבְּעִין לֵילָוָן:
verses.ar_en: And Moshe came into the midst of the cloud. and went up into the mountain. Moshe remained on the mountain for forty days and forty nights.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם משֶׁה לְמֵימָר:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe saying,

verses.ar_he: מַלֵיל עִם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְיַפְרְשׁוּן קֳדָמַי אַפְרָשׁוּתָא מִן כָּל גְבַר דִי יִתִּרְעֵי לִבֵּהּ תִּסְבוּן יָת אַפְרָשׁוּתִי:
verses.ar_en: Speak to the B’nei Yisrael and have them take for [separate before] Me a terumah-offering. From every man whose heart impels him to generosity shall you take My terumah-offering.

verses.ar_he: וְדָא אַפְרָשׁוּתָא דִתִסְבוּן מִנְהוֹן דַהֲבָא וְכַסְפָּא וּנְחָשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: This is the terumah-offering that you shall take from them: gold, silver and copper.

verses.ar_he: וְתִכְלָא וְאַרְגְוָנָא וּצְבַע זְהוֹרִי וּבוּץ וּמֵעַזֵי:
verses.ar_en: Greenish-blue [wool], dark red [wool], crimson [colored] [wool], fine linen, and goats [hair].

verses.ar_he: וּמַשְׁכֵי דְדִכְרֵי מְסַמְקֵי וּמַשְׁכֵי סַסְגוֹנָא וְאָעֵי שִׁטִין:
verses.ar_en: Red[-dyed] ram’s skins, tachash [multicolored] skins, and acacia wood.

verses.ar_he: מִשְׁחָא לְאַנְהָרוּתָא בּוּסְמַיָא לְמִשְׁחָא דִרְבוּתָא וְלִקְטוֹרֶת בּוּסְמַיָא:
verses.ar_en: Oil for the lamp. Spices for anointing-oil, and for the incense of aromatic spices.

verses.ar_he: אַבְנֵי בוּרְלָא וְאַבְנֵי אַשְׁלָמוּתָא לְשַׁקָעָא בְאֵפוֹדָא וּבְחוּשְׁנָא:
verses.ar_en: Onyx stones, and filling stones [for setting] [into] the eiphod and breastplate.

verses.ar_he: וְיַעְבְּדוּן קֳדָמַי מִקְדְשָׁא וְאַשְׁרֵי שְׁכִנְתִּי בֵּינֵיהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: They shall make a Sanctuary for [before] Me, and I will [then] dwell in their midst [rest My Shechina among them].

verses.ar_he: כְּכֹל דִי אֲנָא מַחֲזֵי יָתָךְ יָת דְמוּת מַשְׁכְּנָא וְיָת דְמוּת כָּל מָנוֹהִי וְכֵן תַּעְבְּדוּן:
verses.ar_en: According to all that I am showing you—the form of the mishkon [tabernacle] and the form of all its vessels—and so should you make [it].

verses.ar_he: וְיַעְבְּדוּן אֲרוֹנָא דְאָעֵי שִׁטִּין תַּרְתֵּין אַמִין וּפַלְגָא אֻרְכֵּהּ וְאַמְתָא וּפַלְגָא פְּתָיֵהּ וְאַמְתָא וּפַלְגָא רוּמֵה:
verses.ar_en: They shall make an ark of acacia wood, two and one-half amohs long, one and one-half amohs wide, and one and one-half amohs high.

verses.ar_he: וְתֶחֱפֵי יָתֵהּ דְהַב דְכֵי מִגָו וּמִבָּרָא תַּחֲפִנֵהּ וְתַעְבֵּד עֲלוֹהִי זֵיר דִדְהַב סְחוֹר סְחוֹר:
verses.ar_en: Cover it with pure gold—you shall cover it inside and out. Make for it a golden crown-like rim around [its top].

verses.ar_he: וְתַתִּיךְ לֵהּ אַרְבַּע עִזְקָן דִדְהַב וְתִתֵּן עַל אַרְבַּע זִוְיָתֵהּ וְתַרְתֵּין עִזְקָן עַל סִטְרֵהּ חַד וְתַרְתֵּן עִזְקָן עַל סִטְרֵהּ תִּנְיֵתָא:
verses.ar_en: Cast four gold rings, and place them on its [the ark’s] four corners, two rings on one side, and two rings on the second side.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד אֲרִיחֵי דְאָעֵי שִׁטִּין וְתַחֲפֵי יָתְהוֹן דַהֲבָא:
verses.ar_en: Make [two] poles of acacia wood, and cover them with gold.

verses.ar_he: וְתָעֵל יָת אֲרִיחֲיָא בְּעִזְקָתָא עַל סִטְרֵי אֲרוֹנָא לְמִטַל יָת אֲרוֹנָא בְּהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Place the poles in the rings on the sides of the ark, so that the ark can be carried with them.

verses.ar_he: בְּעִזְקְתָא דַאֲרוֹנָא יְהוֹן אֲרִיחַיָא לָא יְעִדוּן מִנֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: In the rings of the ark, must the poles remain. They must not be removed from them.

verses.ar_he: וְתִתֵּן בַּאֲרוֹנָא יָת סַהֲדוּתָא דִי אֶתֵּן לָךְ:
verses.ar_en: You shall then place in the ark, the Testimony that I will give you.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד כַּפֻּרְתָּא דִדְהַב דְכֵי תַּרְתֵּין אַמִין וּפַלְגָא אֻרְכַּהּ וְאַמְתָא וּפַלְגָא פְּתָיַהּ:
verses.ar_en: Make a cover of pure gold [for the ark], two and one-half amohs long, and one and one-half amohs wide.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד תְּרֵין כְּרוּבִין דִדְהָב נְגִיד תַּעְבֵּד יָתְהוֹן מִתְּרֵין סִטְרֵי כַפֻּרְתָּא:
verses.ar_en: Make two golden cherubim. You must make them by hammering them out of the two ends of the [ark] cover.

verses.ar_he: וְעִבֵּד כְּרוּבָא חַד מִסִטְרָא מִכָּא וּכְרוּבָא חַד מִסִטְרָא מִכָּא מִן כַּפֻּרְתָּא תַּעְבְּדוּן יָת כְּרוּבַיָא עַל תְּרֵין סִטְרוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: Make one cherub out of one end [side], and one cherub out of the other end [side]. From the [same piece of gold as] the cover itself, you shall make the cherubim on its two ends [sides].

verses.ar_he: וִיהוֹן כְּרוּבַיָא פְּרִיסָן גַדְפֵיהוֹן לְעֵלָא מְטַלִין בְּגַדְפֵהוֹן עַל כַּפֻּרְתָּא וְאַפֵּיהוֹן חַד לָקֳבֵל חַד לָקֳבֵל כַּפֻּרְתָּא יְהוֹן אַפֵי כְרוּבַיָא:
verses.ar_en: The cherubim shall spread their wings upward, sheltering the cover with their wings, and the cherubim shall face one another. Their faces shall be [inclined] toward the cover.

verses.ar_he: וְתִתֵּן יָת כַּפֻּרְתָּא עַל אֲרוֹנָא מִלְעֵלָא וּבַאֲרוֹנָא תִּתֵּן יָת סַהֲדוּתָא דִי אֶתֵּן לָךְ:
verses.ar_en: Place the cover on top of the ark and place the Testimony in the ark that I will give you.

verses.ar_he: וֶאֱזַמֵן מֵימְרִי לָךְ תַּמָן וֶאֱמַלֵל עִמָךְ מֵעִלָוֵי כַפֻּרְתָּא מִבֵּין תְּרֵין כְּרוּבַיָא דִי עַל אֲרוֹנָא דְסַהֲדוּתָא יָת כָּל דִי אֲפַקֵד יָתָךְ לְוָת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל:
verses.ar_en: I will set [prepare] My meetings [Word] with you there, and I will speak with you from above the cover, from between the cherubim that are on the Ark of the Testimony. All that which I will command you concerning the B’nei Yisrael.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד פָּתוֹרָא דְאָעֵי שִׁטִּין תַּרְתֵּין אַמִין אֻרְכֵּהּ וְאַמְתָא פְתָיֵהּ וְאַמְתָא וּפַלְגָא רוּמֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: You shall make a table out of acacia wood, two amohs will be its length, one amoh will be its width, and one and one-half amohs its height.

verses.ar_he: וְתַחֲפֵי יָתֵהּ דְהַב דְכֵי וְתַעְבֵּד לֵהּ זֵיר דִדְהַב סְחוֹר סְחוֹר:
verses.ar_en: Overlay it with pure gold, and make a gold crown-like rim around it.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד לֵהּ גְדַנְפָא רוּמֵהּ פֻּשְׁכָּא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר וְתַעְבֵּד זֵיר דִדְהַב לִגְדַנְפֵהּ סְחוֹר סְחוֹר:
verses.ar_en: Make a ledge of a tefach [high] around [the table], and make a gold crown-like rim around the ledge.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד לֵהּ אַרְבַּע עִזְקָן דִדְהָב וְתִתֵּן יָת עִזְקָתָא עַל אַרְבַּע זִיוְיָתָא דִי לְאַרְבַּע רַגְלוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: Make four gold rings [for the table], and place the rings on the four corners that are on its legs.

verses.ar_he: לָקֳבֵל גְדַנְפָא יְהֶוְיָן עִזְקָתָא לְאַתְרָא לַאֲרִיחַיָא לְמִטַל יָת פָּתוֹרָא:
verses.ar_en: The rings shall be against the ledge, and they shall be houses [receptacles] for the poles with which to carry the table.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד יָת אֲרִיחַיָא דְאָעֵי שִׁיטִין וְתַחֲפֵי יָתְהוֹן דַהֲבָא וִיהוֹן נָטְלִין בְּהוֹן יָת פָּתוֹרָא:
verses.ar_en: Make the poles out of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold. The table will be carried by them.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד מָגִיסוֹהִי וּבָזִכּוֹהִי וְקַסְוָתֵהּ וּמְכִילָתֵהּ דְיִתְנַסַךְ בְּהֵן דְהַב דְכֵי תַּעְבֵּד יָתְהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Make its dishes [bread forms], spoons, its half-hollow tubes, and its supports, by which they [the breads] shall be covered. Make them out of pure gold.

verses.ar_he: וְתִתֵּן עַל פָּתוֹרָא לְחֵם אַפַּיָא קֳדָמַי תְּדִירָא:
verses.ar_en: You shall place the showbread upon the table, before Me at all times.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד מְנַרְתָּא דִדְהַב דְכֵי נְגִיד תִּתְעֲבֵד מְנַרְתָּא שִׁדַהּ וּקְנַהּ כַּלִידָהָא חֵזוּרָהָא וְשׁוֹשַׁנָהָא מִנַהּ יְהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: You shall make a menorah [out] of pure gold. The menorah must be made by hammering [its form out of a solid piece of gold]. Its base, its shaft, its cups, its knobs, and its flowers shall be of it [the same piece of gold].

verses.ar_he: וְשִׁתָּא קְנִין נָפְקִין מִסִטְרָהָא תְּלָתָא קְנֵי מְנַרְתָּא מִסִטְרַהּ חַד וּתְלָתָא קְנֵי מְנַרְתָּא מִסִטְרַהּ תִּנְיָנָא:
verses.ar_en: Six branches shall extend from its sides, three branches of the menorah from one of its sides, and three branches of the menorah from the second side.

verses.ar_he: תְּלָתָא כַלִידִין מְצַיְרִין בְּקַנְיָא חַד חֵזוּר וְשׁוֹשַׁן וּתְלָתָא כַלִידִין מְצַיְרִין בְּקַנְיָא חַד חֵזוּר וְשׁוֹשָׁן כֵּן לְשִׁתָּא קְנִין דְנָפְקִין מִן מְנַרְתָּא:
verses.ar_en: Three cups, engraved in almond shaped patterns, on one branch, with a knob and a flower. And three cups engraved in almond shaped patterns, on one branch, with a knob and a flower. So shall be [the form] of each of the six branches that extend from [the shaft of] the menorah.

verses.ar_he: וּבִמְנַרְתָּא אַרְבְּעָא כַלִידִין מְצַיְרִין חֵזוּרָהָא וְשׁוֹשַׁנָהָא:
verses.ar_en: The [shaft of the] menorah shall have four cups, engraved in almond shaped patterns, with their knobs and their flowers.

verses.ar_he: וְחֵזוּר תְּחוֹת תְּרֵין קְנִין מִנַהּ וְחֵזוּר תְּחוֹת תְּרֵין קְנִין מִנַהּ וְחֵזוּר תְּחוֹת תְּרֵין קְנִין מִנַהּ לְשִׁתָּא קְנִין דְנָפְקִין מִן מְנַרְתָּא:
verses.ar_en: [There shall be] a knob under the two branches extending from it. [There should be] a [second] knob under the [second] two branches extending from it. [There should be] a [third] knob under the [third] two branches extending from it. [This holds true] for the six branches that extend from [the shaft of] the menorah.

verses.ar_he: חֵזוּרֵיהוֹן וּקְנֵיהוֹן מִנַהּ יְהוֹן כֻּלַהּ נְגִידָא חֲדָא דִדְהַב דְכֵי:
verses.ar_en: Their knobs and their branches shall be made out of [the menorah] itself. It shall all be made of a single hammered work of pure gold.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד יָת בּוֹצִינָהָא שִׁבְעָא וְתַדְלֵק יָת בּוֹצִינָהָא וִיהוֹן מְנַהֲרִין עַל קֳבֵל אַפָּהָא:
verses.ar_en: You shall make seven lamps [for the menorah]. and its lamps shall be lit so that they shine toward it [the center lamp].

verses.ar_he: וְצִבְיְתָהָא וּמַחְתְּיָתָהָא דִדְהַב דְכֵי:
verses.ar_en: Its tongs and its [ash] scoops [shall also be made of] pure gold.

verses.ar_he: כִּכְּרָא דִדְהַב דְכֵי יַעְבֵּד יָתַהּ יָת כָּל מָנַיָא הָאִלֵין:
verses.ar_en: It shall be made out of a kikar of pure gold [together] with all these vessels.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזֵי וַעֲבֵיד כִּדְמוּתְהוֹן דִאַתְּ מִתְחֲזִי בְּטוּרָא:
verses.ar_en: Observe [carefully] and make them like the pattern that will be shown to you on the mountain.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת מַשְׁכְּנָא תַּעְבֵּד עֲשַׂר יְרִיעָן דְבוּץ שְׁזִיר וְתִכְלָא וְאַרְגְּוָנָא וּצְבַע זְהוֹרִי צוּרַת כְּרוּבִין עוֹבַד אֳמָן תַּעְבֵּד יָתְהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: You shall [then] make the mishkon (Tabernacle) out of ten drapes, [consisting of] fine twined linen, greenish blue, dark red and crimson [colored] [wool]. Figures of cherubim, the work of a craftsman, shall be woven into them.

verses.ar_he: אֻרְכָּא דִירִיעֲתָא חֲדָא עַשְׂרִין וְתַמְנֵי אַמִין וּפוּתְיָא אַרְבַּע אַמִין דִירִיעֲתָא חֲדָא מְשַׁחְתָּא חֲדָא לְכָל יְרִיעֲתָא:
verses.ar_en: Each drape shall be twenty eight amohs long, and each drape shall be four amohs wide. All the drapes shall have the same measure.

verses.ar_he: חֲמֵשׁ יְרִיעָן יְהֶוְיָן מְלַפְּפָן חֲדָא עִם חֲדָא וַחֲמֵשׁ יְרִיעָן מְלַפְּפָן חֲדָא עִם חֲדָא:
verses.ar_en: Five of these drapes shall be joined [sewn] together and [the other] five drapes shall be joined [sewn] together.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד עֲנוּבִין דְתִכְלָא עַל שִׂפְתָא דִירִיעֲתָא חֲדָא מִסִטְרָא בֵּית לוֹפֵי וְכֵן תַּעְבֵּד בְּשִׂפְתָא דִירִיעֲתָא בְּסִטְרָא דְבֵית לוֹפֵי תִּנְיֵתָא:
verses.ar_en: Make loops of greenish blue [wool] on the edge of the drape which is at the [innermost] end of the [first] group. Do the same on the edge of the drape which is at the [innermost] end of the second group.

verses.ar_he: חַמְשִׁין עֲנוּבִין תַּעְבֵּד בִּירִיעֲתָא חֲדָא וְחַמְשִׁין עֲנוּבִין תַּעְבֵּד בְּסִטְרָא דִירִיעֲתָא דְבֵית לוֹפֵי תִּנְיָנָא מְכַוְנָן עֲנוּבַיָא חֲדָא לָקֳבֵל חֲדָא:
verses.ar_en: Make fifty loops on [the edge of] one drape, and make fifty loops on the edge of the drape which is on the second group. The loops shall be opposite one another.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד חַמְשִׁין פּוּרְפִין דִדְהָב וּתְלָפֵף יָת יְרִיעֲתָא חֲדָא עִם חֲדָא בְּפּוּרְפַיָא וִיהֵי מַשְׁכְּנָא חָד:
verses.ar_en: Make fifty golden clasps, and join the drapes [of each group] together with the clasps, so that the mishkon is one.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד יְרִיעָן מְעַזֵי לִפְרָסָא עַל מַשְׁכְּנָא חֲדָא עֶסְרֵי יְרִיעָן תַּעְבֵּד יָתְהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Make drapes of goats hair for a covering over the mishkon. Make eleven drapes.

verses.ar_he: אֻרְכָּא דִירִיעֲתָא חֲדָא תְּלָתִין אַמִין וּפוּתְיָא אַרְבַּע אַמִין דִירִיעֲתָא חֲדָא מְשַׁחְתָּא חֲדָא לַחֲדָא עֶסְרֵי יְרִיעָן:
verses.ar_en: The length of each drape shall be thirty amohs, and the width of each drape shall be four amohs. The eleven drapes must have the same measure.

verses.ar_he: וּתְלָפֵף יָת חֲמֵשׁ יְרִיעָן לְחוֹד וְיָת שִׁית יְרִיעָן לְחוֹד וְתֵיעוּף יָת יְרִיעֲתָא שְׁתִיתֵיתָא לָקֳבֵל אַפֵּי מַשְׁכְּנָא:
verses.ar_en: Join [sew] together five drapes by themselves, and [the other] six drapes by themselves. Let the sixth drape overhang before the entrance of the tent [mishkon].

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד חַמְשִׁין עֲנוּבִין עַל שִׂפְתָא דִירִיעֲתָא חֲדָא בְּסִטְּרָא בֵּית לוֹפֵי וְחַמְשִׁין עֲנוּבִין עַל שִׂפְתָא דִירִיעֲתָא דְבֵית לוֹפֵי תִּנְיֵתָא:
verses.ar_en: Make fifty loops on the edge of one drape which is at the [innermost] end of the [first] group, and fifty loops on the edge of the drape which is on the second group.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד פּוּרְפִין דִנְחָשָׁא חַמְשִׁין וְתָעֵיל יָת פּוּרְפַיָא בַּעֲנוּבַיָא וּתְלָפֵף יָת מַשְׁכְּנָא וִיהֵי חָד:
verses.ar_en: Make fifty copper clasps. Bring the clasps into the loops, and join the tent together, making it one.

verses.ar_he: וְסִרְחָא דְיַתִּירָא בִּירִיעַת מַשְׁכְּנָא פַּלְגוּת יְרִיעֲתָא דְיַתִּירָא תִּסְרַח עַל אֲחוֹרֵי מַשְׁכְּנָא:
verses.ar_en: The overlapping excess [from what is left over] [in the breadth] of the drapes of the tent—half of the extra drape shall overlap the back of the mishkon.

verses.ar_he: וְאַמְתָא מִכָּא וְאַמְתָא מִכָּא בִּדְיַתִּירָא בְּאֻרְכָּא יְרִיעֲתָא דְמַשְׁכְּנָא יְהֵי סְרִיחַ עַל סִטְרֵי מַשְׁכְּנָא מִכָּא וּמִכָּא לְכַסָיוּתֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: The [extra] amoh on one side, and the [extra] amoh on the other side that were in excess of the length of the drapes of the tent shall overlap the sides of the mishkon, on both sides, to cover it.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד חוֹפָאָה לִפְרָסָא מַשְׁכֵי דְדִכְרֵי מְסַמְקֵי וְחוֹפָאָה מַשְׁכֵי דְסַסְגוֹנָא מִלְעֵלָא:
verses.ar_en: Make a covering for the tent out of red dyed ram’s skins, and a covering of tachash [multicolored] skins above that.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד יָת דַפַּיָא לְמַשְׁכְּנָא דְאָעֵי שִטִין קָיְמִין:
verses.ar_en: Make the planks for the mishkon out of acacia wood; [these planks are] to stand upright [vertically].

verses.ar_he: עֲשַׂר אַמִין אֻרְכָּא דְדַפָּא וְאַמְתָא וּפַלְגוּת אַמְתָא פּוּתְיָא דְדַפָּא חָד:
verses.ar_en: Each plank shall be ten amohs long, and one and one half amohs shall be the width of each plank.

verses.ar_he: תַּרְתֵּין צִירִין לְדַפָּא חַד מְשַׁלְבִין חֲדָא לָקֳבֵל חֲדָא כֵּן תַּעְבֵּד לְכֹל דַפֵּי מַשְׁכְּנָא:
verses.ar_en: Each plank shall have two [square] pegs, exactly parallel to each other. So shall you make all the planks of the mishkon.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד יָת דַפַּיָא לְמַשְׁכְּנָא עַסְרִין דַפִּין לְרוּחַ עֵבַר דְרוֹמָא:
verses.ar_en: Make these planks for the mishkon, twenty planks for the southern side.

verses.ar_he: וְאַרְבְּעִין סַמְכִין דִכְסַף תַּעְבֵּד תְּחוֹת עַסְרִין דַפִּין תְּרֵין סַמְכִין תְּחוֹת דַפָּא חַד לִתְרֵין צִירוֹהִי וּתְרֵין סַמְכִין תְּחוֹת דַפָּא חַד לִתְרֵין צִירוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: Make forty silver sockets, [and place them] under the twenty planks. There shall be two sockets under one plank [one] for each of the two pegs, and two sockets under the other plank, [one] for each of the two pegs.

verses.ar_he: וְלִסְטַר מַשְׁכְּנָא תִּנְיֵתָא לְרוּחַ צִפּוּנָא עֶסְרִין דַפִּין:
verses.ar_en: For the second wall of the mishkon, to the northern side, [also make] twenty planks.

verses.ar_he: וְאַרְבְּעִין סַמְכֵיהוֹן דִכְסַף תְּרֵין סַמְכִין תְּחוֹת דַפָּא חַד וּתְרֵין סַמְכִין תְּחוֹת דַפָּא חָד:
verses.ar_en: [Make] their forty silver sockets, two sockets under each plank, two sockets under each plank.

verses.ar_he: וְלִסְיָפֵי מַשְׁכְּנָא מַעַרְבָא תַּעְבֵּד שִׁתָּא דַפִּין:
verses.ar_en: For the west end of the mishkon make six planks.

verses.ar_he: וּתְרֵין דַפִּין תַּעְבֵּד לְזָוְיַת מַשְׁכְּנָא בְּסוֹפֵיהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Make two planks for the corners of the mishkon at the rear side [their ends].

verses.ar_he: וִיהוֹן מְכַוְנִין מִלְרַע וְכַחֲדָא יְהוֹן מְכַוְנִין עַל רֵישֵׁהּ לְעִזְקְתָא חֲדָא כֵּן יְהֵי לְתַרְוֵיהוֹן לִתְרֵין זָוְיָן יְהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: They must be coupled together on the bottom, and they must also be coupled together evenly on the top with one [square] ring. So must it be done with the two [planks], which are at the two corners.

verses.ar_he: וִיהוֹן תְּמַנְיָא דַפִּין וְסַמְכֵיהוֹן דִכְסַף שִׁתָּא עֲשַׂר סַמְכִין תְּרֵין סַמְכִין תְּחוֹת דַפָּא חַד וּתְרֵין סַמְכִין תְּחוֹת דַפָּא חָד:
verses.ar_en: Thus there will be eight planks, and their silver sockets, totaling sixteen sockets, two sockets under each plank, two sockets under each plank.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד עַבְּרֵי דְאָעֵי שִׁטִין חַמְשָׁא לְדַפֵּי סְטַּר מַשְׁכְּנָא חָד:
verses.ar_en: You shall make bars out of acacia wood, five for the planks of one wall,

verses.ar_he: וְחַמְשָׁא עַבְּרִין לְדַפֵּי סְטַר מַשְׁכְּנָא תִּנְיֵתָא וְחַמְשָׁא עַבְּרִין לְדַפֵּי סְטַּר מַשְׁכְּנָא לְסוֹפֵיהוֹן מַעַרְבָא:
verses.ar_en: and five bars for the planks of the second wall of the mishkon. [There shall also be] five bars for the planks of the western [back] wall of the mishkon.

verses.ar_he: וְעַבְּרָא מְצִיעָאָה בְּגוֹ דַפַּיָא מַעְבַר מִן סְיָפֵי לִסְיָפֵי:
verses.ar_en: The middle [center] bar shall go through the planks, reinforcing the planks from one end to the other.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת דַפַּיָא תַּחְפֵּי דַהֲבָא וְיָת עִזְקָתְהוֹן תַּעְבֵּד דַהֲבָא אַתְרָא לְעַבְרַיָא וְתַחְפֵּי יָת עַבְּרַיָא דַהֲבָא:
verses.ar_en: You shall overlay the planks with gold, and make their rings out of gold, to hold the bars. You shall [also] overlay the bars with gold.

verses.ar_he: וּתְקִים יָת מַשְׁכְּנָא כְּהִלְכְתֵהּ דִי אִתְחֲזֵיתָא בְּטוּרָא:
verses.ar_en: You shall erect the mishkon according to its rules. As shown to you on the mountain.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד פָּרֻכְתָּא תִּכְלָא וְאַרְגְוָנָא וּצְבַע זְהוֹרִי וּבוּץ שְׁזִיר עוֹבַד אֳמָן יַעְבֵּד יָתַהּ צוּרַת כְּרוּבִין:
verses.ar_en: You shall make a paroches [partition] out of greenish blue wool, dark red wool, crimson [colored] wool, and twined, fine linen. It shall be the work of a craftsman, with figures of cherubim [woven into it].

verses.ar_he: וְתִתֵּן יָתַהּ עַל אַרְבְּעָא עַמוּדֵי שִׁטִין מְחַפְּיָן דַהֲבָא וָוֵיהוֹן דַהֲבָא עַל אַרְבְּעָא סַמְכֵי דִכְסָף:
verses.ar_en: Place it [the paroches] upon four acacia-wood pillars, that are overlaid with gold. Their hooks shall [also] be of gold. These pillars are to be set into four silver sockets.

verses.ar_he: וְתִתֵּן יָת פָּרֻכְתָּא תְּחוֹת פּוּרְפַיָא וְתָעֵיל תַּמָן מִגָּו לְפָרֻכְתָּא יָת אֲרוֹנָא דְסַהֲדוּתָא וְתַפְרֵשׁ פָּרֻכְתָּא לְכוֹן בֵּין קוּדְשָׁא וּבֵין קֹדֶשׁ קוּדְשַׁיָא:
verses.ar_en: Place the paroches under the clasps [which kept the drapes together]. Bring into the space within [behind] the paroches, the Ark of the Testimony, and the paroches will divide for you between the Holy and the Holy of Holies.

verses.ar_he: וְתִתֵּן יָת כַּפֻּרְתָּא עַל אֲרוֹנָא דְסַהֲדוּתָא בְּקֹדֶשׁ קוּדְשַׁיָא:
verses.ar_en: Place the cover upon the Ark of the Testimony in the Holy of Holies.

verses.ar_he: וּתְשַׁוִי יָת פָּתוֹרָא מִבָּרָא לְפָרֻכְתָּא וְיָת מְנַרְתָּא לָקֳבֵל פָּתוֹרָא עַל צִדָּא דְמַשְּׁכְּנָא דָרוֹמָא וּפָתוֹרָא תִתֵּן עַל סְטַר צִפּוּנָא:
verses.ar_en: Put the table outside the paroches, and the menorah opposite the table, toward the southern side of the mishkon. The table should be placed on the northern side.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד פְּרָסָא לִתְרַע מַשְׁכְּנָא תִּכְלָא וְאַרְגְוָנָא וּצְבַע זְהוֹרִי וּבוּץ שְׁזִיר עוֹבַד צַיָר:
verses.ar_en: You shall make a screen for the entrance of the tent. [Make it out of] greenish blue wool, dark red wool, crimson [colored] wool, and twined, fine linen. It shall be the work of an embroiderer.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד לִפְרָסָא חַמְשָׁא עַמוּדֵי שִׁטִין וְתַחֲפֵי יָתְהוֹן דַהֲבָא וָוֵיהוֹן דַהֲבָא וְתַתִּיךְ לְהוֹן חַמְשָׁא סַמְכֵי נְחָשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: Make five pillars of acacia wood for the screen. Overlay them with gold and their hooks are to be gold. Cast five copper sockets for them [the pillars].

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד יָת מַדְבְּחָא דְאָעֵי שִׁטִין חֲמֵשׁ אַמִין אֻרְכָּא וַחֲמֵשׁ אַמִין פּוּתְיָא מְרַבַּע יְהֵי מַדְבְּחָא וּתְלַת אַמִין רוּמֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: You shall make the altar out of acacia wood. It shall be five amohs long, and five amohs wide. The altar shall be square, and its height shall be three amohs.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד קַרְנוֹהִי עַל אַרְבַּע זִוְיָתֵהּ מִנֵהּ תְּהֶוְיָן קַרְנוֹהִי וְתַחֲפֵי יָתֵהּ נְחָשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: Make its raised projections on its four corners. Its raised projections shall be of one piece with it, and you shall overlay it [the altar] with copper.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד פְּסַכְתְּרָוָתֵהּ לְמִסְפֵי קִטְּמֵיהּ וּמַגְרוֹפְיָתֵהּ וּמִזְרְקָתֵהּ וְצִנוּרְיָתֵהּ וּמַחְתְּיָתֵהּ לְכָל מָנוֹהִי תַּעְבֵּד נְחָשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: Make its pots to remove [collect] its ashes, [also] its scoops, its basins, its flesh hooks, and its fire pans. Make all of its vessels out of copper.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד לֵהּ סְרָדָא עוֹבַד מְצַדְתָּא דִנְחָשָׁא וְתַעְבֵּד עַל מְצַדְתָּא אַרְבַּע עִזְקָן דִנְחָשָׁא עַל אַרְבַּע סִטְּרוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: Make for it a grate of copper netting. On the grate you shall make four copper rings on its four corners.

verses.ar_he: וְתִתֵּן יָתַהּ תְּחוֹת סוֹבָבֵי מַדְבְּחָא מִלְרָע וּתְהֵי מְצַדְתָּא עַד פַּלְגוּת מַדְבְּחָא:
verses.ar_en: Place it under the rim of the altar, extending downward, so that the grate reaches the middle of the altar.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד אֲרִיחַיָא לְמַדְבְּחָא אֲרִיחֵי דְאָעֵי שִׁטִין וְתַחֲפֵי יָתְהוֹן נְחָשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: Make poles for the altar, poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with copper.

verses.ar_he: וְיָעֵל יָת אֲרִיחוֹהִי בְּעִזְקָתָא וִיהוֹן אֲרִיחַיָא עַל תְּרֵין סִטְרֵי מַדְבְּחָא בְּמִטַל יָתֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: Place its poles into the rings, and the poles shall be on the two sides of the altar when it is carried.

verses.ar_he: חֲלִיל לוּחֵי תַּעְבֵּד יָתֵהּ כְּמָא דִי אַחֲזִי יָתָךְ בְּטוּרָא כֵּן יַעְבְּדוּן:
verses.ar_en: It should be a hollow structure constructed from boards. As it was shown to you on the mountain, so shall they make it.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד יָת דָרַת מַשְׁכְּנָא לְרוּחַ עֵבַר דָרוֹמָא סְרָדִין לְדָרְתָּא דְבוּץ שְׁזִיר מְאָה בְאַמִין אֻרְכָּא לְעֵבֶר חָד:
verses.ar_en: You shall make the enclosure for the mishkon. On the south side there shall be curtains for the enclosure made of fine twined linen. It shall be one hundred amohs long on one side.

verses.ar_he: וְעַמוּדוֹהִי עֶשְׂרִין וְסַמְכֵיהוֹן עֶשְׂרִין נְחָשָׁא וָוֵי עַמוּדַיָא וְכִבּוּשֵׁיהוֹן כְּסָף:
verses.ar_en: It shall have twenty pillars, and they shall have twenty copper sockets. The hooks and bands of the pillars shall be of silver.

verses.ar_he: וְכֵן לְרוּחַ צִפּוּנָא בְּאֻרְכָּא סְרָדִין מְאָה אֻרְכָּא וְעַמוּדוֹהִי עֶשְׂרִין וְסַמְכֵיהוֹן עֶשְׂרִין נְחָשָׁא וָוֵי עַמוּדַיָא וְכִבּוּשֵׁהוֹן דִכְסָף:
verses.ar_en: The same shall be on the north side. The curtains shall be one hundred amohs long, with twenty pillars and twenty copper sockets. The hooks and bands of the pillar shall be of silver.

verses.ar_he: וּפוּתְיָא דְדַרְתָּא לְרוּחַ מַעַרְבָא סְרָדִין חַמְשִׁין אַמִין עַמוּדֵיהוֹן עַשְׂרָא וְסַמְכֵיהוֹן עַשְׂרָא:
verses.ar_en: For the width of the enclosure on the west side there shall be curtains of fifty amohs. They shall have ten pillars and ten sockets.

verses.ar_he: וּפוּתְיָא דְדַרְתָּא לְרוּחַ קִדוּמָא מַדִינְחָא חַמְשִׁין אַמִין:
verses.ar_en: The width of the enclosure on the east side shall be fifty amohs.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵי אַמִין סְרָדִין לְעִבְרָא עַמוּדֵיהוֹן תְּלָתָא וְסַמְכֵיהוֹן תְּלָתָא:
verses.ar_en: There shall be curtains fifteen amohs long on one flank [of the entrance]. They shall have three pillars and three sockets.

verses.ar_he: וּלְעִבְרָא תִּנְיָנָא חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵי סְרָדִין עֲמוּדֵיהוֹן תְּלָתָא וְסַמְכֵיהוֹן תְּלָתָא:
verses.ar_en: The other flank shall [also] have curtains of fifteen amohs. They [too] shall have three pillars and three sockets.

verses.ar_he: וְלִתְרַע דַרְתָּא פְּרָסָא עֶשְׂרִין אַמִין תִּכְלָא וְאַרְגְוָנָא וּצְבַע זְהוֹרִי וּבוּץ שְׁזִיר עוֹבַד צַיָר עַמוּדֵיהוֹן אַרְבְּעָא וְסַמְכֵיהוֹן אַרְבְּעָא:
verses.ar_en: The entrance of the enclosure shall have a screen of twenty amohs. [It shall be made of] greenish-blue wool, dark red wool, crimson [colored] wool, and twined, fine linen. It shall be the work of an embroiderer. It [the screen] shall have four pillars and four sockets.

verses.ar_he: כָּל עַמוּדֵי דַרְתָּא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר מְכַבְּשִׁין כְּסַף וָוֵיהוֹן כְּסַף וְסַמְכֵיהוֹן נְחָשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: All the pillars around the enclosure shall have silver bands, and silver hooks, and copper sockets.

verses.ar_he: אֻרְכָּא דְדַרְתָּא מְאָהּ בְאַמִין וּפוּתְיָא חַמְשִׁין בְּחַמְשִׁין וְרוּמָא חֲמֵשׁ אַמִין דְבוּץ שְׁזִיר וְסַמְכֵיהוֹן נְחָשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: The length of the enclosure shall be one hundred amohs. The width shall be fifty by fifty amohs. The height [of the pillars holding up the curtains] of twisted fine linen shall be five amohs, and their sockets shall be [made] of copper.

verses.ar_he: לְכֹל מָאנֵי מַשְׁכְּנָא בְּכֹל פָּלְחָנֵהּ וְכָל סִכּוֹהִי וְכָל סִכֵּי דְדַרְתָּא נְחָשָׁא:ססס:
verses.ar_en: All the vessels of the mishkon in all its service, all of its stakes and all the stakes of the enclosure, shall be made of copper.

verses.ar_he: וְאַתְּ תְּפַקֵד יָת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְיִסְבוּן לָךְ מִשְׁחָא זֵיתָא דַכְיָא כָּתִישָׁא לְאַנְהָרָא לְאַדְלָקָא בוֹצִינַיָא תְּדִירָא:
verses.ar_en: You shall command the B’nei Yisrael and have them bring you clear olive oil, [made from olives that were] crushed for lighting, to keep the lamp burning constantly.

verses.ar_he: בְּמַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא מִבָּרָא לְפָרֻכְתָּא דְעַל סַהֲדוּתָא יְסַדַר יָתֵהּ אַהֲרֹן וּבְנוֹהִי מֵרַמְשָׁא עַד צַפְרָא קָדָם יְיָ קְיָם עֲלָם לְדָרֵיהוֹן מִן בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל:
verses.ar_en: In the Tent of Meeting, outside the paroches, which is before the Testimony, Aharon and his sons shall arrange it [for the lamp to burn] from evening to morning before Adonoy. This is an everlasting statute for their generations of the B’nei Yisrael.

verses.ar_he: וְאַתְּ קָרֵב לְוָתָךְ יָת אַהֲרֹן אָחוּךְ וְיָת בְּנוֹהִי עִמֵהּ מִגוֹ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְשַׁמָשָׁא קֳדָמַי אַהֲרֹן נָדָב וַאֲבִיהוּא אֶלְעָזָר וְאִיתָמָר בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן:
verses.ar_en: And [now separate] and take unto you your brother, Aharon, and his sons with him, from among the B’nei Yisrael, to serve [before] Me [as kohanim]: Aharon, Nadav, Avihu, Elazar, and Isamar, the sons of Aharon.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד לְבוּשֵׁי קוּדְשָׁא לְאַהֲרֹן אָחוּךְ לִיקָר וּלְתֻשְׁבְּחָן:
verses.ar_en: Make sacred garments for your brother, Aharon, for honor and splendor.

verses.ar_he: וְאַתְּ תְּמַלֵל עִם כָּל חַכִּימֵי לִבָּא דְאַשְׁלֵמִית עִמֵהּ רוּחַ חָכְמְתָא וְיַעְבְּדוּן יָת לְבוּשֵׁי אַהֲרֹן לְקַדָשׁוּתֵהּ לְשַׁמָשָׁא קֳדָמַי:
verses.ar_en: Speak to all who are wise in heart, whom I have filled with the spirit of wisdom, and have them make Aharon’s garments, to sanctify him to serve [before] Me [as kohein].

verses.ar_he: וְאִלֵין לְבוּשַׁיָא דִי יַעְבְּדוּן חוּשְׁנָא וְאֵפוֹדָא וּמְעִילָא וְכִתּוּנָא מְרַמְצָא מִצְנֶפְתָּא וְהֶמְיָנָא וְיַעְבְּדוּן לְבוּשֵׁי קוּדְשָׁא לְאַהֲרֹן אָחוּךְ וְלִבְנוֹהִי לְשַׁמָשָׁא קֳדָמַי:
verses.ar_en: These are the garments that they shall make: a breastplate, an eiphod, a robe, a checkered undershirt, a turban and a sash-belt. Have them make sacred garments for your brother Aharon, and for his sons, to serve [before] Me [as kohanim].

verses.ar_he: וְאִנוּן יִסְבוּן יָת דַהֲבָא וְיָת תִּכְלָא וְיָת אַרְגְוָנָא וְיָת צְבַע זְהוֹרִי וְיָת בּוּצָא:
verses.ar_en: They shall take the gold, the greenish-blue wool, the dark red wool the crimson [colored] wool, and the fine twined linen.

verses.ar_he: וְיַעְבְּדוּן יָת אֵפוֹדָא דַהֲבָא תִּכְלָא וְאַרְגְוָנָא צְבַע זְהוֹרִי וּבוּץ שְׁזִיר עוֹבַד אֳמָן:
verses.ar_en: They shall make the eiphod out of gold, greenish-blue wool, dark red wool, crimson [colored] wool, and fine twined linen, the work of a craftsman.

verses.ar_he: תַּרְתֵּין כַּתְפִּין מְלַפְּפָן יְהוֹן לֵהּ עַל תְּרֵין סִטְרוֹהִי וְיִתְלָפַף:
verses.ar_en: It shall have two shoulder straps attached to it, they shall be attached at its two corners [sides].

verses.ar_he: וְהֶמְיַן תִּקוּנֵי דִי עֲלוֹהִי כְּעוֹבָדוֹהִי מִנֵהּ יְהֵי דַהֲבָא תִּכְלָא וְאַרְגְּוָנָא וּצְבַע זְהוֹרִי וּבוּץ שְׁזִיר:
verses.ar_en: The eiphod’s belt [that enhances it], which is on it, shall be made in the same manner [as the eiphod]—it shall be woven with it. [with] gold, greenish blue wool, dark red wool, crimson [colored] wool and fine twined linen.

verses.ar_he: וְתִסַב יָת תַּרְתֵּין אַבְנֵי בוּרְלָא וְתִגְלוֹף עֲלֵיהֶן שְׁמָהַת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל:
verses.ar_en: Take two shoham [onyx] stones and engrave on them the names of the B’nei Yisrael.

verses.ar_he: שִׁתָּא מִשְׁמָהָתְהוֹן עַל אַבְנָא חֲדָא וְיָת שְׁמָהַת שִׁתָּא דְאִשְׁתָּאָרוּ עַל אַבְנָא תִנְיֵתָא כְּתוּלְדָתְהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Six of their names on the one stone, and the remaining six names on the second stone, in the order of their birth.

verses.ar_he: עוֹבַד אֳמָן אֶבֶן טָבָא כְּתַב מְפָרַשׁ כִּגְלֹף דְעִזְקָא תִגְלוֹף יָת תַּרְתֵּין אַבְנַיָא עַל שְׁמָהַת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מְשַׁקְעָן מְרַמְצָן דִדְהַב תַּעְבֵּד יָתְהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: The work of a skilled [precious] stone engraver, like the engraving of a signet [ring] [written in script that is clear like they engrave a signet ring] shall you engrave the two stones with the names of the B’nei Yisrael. In gold settings shall you place them.

verses.ar_he: וּתְשַׁוִּי יָת תַּרְתֵּין אַבְנַיָא עַל כִּתְפֵּי אֵפוֹדָא אַבְנֵי דָכְרָנָא לִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְיִטּוֹל אַהֲרֹן יָת שְׁמָהָתְהוֹן קֳדָם יְיָ עַל תְּרֵין כִּתְפּוֹהִי לְדָכְרָנָא:
verses.ar_en: Set the two stones on the shoulder straps of the eiphod as remembrance stones for the B’nei Yisrael. Aharon shall bear their names before Adonoy, on his two shoulders as a remembrance.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד מְרַמְצָן דִדְהַב:
verses.ar_en: Make gold settings,

verses.ar_he: וְתַרְתֵּין תִּכִּין דְהַב דְכֵי מְתַחְמָן תַּעְבֵד יָתְהוֹן עוֹבַד גְדִילוּ וְתִתֵּן יָת תִּכַּיָא גְדִילָתָא עַל מְרַמְצָתָא:
verses.ar_en: and two chains of pure gold, you will make them for the ends, a braided work. and you will fasten the braided chain’s to the settings.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד חשֶׁן דִינָא עוֹבַד אֳמָן כְּעוֹבַד אֵפוֹדָא תַּעְבְּדִנֵהּ דַהֲבָא תִּכְלָא וְאַרְגְוָנָא וּצְבַע זְהוֹרִי וּבוּץ שְׁזִיר תַּעְבֵּד יָתֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: Make a breastplate of judgment, the work of a craftsman. Make it in the same manner you made the eiphod. [Out of] gold, greenish-blue wool, dark red wool, crimson [colored] wool and fine twined linen, shall you make it.

verses.ar_he: מְרַבַּע יְהֵי עֵיף זֶרְתָּא אֻרְכֵּה וְזֶרְתָּא פְתָיֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: It shall be a doubled square, a span in its length and a span in its width.

verses.ar_he: וְתַשְׁלֵם בֵּה אַשְׁלָמוּת אַבְנָא אַרְבְּעָא סִדְרִין אֶבֶן טָּבָא סִדְרָא קַדְמָאָה סָמְקָן יַרְקָן וּבַרְקָן סִדְרָא חָד:
verses.ar_en: Fill it [the breastplate settings] with fillings of [mounted] stones. Their shall be four rows of [precious] stones: [The first row:] An odem [ruby], pitda [topaz], and a barekes [emerald], [shall be placed on] the first row [one].

verses.ar_he: וְסִדְרָא תִּנְיָנָא אִזְמָרַגְדִין וְשַׁבְזִיז וְסִבְהֲלוֹם:
verses.ar_en: The second row: nofech [carbuncle], sapphire, and yahalom [diamond].

verses.ar_he: וְסִדְרָא תְּלִיתָאָה קַנְכִּירֵי טַרְקְיָא וְעֵין עֶגְלָא:
verses.ar_en: The third row: leshem [opal], shevo [agate], and achlomo [amethyst].

verses.ar_he: וְסִדְרֵא רְבִיעָאָה כְּרוּם יַמָא וּבוּרְלָא וּפַנְטֵרֵי מְרַמְצָן דִדְהַב יְהוֹן בְּאַשְׁלָמוּתְהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: The fourth row: tarshish [chrysolite], shoham [onyx], and yoshfei [jasper]. [These stones] shall be placed in gold settings in their fullness.

verses.ar_he: וְאַבְנַיָא יְהֶוְיַן עַל שְׁמָהַת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל תַּרְתֵּי עֶסְרֵי עַל שְׁמָהַתְהוֹן כְּתַב מְפָרַשׁ כִּגְלוֹף דְעִזְקָא גְבַר עַל שְׁמֵהּ תְּהֶוְיָן לִתְרֵין עֲסַר שִׁבְטִין:
verses.ar_en: These stones shall have on them the names of the B’nei Yisrael, twelve of them by their names, each one’s name [written in script that is clear like they engrave a signet ring] engraved as on a signet [ring], representing the twelve tribes.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד עַל חוּשְׁנָא תִּכִּין מְתַחְמָן עוֹבַד גְדִילוּ דְהַב דְכֵי:
verses.ar_en: Make [two] twisted end-chains for the breastplate, braided work of pure gold.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד עַל חוּשְׁנָא תַּרְתֵּין עִזְקָן דִדְהַב וְתִתֵּן יָת תַּרְתֵּין עִזְקָתָא עַל תְּרֵין סִטְרֵי חוּשְׁנָא:
verses.ar_en: Make two gold ring’s for the breastplate, and set the two rings on the two [upper] corners [sides] for the breastplate.

verses.ar_he: וְתִתֵּן יָת תַּרְתֵּין גְדִילָן דִדְהַב עַל תַּרְתֵּין עִזְקָתָא לְסִטְרֵי חוּשְׁנָא:
verses.ar_en: Place [attach] the two gold-braided chains on the two rings, at the corners [sides] of the breastplate.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת תַּרְתֵּין גְדִילָן דְעַל תַּרְתֵּין סִטְרוֹהִי תִּתֵּן עַל תַּרְתֵּין מְרַמְצָתָא וְתִתֵּן עַל כִּתְפֵּי אֵפוֹדָא לָקֳבֵל אַפּוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: The two ends of the two braided chains [which are on its two sides], you shall place [attach] to the two settings, and place them on the shoulder straps of the eiphod toward its face.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד תַּרְתֵּין עִזְקָן דִדְהַב וּתְשַׁוִּי יָתְהוֹן עַל תְּרֵין סִטְרֵי חוּשְׁנָא עַל סִפְתֵהּ דִי לְעִבְרָא דְאֵפוֹדָא מִלְגָו:
verses.ar_en: Make two gold rings and set them on the two [lower] corners [sides] of the breastplate, on its edge that is on the inner side of the eiphod.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד תַּרְתֵּין עִזְקָן דִדְהַב וְתִתֵּן יָתְהוֹן עַל תַּרְתֵּין כִּתְפֵּי אֵפוֹדָא מִלְרַע מִלְקֳבֵל אַפּוֹהִי לָקֳבֵל בֵּית לוֹפֵי מֵעִלָוֵי לְהֶמְיַן אֵפוֹדָא:
verses.ar_en: Make two gold rings and place them on the two shoulder straps of the eiphod, on the bottom, toward its face, a gainst where they are joined, above the eiphod’s belt.

verses.ar_he: וְיֶחְדוּן יָת חוּשְׁנָא מֵעִזְקְתֵהּ לְעִזְקְתָא דְאֵפוֹדָא בְּחוּטָא דִתְכֶלְתָּא לְמֶהֱוֵי עַל הֶמְיַן אֵפוֹדָא וְלָא יִתְפָּרֵק חוּשְׁנָא מֵעִלָוֵי אֵפוֹדָא:
verses.ar_en: They shall bind the [lower] rings of the breastplate to the [lower] rings of the eiphod with a cord of greenish-blue wool, so that it [the breastplate] remains against the eiphod’s belt, so that the breastplate does not move from the eiphod.

verses.ar_he: וְיִטוֹל אַהֲרֹן יָת שְׁמָהַת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּחשֶׁן דִינָא עַל לִבֵּהּ בְּמֵעֲלֵהּ לְקוּדְשָׁא לְדוּכְרָנָא קֳדָם יְיָ תְּדִירָא:
verses.ar_en: Aharon will thus carry the names of the B’nei Yisrael on the breastplate of judgment, over his heart, when he comes into the Holy [sanctuary], as a constant remembrance before Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְתִתֵּן בְּחשֶׁן דִינָא יָת אוּרַיָא וְיָת תֻּמַיָא וִיהוֹן עַל לִבָּא דְאַהֲרֹן בְּמֵעֲלֵהּ קֳדָם יְיָ וְיִטוֹל אַהֲרֹן יָת דִינָא דִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל עַל לִבֵּהּ קֳדָם יְיָ תְּדִירָא:
verses.ar_en: Place in the breastplate the Urim and Tumim, and they will be over Aharon’s heart when he comes before Adonoy. Aharon will carry the judgment of the B’nei Yisrael over his heart, before Adonoy always.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד יָת מְעִילָא דְאֵפוֹדָא גְמִיר תִּכְלָא:
verses.ar_en: Make the robe of the eiphod completely out of greenish-blue wool.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי פוּם רֵישֵׁהּ כָּפִיל לְגַוֵּהּ תּוֹרָא יְהֵא מַקַף לְפוּמֵהּ סְחוֹר סְחוֹר עוֹבַד מָחֵי כְּפוּם שִׂרְיָן יְהֵי לֵהּ לָא יִתְבְּזָע:
verses.ar_en: Its opening at the top shall be turned inward. Its opening shall have a border [encircling] all around, [this border shall be] of woven work, like there is around the opening of a coat of armor, so that it will not be torn.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד עַל שִׁיפוֹלוֹהִי רִמוֹנֵי תִּכְלָא וְאַרְגְוָנָא וּצְבַע זְהוֹרִי עַל שִׁיפוֹלוֹהִי סְחוֹר סְחוֹר וְזַגִין דְדַהֲבָא בֵּינֵיהוֹן סְחוֹר סְחוֹר:
verses.ar_en: On its [lower] hem you shall make pomegranates of greenish-blue wool, dark red wool, and crimson [colored] wool—around its [lower] hem. There shall be gold bells between them, all around.

verses.ar_he: זַגָא דְדַהֲבָא וְרִמוֹנָא זַגָא דְדַהֲבָא וְרִמוֹנָא עַל שִׁיפוֹלֵי מְעִילָא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר:
verses.ar_en: A gold bell and a pomegranate, a gold bell and a pomegranate, on the [lower] hem of the robe all around.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי עַל אַהֲרֹן לְשַׁמָשָׁא וְיִשְׁתְּמַע קָלֵהּ בְּמֵעֲלֵהּ לְקוּדְשָׁא קֳדָם יְיָ וּבְמִפְקֵהּ וְלָא יְמוּת:
verses.ar_en: It shall be on Aharon when he performs [Divine] service. Its sound shall be heard when he comes into the Holy [sanctuary] in the presence of Adonoy, and when he comes out, so that he will not die.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד צִיצָא דִדְהַב דְכֵי וְתִגְלוֹף עֲלוֹהִי כְּתַב מִפָרַשׁ קֹדֶשׁ לַיָי:
verses.ar_en: You shall make a diadem of pure gold, and engrave on it in the manner of a signet [ring] [script that is clear], “Holy unto Adonoy.”

verses.ar_he: וּתְשַׁוִי יָתֵהּ עַל חוּטָא דִתְכֶלְתָּא וִיהֵי עַל מִצְנֶפְתָּא לָקֳבֵל אַפֵּי מִצְנֶפְתָּא יְהֵי:
verses.ar_en: Set [fasten] it on a greenish-blue wool cord, so that it will be on the turban. It shall be near the front of the turban.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי עַל בֵּית עֵינוֹהִי דְאַהֲרֹן וְיִטּוֹל אַהֲרֹן יָת עֲוָיַת קוּדְשַׁיָא דִי יְקַדְשׁוּן בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְכָל מַתְּנַּת קוּדְשֵׁיהוֹן וִיהֵי עַל בֵּית עֵינוֹהִי תְּדִירָא לְרַעֲוָא לְהוֹן קֳדָם יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: It shall be [worn] on Aharon’s forehead, and Aharon will carry [atone] the iniquity of the sacred offerings that the B’nei Yisrael consecrate for all their sacred gifts. It shall be on his forehead always to make them [the sacred-offerings] acceptable before Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וּתְרַמֵץ כִּתּוּנָא בוּצָא וְתַעְבֵּד מִצְנֶפְתָּא דְבוּצָא וְהֶמְיָנָא תַּעְבֵּד עוֹבַד צַיָר:
verses.ar_en: Make the undershirt with checkered work of fine linen. Make the turban of fine linen. and the sash-belt shall be the work of an embroiderer.

verses.ar_he: וְלִבְנֵי אַהֲרֹן תַּעְבֵּד כִּתּוּנִין וְתַעְבֵּד לְהוֹן הֶמְיָנִין וְכוֹבָעִין תַּעְבֵּד לְהוֹן לִיקָר וּלְתֻשְׁבְּחָן:
verses.ar_en: For Aharon’s sons, make undershirts, and [also] make sash-belts for them. Make turban-like hats for them, for honor and splendor.

verses.ar_he: וְתַלְבֵּש יָתְהוֹן יָת אַהֲרֹן אָחוּךְ וְיָת בְּנוֹהִי עִמֵהּ וּתְרַבֵּי יָתְהוֹן וּתְקָרֵב יָת קֻרְבָּנְהוֹן וּתְקַדֵשׁ יָתְהוֹן וִישַׁמְשׁוּן קֳדָמַי:
verses.ar_en: Clothe your brother, Aharon, with [these garments], and also [clothe] his sons along with him. [Then] anoint them, and install them [offer their sacrifices], and consecrate them to serve [before] Me [as kohanim].
