verses.ar_he: וְעִבֵד לְהוֹן מִכְנְסִין דְבוּץ לְכַסָאָה בְשַׂר עֶרְיְתָא מֵחַרְצָן וְעַד יַרְכָּן יְהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Make for them linen pants to cover their nakedness, reaching from their waists to their thighs.

verses.ar_he: וִיהוֹן עַל אַהֲרֹן וְעַל בְּנוֹהִי בְּמֵעַלְהוֹן לְּמַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא אוֹ בְמִקְרָבְהוֹן לְמַדְבְּחָא לְשַׁמָשָׁא בְקוּדְשָׁא וְלָא יְקַבְּלוּן חוֹבָא וִימוּתוּן קְיָם עָלָם לֵהּ וְלִבְנוֹהִי בַתְרוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: These [garments] must be worn by Aharon and his sons whenever they come into Tent of Meeting, or approach the altar to serve in the Holy [sanctuary], in order that they not bear iniquity and die. This is an everlasting statute for him and his descendants after him.

verses.ar_he: וְדֵין פִּתְגָמָא דִי תַעְבֵּד לְהוֹן לְקַדָשָׁא יָתְהוֹן לְשַׁמָשָׁא קֳדָמַי סַב תּוֹר חָד בַּר תּוֹרֵי וְדִכְרִין תְּרֵין שַׁלְמִין:
verses.ar_en: This is what you must do for them to consecrate them to serve [before] Me [as kohanim]. Take one young bull and two unblemished rams,

verses.ar_he: וּלְחֵם פַּטִיר וּגְרִיצִין פַּטִּירִין דְפִילָן בִּמְשַׁח וְאֶסְפּוֹגִין פַּטִּירִין דִמְשִׁיחִין בִּמְשָׁח סֻלְתָּא חִטִין תַּעְבֵּד יָתְהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: [also] unleavened bread, unleavened loaves mixed with [olive] oil. and unleavened wafers anointed with oil. You must make them with fine wheat flour.

verses.ar_he: וְתִתֵּן יָתְהוֹן עַל סַלָא חַד וּתְקָרֵב יָתְהוֹן בְּסַלָא וְיָת תּוֹרָא וְיָת תְּרֵין דִכְרִין:
verses.ar_en: Place them in one basket and bring them in the basket [along] with the young bull and the two rams.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת אַהֲרֹן וְיָת בְּנוֹהִי תְּקָרֵב לִתְרַע מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וְתַסְחֵי יָתְהוֹן בְּמַיָא:
verses.ar_en: Bring Aharon and his sons near to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and immerse them in the water.

verses.ar_he: וְתִסַב יָת לְבוּשַׁיָא וְתַלְבֵּשׁ יָת אַהֲרֹן יָת כִּתּוּנָא וְיָת מְעִיל אֵפוֹדָא וְיָת אֵפוֹדָא וְיָת חוּשְׁנָא וְתַתְקֵן לֵהּ בְּהֶמְיַן אֵפוֹדָא:
verses.ar_en: Take the garments and clothe Aharon with the undershirt, the robe of the eiphod, the eiphod, the breastplate, and gird [beautify] him with the belt of the eiphod.

verses.ar_he: וּתְשַׁוִי מִצְנֶפְתָּא עַל רֵישֵׁהּ וְתִתֵּן יָת כְּלִילָא דְקוּדְשָׁא עַל מִצְנֶפְתָּא:
verses.ar_en: Set the turban upon his head and place the sacred diadem upon the turban.

verses.ar_he: וְתִסַב יָת מִשְׁחָא דִרְבוּתָא וּתְרִיק עַל רֵישֵׁהּ וּתְרַבֵּהּ יָתֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: Take the anointing oil and pour it on his head and anoint him.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת בְּנוֹהִי תְּקָרֵב וְתַלְבֵּשִׁנוּן כִּתּוּנִין:
verses.ar_en: Bring his sons near and clothe them with undershirts.

verses.ar_he: וּתְזָרֵז יָתְהוֹן הֶמְיָנִין אַהֲרֹן וּבְנוֹהִי וְתַתְקֵן לְהוֹן כּוֹבָעִין וּתְהֵי לְהוֹן כְּהֻנְתָּא לִקְיַם עָלָם וּתְקָרֵב קֻרְבָּנָא דְאַהֲרֹן וְקֻרְבָּנָא דִבְנוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: Gird them—Aharon and his sons—with sash-belts, and bind turban-like hats for them, and the priesthood shall be for them an everlasting statute. Thus you shall install [offer the sacrifice of] Aharon and [the sacrifice of] his sons.

verses.ar_he: וּתְקָרֵב יָת תּוֹרָא לִקֳדָם מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וְיִסְמוֹךְ אַהֲרֹן וּבְנוֹהִי יָת יְדֵיהוֹן עַל רֵישׁ תּוֹרָא:
verses.ar_en: Bring the young bull before the Tent of Meeting, and Aharon and his sons shall support their hands on the head of the young bull.

verses.ar_he: וְתִכּוֹס יָת תּוֹרָא קֳדָם יְיָ בִּתְרַע מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא:
verses.ar_en: Slaughter the bull before Adonoy, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

verses.ar_he: וְתִסַב מִדְמָא דְתוֹרָא וְתִתֵּן עַל קַרְנַת מַדְבְּחָא בְּאֶצְבְּעָךְ וְיָת כָּל דְמָא תֵישׁוֹד לִיסוֹדָא דְמַדְבְּחָא:
verses.ar_en: Take of the blood of the bull and put it on the horn-like elevations of the altar with your finger, and pour all the [remaining] blood at the base of the altar.

verses.ar_he: וְתִסַב יָת כָּל תַּרְבָּא דְחָפֵי יָת גַוָא וְיָת חִצְרָא דִעַל כַּבְדָא וְיָת תַּרְתֵּין כָּלְיָן וְיָת תַּרְבָּא דִי עֲלֵיהֶן וְתַסֵיק לְמַדְבְּחָא:
verses.ar_en: Take all the fat that covers the inner organs, the lobe that is with the liver, the two kidneys with the fat that is upon them, and burn them on the altar.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת בִּסְרָא דְתוֹרָא וְיָת מַשְׁכֵהּ וְיָת אוּכְלֵהּ תּוֹקִיד בְּנוּרָא מִבָּרָא לְמַשְׁרִיתָא חַטָאתָא הוּא:
verses.ar_en: [However] the flesh of the bull, its skin, and its intestinal waste, you shall burn with fire outside the camp. It is a sin-offering.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת דִכְרָא חַד תִּסַב וְיִסְמְכוּן אַהֲרֹן וּבְנוֹהִי יָת יְדֵיהוֹן עַל רֵישׁ דִכְרָא:
verses.ar_en: Take the first ram and have Aharon and his sons support their hands on the head of the ram.

verses.ar_he: וְתִכּוֹס יָת דִכְרָא וְתִסַב יָת דְמֵהּ וְתִזְרוֹק עַל מַדְבְּחָא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר:
verses.ar_en: Slaughter the ram, and take its blood, and sprinkle it around the altar.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת דִכְרָא תְּפַלֵג לְאֵבָרוֹהִי וּתְחַלִיל גַּוֵהּ וּכְרָעוֹהִי וְתִתֵּן עַל אֵבָרוֹהִי וְעַל רֵישֵׁהּ:
verses.ar_en: Cut the ram into pieces [its limbs]. [Then] wash off its intestines and its legs and place them with its cut up pieces [limbs] and its head.

verses.ar_he: וְתַסֵיק יָת כָּל דִכְרָא לְמַדְבְּחָא עֲלָתָא הוּא קֳדָם יְיָ לְאִתְקַבָּלָא בְרַעֲוָא קֻרְבָּנָא קֳדָם יְיָ הוּא:
verses.ar_en: Burn the entire ram on the altar, it is a burnt-offering to [before] Adonoy, a pleasing fragrance [to be accepted with favor], a fire-offering to [sacrifice before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְתִסַב יָת דִכְרָא תִנְיָנָא וְיִסְמוֹךְ אַהֲרֹן וּבְנוֹהִי יָת יְדֵיהוֹן עַל רֵישׁ דִכְרָא:
verses.ar_en: Take the second ram and have Aharon and his sons support their hands on the head of the ram.

verses.ar_he: וְתִכּוֹס יָת דִכְרָא וְתִסַב מִדְמֵהּ וְתִתֵּן עַל רוּם אוּדְנָא דְאַהֲרֹן וְעַל רוּם אוּדְנָא דִבְנוֹהִי דְיַמִינָא וְעַל אִלְיוֹן יְדֵיהוֹן דְיַמִינָא וְעַל אִלְיוֹן רַגְלֵיהוֹן דְיַמִינָא וְתִזְרוֹק יָת דְמָא עַל מַדְבְּחָא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר:
verses.ar_en: Slaughter the ram, and take of its blood, and place it on the tip of Aharon’s right ear, and on the tip of the right ear of his sons, and on the thumb of their right hands, and on the big toe of their right feet. Sprinkle the [remaining] blood all around the altar.

verses.ar_he: וְתִסַב מִן דְמָא דִי עַל מַדְבְּחָא וּמִמִשְׁחָא דִרְבוּתָא וְתַדֵי עַל אַהֲרֹן וְעַל לְבוּשׁוֹהִי וְעַל בְּנוֹהִי וְעַל לְבוּשֵׁי בְנוֹהִי עִמֵהּ וְיִתְקַדַשׁ הוּא וּלְבוּשׁוֹהִי וּבְנוֹהִי וּלְבוּשֵׁי בְנוֹהִי עִמֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: Take of the blood that is on the altar, and of the anointing oil and sprinkle it upon Aharon and his garments, and upon his sons and their garments as well. Thus he and his garments will be consecrated, along with his sons and his son’s garments.

verses.ar_he: וְתִסַב מִן דִכְרָא תַּרְבָּא וְאַלִיתָא וְיָת תַּרְבָּא דְחָפֵי יָת גַוָא וְיָת חֲצַר כַּבְדָא וְיָת תַּרְתֵּן כָּלְיָן וְיָת תַּרְבָּא דִי עֲלֵיהֶן וְיָת שׁוֹקָא דְיַמִינָא אֲרֵי דְכַר קֻרְבָּנָא הוּא:
verses.ar_en: Take from the ram the [intestinal] fat, the broad tail, the fat that covers the inner organs, the lobe of the liver, the two kidneys, and the fat that is upon them, and the right shoulder, for it is a ram of a completion-offering [offering].

verses.ar_he: וּפִתָּא דִלְחֵם חַד וּגְרִצְתָּא דִלְחֵם מְשַׁח חֲדָא וְאֶסְפּוֹג חָד מִסַלָא דְפַטִירַיָא דִי קֳדָם יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: [Take also] one bread-cake, and one loaf of oiled bread, and one wafer from the basket of unleavened bread that is before Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וּתְשַׁוֵי כֹלָא עַל יְדָא דְאַהֲרֹן וְעַל יְדָא דִבְנוֹהִי וּתְרִים יָתְהוֹן אֲרָמוּתָא קֳדָם יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: Place all [these things] upon the [open] hands of Aharon, and upon the [open] hands of his sons, and you shall wave them for wave-offering before Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְתִסַב יָתְהוֹן מִידֵיהוֹן וְתַסֵיק לְמַדְבְּחָא עַל עֲלָתָא לְאִתְקַבָּלָא בְרַעֲוָא קֳדָם יְיָ קֻרְבָּנָא הוּא קֳדָם יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: Then take [these things] from their hands and burn them on the altar after the burnt-offering as a pleasing fragrance [to be accepted with favor] before Adonoy. It is a fire-offering to [sacrifice before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְתִסַב יָת חֶדְיָא מִדְכַר קֻרְבָּנַיָא דִי לְאַהֲרֹן וּתְרִים יָתֵהּ אֲרָמוּתָא קֳדָם יְיָ וִיהֵי לָךְ לָחֳלָק:
verses.ar_en: Take the breast from Aharon’s installation ram [offering] and wave it as wave-offering to [before] Adonoy. Then it shall be your [Moshe’s] portion.

verses.ar_he: וּתְקַדֵשׁ יָת חֶדְיָא דַאֲרָמוּתָא וְיָת שׁוֹקָא דְאַפְרָשׁוּתָא דִי אִתָּרַם וְדִי אִתַּפְרָשׁ מִדְכַר קֻרְבָּנַיָא מִדִי לְאַהֲרֹן וּמִדִי לִבְנוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: Sanctify the breast of the wave-offering, and the shoulder of the terumah-offering which were [the] waved and uplifted [parts] of the ram of the completion-offering [offering] [which was used to install] Aharon and his sons.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי לְאַהֲרֹן וְלִבְנוֹהִי לִקְיַם עָלָם מִן בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֲרֵי אַפְרָשׁוּתָא הוּא וְאַפְרָשׁוּתָא יְהֵי מִן בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מִנִכְסַת קוּדְשֵׁיהוֹן אַפְרָשׁוּתְהוֹן קֳדָם יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: It [the breast and shoulder] shall be for Aharon and his sons’ by statute for ever. [This portion is taken] from the B’nei Yisrael for it is a terumah-offering. It shall be a terumah-offering from the B’nei Yisrael taken from their peace-offerings. It is their terumah-offering to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וּלְבוּשֵׁי קוּדְשָׁא דִי לְאַהֲרֹן יְהוֹן לִבְנוֹהִי בַּתְרוֹהִי לְדַכָּאָה בְהוֹן וּלְקָרָבָא בְהוֹן יָת קֻרְבָּנְהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Aharon’s sacred garments shall be his son’s after him, to be uplifted through them and to be installed [offer their sacrifices] through them.

verses.ar_he: שִׁבְעַת יוֹמִין יַלְבֵּשִׁנוּן כַּהֲנָא תְּחוֹתוֹהִי מִבְּנוֹהִי דִי יֵעוֹל לְמַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא לְשַׁמָשָׁא בְקוּדְשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: Seven [consecutive] days shall they be worn by he who serves in his place—one of his sons—who will come into the Tent of Meeting to serve in the Holy [Sanctuary].

verses.ar_he: וְיָת דְכַר קֻרְבָּנַיָא תִּסָב וּתְבַשֵׁל יָת בִּסְרֵהּ בַּאֲתַר קַדִישׁ:
verses.ar_en: Take the [remainder of the] ram of the completion-offering [offering] and cook its flesh in a sacred place.

verses.ar_he: וְיֵכוּל אַהֲרֹן וּבְנוֹהִי יָת בְּסַר דִכְרָא וְיָת לַחְמָא דִי בְסַלָא לִתְרַע מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא:
verses.ar_en: Aharon and his sons shall eat the ram’s meat, along with the bread that is in the basket, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

verses.ar_he: וְיֵכְלוּן יָתְהוֹן דִי יִתְכַּפַּר בְּהוֹן לְקָרָבָא יָת קֻרְבָּנְהוֹן לְקַדָשָׁא יָתְהוֹן וְחִלוֹנַי לָא יֵיכוּל אֲרֵי קוּדְשָׁא אִנוּן:
verses.ar_en: They are to eat those things through which atonement was achieved, to install them [offer their sacrifices] and [thereby] to sanctify them. A stranger [a non-kohein] may not eat thereof for they are sacred.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם יִשְׁתָּאַר מִבְּסַר קֻרְבָּנַיָא וּמִן לַחְמָא עַד צַפְרָא וְתוֹקִיד יָת דְאִשְׁתָּאַר בְּנוּרָא לָא יִתְאֲכֵל אֲרֵי קוּדְשָׁא הוּא:
verses.ar_en: If any meat of the installation-offering [offering] is left over or if any of the bread [is left over] until morning, you must burn the leftovers in fire. It must not be eaten for it is sacred.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד לְאַהֲרֹן וְלִבְנוֹהִי כְּדֵין כְּכֹל דִי פַקֵּדִית יָתָךְ שִׁבְעַת יוֹמִין תְּקָרֵב קֻרְבָּנְהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: So shall you do for Aharon and his sons, according to all that I have commanded you. Seven days shall you install them [offer their sacrifices].

verses.ar_he: וְתוֹרָא דְחַטָאתָא תַּעְבֵּד לְיוֹמָא עַל כִּפּוּרַיָא וּתְדַכֵּי עַל מַדְבְּחָא בְּכַפָּרוּתָךְ עֲלוֹהִי וּתְרַבֵּי יָתֵהּ לְקַדָשׁוּתֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: Offer a bull for a sin-offering each day for atonement; and by sprinkling [its blood] on the altar you will purify [elevate] it [the altar.] You shall then anoint it to sanctify it.

verses.ar_he: שִׁבְעַת יוֹמִין תְּכַפֵּר עַל מַדְבְּחָא וּתְקַדֵשׁ יָתֵהּ וִיהֵי מַדְבְּחָא קֹדֶשׁ קוּדְשַׁיָא כָּל דְיִקְרַב בְּמַדְבְּחָא יִתְקַדָשׁ:
verses.ar_en: For seven days you shall make atonement for the altar and sanctify it and thus the altar will be Holy of Holies. Anything that touches the altar becomes sacred.

verses.ar_he: וְדֵין דִי תַעְבֵּד עַל מַדְבְּחָא אִמְרִין בְּנֵי שְׁנָא תְּרֵין לְיוֹמָא תְּדִירָא:
verses.ar_en: And this is what you shall offer upon the altar: two yearling lambs each day, continually.

verses.ar_he: יָת אִמְרָא חַד תַּעְבֵּד בְּצַפְרָא וְיָת אִמְרָא תִנְיָנָא תַּעְבֵּד בֵּין שִׁמְשַׁיָא:
verses.ar_en: Offer one lamb in the morning and offer the second lamb in the afternoon.

verses.ar_he: וְעִסְרוֹנָא סֻלְתָּא דְפִילָא בִמְשַׁח כָּתִישָׁא רַבְעוּת הִינָא וְנִסְכָּא רַבְעוּת הִינָא חַמְרָא לְאִמְרָא חָד:
verses.ar_en: And a tenth [of an ephah] of fine flour mixed with one fourth of a hin of pressed olive oil, and a libation of a fourth of a hin of wine for the first lamb.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת אִמְרָא תִנְיָנָא תַּעְבֵּד בֵּין שִׁמְשַׁיָא כְּמִנְחַת צַפְרָא וּכְנִסְכַּהּ תַּעְבֵּד לַהּ לְאִתְקַּבָּלָא בְרַעֲוָא קֻרְבָּנָא קֳדָם יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: Offer the second lamb in the afternoon. As the meal-offering of the morning together with its libation, shall you offer it, for a pleasing fragrance [to be accepted with favor], a fire-offering to [sacrifice before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: עֲלָתָא תְדִירָא לְדָרֵיכוֹן בִּתְרַע מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא קֳדָם יְיָ דִאֱזַמֵן מֵימְרִי לְכוֹן תַּמָן לְמַלָלָא עִמָךְ תַּמָן:
verses.ar_en: This shall be a continual burnt-offering for your generations. [It shall be offered] at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, before Adonoy, where I will meet [prepare My Word] with you, to speak to you there.

verses.ar_he: וֶאֱזַמֵן מֵימְרִי תַמָן לִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְיִתְקַדַשׁ בִּיקָרִי:
verses.ar_en: It is there that I will meet [prepare My Word] with the B’nei Yisrael, and it [I] will be sanctified with My Glory.

verses.ar_he: וֶאֱקַדֵשׁ יָת מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וְיָת מַדְבְּחָא וְיָת אַהֲרֹן וְיָת בְּנוֹהִי אֱקַדֵשׁ לְשַׁמָשָׁא קֳדָמַי:
verses.ar_en: I will sanctify the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and Aharon and his sons I will sanctify to serve [before] Me as kohanim.

verses.ar_he: וְאַשְׁרֵי שְׁכִנְתִּי בְּגוֹ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאֶהֱוֵי לְהוֹן לֶאֱלָהּ:
verses.ar_en: I will dwell [rest My Shechina] among the B’nei Yisrael, and I will be their God.

verses.ar_he: וְיִדְעוּן אֲרֵי אֲנָא יְיָ אֱלָהֲהוֹן דִי אַפֵּקִית יָתְהוֹן מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם לְאַשְׁרָאָה שְׁכִנְתִּי בֵּינֵיהוֹן אֲנָא יְיָ אֱלָהֲהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: They will know that I, Adonoy, am their God who brought them out of the land of Egypt to dwell [rest My Shechina] among them. I am Adonoy, their God.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵד מַדְבְּחָא לְאַקְטָרָא עֲלוֹהִי קְטוֹרֶת בּוּסְמַיָא דְאָעֵי שִׁטִין תַּעְבֵּד יָתֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: You shall make an altar [upon which] to burn incense [spices]. Make it out of Acacia wood.

verses.ar_he: אַמְתָא אֻרְכֵּהּ וְאַמְתָא פְתָיֵהּ מְרַבַּע יְהֵי וְתַרְתֵּין אַמִין רוּמֵהּ מִנֵהּ קַרְנוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: It shall be one amoh long and one amoh wide, it shall be a square, and two amohs high. Its horn-like elevations shall be of one piece with it.

verses.ar_he: וְתַחֲפֵי יָתֵהּ דְהַב דְכֵי יָת אִגָרֵהּ וְיָת כָּתְלוֹהִי סְחוֹר סְחוֹר וְיָת קַרְנוֹהִי וְתַעְבֵּד לֵהּ דֵיר דִדְהב סְחוֹר סְחוֹר:
verses.ar_en: You shall overlay it with pure gold, on its top, its walls all around, and its horn-like elevations, and make a gold crown-like rim all around it.

verses.ar_he: וְתַרְתֵּין עִזְקַן דִדְהַב תַּעְבֶּד לֵהּ מִלְרַע לְדֵירֵהּ עַל תַּרְתֵּין זִוְיָתֵהּ תַּעְבֵּד עַל תְּרֵין סִטְרוֹהִי וִיהֵי לְאַתְרָא לַאֲרִיחַיָא לְמִטַל יָתֵהּ בְּהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Make two gold rings for it under its crown-like rim, on two of its corners. Make them on its two opposite sides. They will house the poles with which it is carried.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד יָת אֲרִיחַיָא דְאָעֵי שִׁטִין וְתַחֲפֵי יָתְהוֹן דַהֲבָא:
verses.ar_en: Make the poles out of acacia wood and overlay them with gold.

verses.ar_he: וְתִתֵּן יָתֵה קֳדָם פָּרֻכְתָּא דִי עַל אֲרוֹנָא דְסַהֲדוּתָא לִקֳדָם כַּפֻּרְתָּא דִי עַל סַהֲדוּתָא דִי אֲזַמֵן מֵימְרִי לָךְ תַּמָן:
verses.ar_en: Place it in front of the paroches that is by the Ark of the Testimony, in front of the covering that is on the Testimony where I will meet [prepare My Word] with you there.

verses.ar_he: וְיַקְטַר עֲלוֹהִי אַהֲרֹן קְטוֹרֶת בּוּסְמִין בִּצְפַר בִּצְפַר בְּאַתְקָנוּתֵהּ יָת בּוֹצִינַיָא יַסֵקִנַהּ:
verses.ar_en: Aharon shall burn upon it incense of spices. Every morning when he cleans the lamps, he shall burn it.

verses.ar_he: וּבְאַדְלָקוּת אַהֲרֹן יָת בּוֹצִינַיָא בֵּין שִׁמְשַׁיָא יַסֵקִנַהּ קְטוֹרֶת בּוּסְמַיָא תְדִירָא קֳדָם יְיָ לְדָרֵיכוֹן:
verses.ar_en: And when Aharon lights the lamps in the afternoon, he shall burn it. It is a continual incense [spice]-offering before Adonoy for you generations.

verses.ar_he: לָא תַסְקוּן עֲלוֹהִי קְטוֹרֶת בּוּסְמִין נוּכְרָאִין וַעֲלָתָא וּמִנְחָתָא וְנִסְכָּא לָא תְנַסְכוּן עֲלוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: Do not bring upon it strange [unauthorized] incense [spices]; neither burnt-offerings nor meal-offerings. You shall not pour a libation-offering upon it.

verses.ar_he: וִיכַפֵר אַהֲרֹן עַל קַרְנוֹהִי חֲדָא בְּשַׁתָּא מִדְמָא חַטַאת כִּפּוּרַיָא חֲדָא בְשַׁתָּא יְכַפֵּר עֲלוֹהִי לְדָרֵיכוֹן קֹדֶשׁ קוּדְשִׁין הוּא קֳדָם יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: Aharon shall make atonement on its horn-like elevations once each year. With the blood of the sin-offering of atonement, he shall make atonement on it once each year for your generations. It is Holy of Holies to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם משֶׁה לְמֵימָר:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying,

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי תְקַבֵּל יָת חֻשְׁבַּן בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמִנְיָנֵיהוֹן וְיִתְּנוּן גְבַר פֻּרְקַן נַפְשֵׁהּ קֳדָם יְיָ כַּד תִּמְנֵי יָתְהוֹן וְלָא יְהֵי בְהוֹן מוֹתָא כַּד תִּמְנֵי יָתְהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: “When you take the count of the B’nei Yisrael to determine their numbers, each man shall give an atonement pledge [a redemption] for his soul to [before] Adonoy, when you count them. Thus there will be no plague among them when you count them.

verses.ar_he: דֵין יִתְּנוּן כָּל דְעָבַר עַל מִנְיָנַיָּא פַּלְגוּת סִלְעָא בְּסִלְעֵי קוּדְשָׁא עֶסְרִין מָעִין סִלְעָא פַּלְגוּת סִלְעָא אַפְרָשׁוּתָא קֳדָם יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: Everyone passing by to be counted must give this—half a shekel [sela] based on the shekel [sela] of the Holy [Sanctuary,] where a shekel [sela] is twenty geirah [ma’in]. Half of such a shekel [sela] must be given as a terumah-offering to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: כֹּל דְעָבַר עַל מִנְיָנַיָא מִבַּר עֶסְרִין שְׁנִין וּלְעֵלָא יִתֵּן אַפְרָשׁוּתָא קֳדָם יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: Everyone passing by to be counted, from [age] twenty years and older, must give a terumah-offering to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: דְעַתִּיר לָא יַסְגֵי וּדְמִסְכֵּן לָא יַזְעֵר מִפַּלְגוּת סִלְעָא לְמִתַּן יָת אַפְרָשׁוּתָא קֳדָם יְיָ לְכַפָּרָא עַל נַפְשָׁתֵיכוֹן:
verses.ar_en: The rich shall not give more, and the poor shall not give less than half a shekel [sela], when giving this terumah-offering to [before] Adonoy to atone for your souls.

verses.ar_he: וְתִסַב יָת כְּסַף כִּפּוּרַיָא מִן בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְתִתֵּן יָתֵהּ עַל פָּלְחַן מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וִיהֵי לִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְדָכְרָנָא קֳדָם יְיָ לְכַפָּרָא עַל נַפְשָׁתֵיכוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Take this atonement money from the B’nei Yisrael and donate it for the work of the Tent of Meeting. It will be a remembrance for the B’nei Yisrael before Adonoy to atone for your souls.”

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם משֶׁה לְמֵימָר:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying:

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד כִּיוֹרָא דִנְחָשָׁא וּבְסִיסֵהּ נְחָשָׁא לְקִדוּשׁ וְתִתֵּן יָתֵהּ בֵּין מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וּבֵין מַדְבְּחָא וְתִתֵּן תַּמָן מַיָא:
verses.ar_en: “Make a copper wash basin and its copper base for washing [sanctification]; and place it between the Tent of Meeting and the Altar, and put water in it.

verses.ar_he: וִיקַדְשׁוּן אַהֲרֹן וּבְנוֹהִי מִנֵהּ יָת יְדֵיהוֹן וְיָת רַגְלֵיהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Aharon and his sons will wash from it [sanctify] their hands and their feet [from it].

verses.ar_he: בְּמֵיעַלְהוֹן לְמַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא יְקַדְשׁוּן מַיָא וְלָא יְמוּתוּן אוֹ בְמִקְרָבְהוֹן לְמַדְבְּחָא לְשַׁמָשָׁא לְאַסָקָא קֻרְבָּנָא קֳדָם יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: Before entering the Tent of Meeting they must wash [sanctify] with water and they will not die, or whenever they approach the Altar for Divine service, or to burn a fire-offering to [sacrifice before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וִיקַדְשׁוּן יְדֵיהוֹן וְרַגְלֵיהוֹן וְלָא יְמוּתוּן וּתְהֵי לְהוֹן קְיָם עָלָם לֵהּ וְלִבְנוֹהִי לְדָרֵיהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: They must wash [sanctify] their hands and their feet and they will not die. This is a perpetual statute for them, for him [Aharon] and his descendants for all their generations.”

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם משֶׁה לְמֵימָר:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe saying.

verses.ar_he: וְאַתְּ סַב לָךְ בּוּסְמִין רֵישָׁא מֵירָא דַכְיָא מַתְקַל חֲמֵשׁ מְאָה וְקִנְמָן בֶּשֶׂם פַּלְגוּתֵהּ מַתְקַל מָאתָן וְחַמְשִׁין וּקְנֵה בוּסְמָא מַתְקַל מָאתָן וְחַמְשִׁין:
verses.ar_en: “You shall take the finest spices, [the weight of] five hundred [shekels] of pure myrrh, half portions of fragrant cinnamon, [consisting of] [the weight of] two hundred and fifty [shekels] each, and [the weight of] two hundred and fifty [shekels] of calamus spices.

verses.ar_he: וּקְצִיעֵתָא מַתְקַל חֲמֵשׁ מְאָה בְּסִלְעֵי קוּדְשָׁא וּמְשַׁח זֵיתָא מְלֵא הִינָא:
verses.ar_en: [Also take] [the weight of] five hundred [shekels] of cassia based on the shekel [sela] value of the Holy [Sanctuary], and a [full] hin of olive oil.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד יָתֵהּ מְשַׁח רְבוּת קוּדְשָׁא בּוֹסֶם מְבַסָם עוֹבַד בּוּסְמָנוּ מְשַׁח רְבוּת קוּדְשָׁא יְהֵא:
verses.ar_en: Make it into sacred anointing oil, a blend made by a [perfume] blender. It shall be a sacred anointing oil.

verses.ar_he: וּתְרַבִּי בֵהּ יָת מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וְיָת אֲרוֹנָא דְסַהֲדוּתָא:
verses.ar_en: Anoint with it the Tent of Meeting, and the Ark of the Testimony,

verses.ar_he: וְיָת פָּתוֹרָא וְיָת כָּל מָנוֹהִי וְיָת מְנַרְתָּא וְיָת מָנָהָא וְיָת מַדְבְּחָא דִקְטֹרֶת בּוּסְמַיָא:
verses.ar_en: And the Table and all its vessels, and the Menorah and its vessels, and the [Spice] Incense Altar,

verses.ar_he: וְיָת מַדְבַּח דַעֲלָתָא וְיָת כָּל מָנוֹהִי וְיָת כִּיוֹרָא וְיָת בְּסִיסֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: And the Burnt-offering Altar and all its vessels, and the wash basin and its base.

verses.ar_he: וּתְקַדֵשׁ יָתְהוֹן וִיהוֹן קֹדֶשׁ קוּדְשַׁיָא כָּל דְיִקְרַב בְּהוֹן יִתְקַדָשׁ:
verses.ar_en: Sanctify them and they will become holy of holies. Anything that touches them will become holy.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת אַהֲרֹן וְיָת בְּנוֹהִי תְּרַבִּי וּתְקַדֵשׁ יָתְהוֹן לְשַׁמָשָׁא קֳדָמַי:
verses.ar_en: You shall also anoint Aharon and his sons, and sanctify them to serve [before] Me as kohanim.”

verses.ar_he: וְעִם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל תְּמַלֵל לְמֵימָר מְשַׁח רְבוּת קוּדְשָׁא יְהֵי דֵין קֳדָמַי לְדָרֵיכוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Speak to the B’nei Yisrael, saying: “This shall be sacred anointing oil to [before] Me for all your generations.

verses.ar_he: עַל בִּסְרָא דַאֲנָשָׁא לָא יִתְנַסַךְ וּבִדְמוּתֵהּ לָא תַעְבְּדוּן כְּוָתֵהּ קוּדְשָׁא הוּא קוּדְשָׁא יְהֵי לְכוֹן:
verses.ar_en: It must not be poured on the flesh of any man, and its formula [likeness] must not be duplicated. It is sacred. It must be sacred to you.

verses.ar_he: גְבַר דִי יְבַסֵם דִכְוָתֵהּ וְדִי יִתֵּן מִנֵהּ עַל חִלוֹנָי וְיִשְׁתֵּצֵי מֵעַמֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: If a person compounds a similar formula, or if he places from it upon an unauthorized person, he shall be cut off [spiritually] from his people.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה סַב לָךְ בּוּסְמִין נְטוֹפָא וְטוּפְרָא וְחֶלְבְּנֵתָא בּוּסְמִין וּלְבוּנְתָא דָכִיתָא מַתְקַל בְּמַתְקַל יְהֵי:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe, Take for yourself spices, stacte, onycha and galbanum, spices and pure frankincense. They shall be of equal weight.

verses.ar_he: וְתַעְבֵּד יָתַהּ קְטוֹרֶת בּוּסְמִין בּוֹסֶם עוֹבַד בּוּסְמָנוּ מְעָרַב דְכֵי קוּדְשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: Make it into incense [spice], a blend blended by a blender, thoroughly blended, pure and holy.

verses.ar_he: וְתִשְׁחוֹק מִנַהּ וְתַדִיק וְתִתֵּן מִנַהּ קֳדָם סַהֲדוּתָא בְּמַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא דִי אֱזַמֵן מֵימְרִי לָךְ תַּמָן קֹדֶשׁ קוּדְשִׁין תְּהֵי לְכוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Pulverize some of it very finely and place it before the [Ark of] Testimony in the Tent of Meeting, where I will meet [prepare My Word] with you. It shall be holy of holies to you.

verses.ar_he: וּקְטֹרֶת בּוּסְמִין דִי תַעְבֵּד בִּדְמוּתַהּ לָא תַעְבְּדוּן לְכוֹן קוּדְשָׁא תְּהֵי לָךְ קֳדָם יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: The incense [spice] you are making, its formula [likeness] must not be duplicated for you[r use]. It shall be sacred to you for [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: גְבַר דִיַעְבֵּד דִכְוָתַהּ לַאֲרָחָא בַהּ וְיִשְׁתֵּצֵי מֵעַמֵּהּ:
verses.ar_en: A person who duplicates this formula to enjoy its fragrance, shall be cut off [spiritually] from his people.”

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם משֶׁה לְמֵימָר:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe, saying,

verses.ar_he: חֲזֵי דְרַבֵּיתִי בְשׁוּם בְּצַלְאֵל בַּר אוּרִי בַּר חוּר לְשִׁבְטָא דִיהוּדָה:
verses.ar_en: “I have called [exalted] by name [designated] Betzalel, son of Uri son of Chur, of the tribe of Yehudah.

verses.ar_he: וְאַשְׁלֵמִית עִמֵהּ רוּחַ מִן קֳדָם יְיָ בְּחָכְמְתָא וּבְסוּכְלְתָנוּ וּבְמַדַע וּבְכָל עִבִידָא:
verses.ar_en: I have filled him with Divine spirit [from before Elohim], with wisdom, with understanding, with knowledge, and with [the skill to perform] all types of crafting,

verses.ar_he: לְאַלָפָא אוּמַנְוָן לְמֶעְבַּד בְּדַהֲבָא וּבְכַסְפָּא וּבִנְחָשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: to devise plans [teach craftsmanship] to work in gold, in silver, and in copper,

verses.ar_he: וּבְאָמָנוּת אֶבֶן טָבָא לְאַשְׁלָמָא וּבְנַגָרוּת אָעָא לְמֶעְבַּד בְּכָל עִבִידָא:
verses.ar_en: to cut [precious] stones for setting, to carve wood, and to work in all types of crafting.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲנָא הָא יְהָבִית עִמֵהּ יָת אָהֳלִיאָב בַּר אֲחִיסָמָךְ לְשִׁבְטָא דְדָן וּבְלִבָּא כָל חַכִּימֵי לִבָּא יְהָבִית חָכִמְתָא וְיַעְבִּדוּן יָת כָּל דִי פַקֵדִתָּךְ:
verses.ar_en: And behold, I have appointed [to serve] with him, Oholiav, son of Achisamach of the tribe of Don. In the heart of every wise-hearted person I have placed wisdom, so they can make all that I have commanded:

verses.ar_he: יָת מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וְיָת אֲרוֹנָא לְסַהֲדוּתָא וְיָת כַּפֻּרְתָּא דִי עֲלוֹהִי וְיָת כָּל מָנֵי מַשְׁכְּנָא:
verses.ar_en: the Tent of Meeting, the Ark for the Testimony, the [Ark] Cover that is to be placed on it, and all the vessels [furniture] of the Tent:

verses.ar_he: וְיָת פָּתוֹרָא וְיָת מָנוֹהִי וְיָת מְנַרְתָּא דָכִיתָא וְיָת כָּל מָנָהָא וְיָת מַדְבְּחָא דִקְטּוֹרֶת בּוּסְמַיָא:
verses.ar_en: the Table and its vessels, The pure [gold] Menorah, and all its vessels, and the [Spice] Incense Altar,

verses.ar_he: וְיָת מַדְבְּחָא דַעֲלָתָא וְיָת כָּל מָנוֹהִי וְיָת כִּיוֹרָא וְיָת בְּסִיסֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: the Burnt—offering Altar, and all its vessels, the Wash Basin and its base.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת לְבוּשֵׁי שִׁמוּשָׁא וְיָת לְבוּשֵׁי קוּדְשָׁא לְאַהֲרֹן כַּהֲנָא וְיָת לְבוּשֵׁי בְנוֹהִי לְשַׁמָשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: [They shall also make] garments [coverings] of crochet-work [service], as well as the sacred garments for Aharon, the kohein, and the garments for his sons to serve [as kohanim,]

verses.ar_he: וְיָת מִשְׁחָא דִרְבוּתָא וְיָת קְטוֹרֶת בּוּסְמַיָא לְקוּדְשָׁא כְּכֹל דִי פַקֵדִתָּךְ יַעְבְּדוּן:
verses.ar_en: [Also] the anointing oil, and the incense of spices for the Holy [Sanctuary,] according to all that I have commanded you,” they shall make.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה לְמֵימָר:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe, saying,

verses.ar_he: וְאַתְּ מַלֵל עִם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמֵימַר בְּרַם יָת יוֹמֵי שַׁבַּיָא דִי לִי תִּטְּרוּן אֲרֵי אָת הִיא בֵּין מֵימְרִי וּבֵינֵיכוֹן לְדָרֵיכוֹן לְמִדַע אֲרֵי אֲנָא יְיָ מְקַדִשְׁכוֹן:
verses.ar_en: And you speak to the B’nei Yisrael, saying, You must still preserve My Shabbos [days], for it is a sign between Me [My Word] and yourselves for your generations to know that I Adonoy am making you holy.

verses.ar_he: וְתִטְּרוּן יָת שַׁבְּתָא אֲרֵי קוּדְשָׁא הִיא לְכוֹן מְחַלְלִנַהּ אִתְקְטָלָא יִתְקְטֵל אֲרֵי כָּל דְיַעְבֶּד בַּהּ עִבִידָא וְיִשְׁתֵּצֵי אֲנָשָׁא הַהוּא מִגוֹ עַמֵּהּ:
verses.ar_en: You shall [therefore] preserve the Shabbos for it is sacred to you. Anyone who profanes it shall be put to death, for whoever does work on it [Shabbos] shall be cut off [spiritually] from the midst of his people.

verses.ar_he: שִׁתָּא יוֹמִין יִתְעֲבֵד עִבִידָא וּבְיוֹמָא שְׁבִיעָאָה שְׁבַת שַׁבְּתָא קוּדְשָׁא קֳדָם יְיָ כָּל דְיַעְבֵּד עִבִדְתָּא בְּיוֹמָא דְשַׁבְּתָא אִתְקְטָלָא יִתְקְטֵל:
verses.ar_en: You may do work on [the] six days [of the week] but the seventh day is a Shabbos of complete rest, it is sacred to [before] Adonoy. Whoever does work on the day of Shabbos shall be put to death.

verses.ar_he: וְיִטְרוּן בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל יָת שַׁבְּתָא לְמֶעְבַּד יָת שַׁבְּתָא לְדָרֵיהוֹן קְיַם עָלָם:
verses.ar_en: The B’nei Yisrael shall preserve the Shabbos, to maintain the Shabbos for their generations, as an everlasting covenant.

verses.ar_he: בֵּין מֵימְרִי וּבֵין בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אָת הִיא לְעָלָם אֲרֵי שִׁתָּא יוֹמִין עֲבַד יְיָ יָת שְׁמַיָא וְיָת אַרְעָא וּבְיוֹמָא שְׁבִיעָאָה שְׁבַת וְנַח:
verses.ar_en: Between Me [My Word] and between the B’nei Yisrael it is an everlasting sign; for in six days Adonoy made the heavens and the earth, and on the seventh day, He abstained from work and He rested.”

verses.ar_he: וִיהַב לְמשֶׁה כַּד שֵׁיצֵי לְמַלָלָא עִמֵהּ בְּטוּרָא דְסִינָי תְּרֵין לוּחֵי סַהֲדוּתָא לוּחֵי אַבְנָא כְּתִיבִין בְּאֶצְבְּעָא דַיְיָ:
verses.ar_en: And He [Adonoy] gave to Moshe—when He finished speaking with him on Mount Sinai—two Tablets of the Testimony. They were stone tablets, written with God’s finger.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזָא עַמָא אֲרֵי אוֹחַר משֶׁה לְמֵחַת מִן טוּרָא וְאִתְכְּנֵשׁ עַמָא עַל אַהֲרֹן וַאֲמָרוּ לֵהּ קוּם עֲבֵד לָנָא דַחֲלָן דִיְהָכוּן קֳדָמָנָא אֲרֵי דֵין משֶׁה גַבְרָא דִי אַסְקָנָא מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם לָא יְדַעְנָא מָא הֲוָה לֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: [When] the people saw that Moshe was late in coming down from the mountain, they gathered against Aharon, and said to him, “Arise, make us gods that will lead us, for this Moshe, the man who brought us up from the land of Egypt, we do not know what happened to him.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לְהוֹן אַהֲרֹן פְּרִיקוּ קָדָשֵׁי דְדַהֲבָא דִי בְאוּדְנֵי נְשֵׁיכוֹן בְּנֵיכוֹן וּבְנָתֵיכוֹן וְאַיְתִיוּ לְוָתִי:
verses.ar_en: Aharon said to them, “Remove the golden rings which are on the ears of your wives, your sons, and your daughters and bring them to me.”

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְפְּרִיקוּ כָּל עַמָא יָת קָדָשֵׁי דְדַהֲבָא דִי בְאוּדְנֵיהוֹן וְאַיְתִיוּ לְאַהֲרֹן:
verses.ar_en: All the people removed the golden rings which were on their ears, and brought them to Aharon.

verses.ar_he: וּנְסִיב מִידֵיהוֹן וְצַר יָתֵהּ בְּזִיפָא וְעָבְדֵהּ עֵגֶל מַתְּכָא וַאֲמָרוּ אִלֵין דַחַלְתָּךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל דִי אַסְקוּךְ מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרָיִם:
verses.ar_en: He took them from their hands, and formed it with [a goldsmith’s] engraving tool, and made it into a molten calf. They [then] said, “These, Yisrael, are your gods who brought you up from the land of Egypt.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזָא אַהֲרֹן וּבְנָא מַדְבְּחָא קֳדָמוֹהִי וּקְרָא אַהֲרֹן וַאֲמַר חַגָא קֳדָם יְיָ מְחָר:
verses.ar_en: [When] Aharon saw [this], he built an altar before it. Aharon then called out and said: “Tomorrow will be a festival to [before] Adonoy.”

verses.ar_he: וְאַקְדִימוּ בְּיוֹמָא דְבַתְרוֹהִי וְאַסִיקוּ עֲלָוָן וְקָרִיבוּ נִכְסִין וְאַסְחַר עַמָא לְמֵיכַל וּלְמִשְׁתֵּי וְקָמוּ לְחַיָכָא:
verses.ar_en: They arose early the next morning, and offered burnt-offerings and brought peace-offerings. The people then sat down [reclined] to eat and drink, and got up to amuse themselves.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם משֶׁה אִזֵל חוּת אֲרֵי חַבִּיל עַמָּךְ דִי אַסֶקְתָּא מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרָיִם:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe, “Go down, for your people have become corrupt—those whom you brought up out of the land of Egypt.

verses.ar_he: סָטוּ בִּפְרִיעַ מִן אוֹרְחָא דִי פַקֶדְתִּנוּן עֲבָדוּ לְהוֹן עֵגֶל מַתְּכָא וּסְגִידוּ לֵהּ וְדַבָּחוּ לֵהּ וַאֲמָרוּ אִלֵין דַחַלְתָּךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל דִי אַסְקוּךְ מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרָיִם:
verses.ar_en: They have departed quickly from the way that I commanded them, they have made for themselves a molten calf. They have prostrated themselves to it and offered sacrifices to it, and have said, ‘These, Yisrael, are your gods who brought you up out of the land of Egypt.’”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה גְלִי קֳדָמַי עַמָא הָדֵין וְהָא עַמָא קְשֵׁי קְדַל הוּא:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe, “I have seen [observed] this people [are revealed before Me], and behold they are a stiff-necked people.

verses.ar_he: וּכְעַן הַנַּח בָּעוּתָךְ מִן קֳדָמַי וְיִתְקֵף רוּגְזִי בְהוֹן וְאֵישֵׁיצִנוּן וְאֶעְבֵּד יָתָךְ לְעַם סַגִי:
verses.ar_en: Now leave Me alone [leave your prayer from before Me] and My wrath will blaze against them and destroy them. I will then make you into a great nation.”

verses.ar_he: וְצַלִי משֶׁה קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהֵהּ וַאֲמַר לְמָא יְיָ יִתְקֵף רוּגְזָךְ בְּעַמָךְ דִי אַפֶּקְתָּא מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם בְּחֵיל רַב וּבִידָא תַקִיפָא:
verses.ar_en: Moshe implored [prayed] before the Presence of Adonoy, his God, and he said, “Adonoy! Why should Your wrath blaze against Your people whom You brought out from the land of Egypt with great power and with a mighty hand?

verses.ar_he: לְמָא יֵימְרוּן מִצְרָאֵי לְמֵימַר בְּבִישְׁתָּא אַפֶּקְתִּנוּן לְקַטָלָא יָתְהוֹן בֵינֵי טוּרַיָא וּלְשֵׁיצָיוּתְהוֹן מֵעַל אַפֵּי אַרְעָא תּוּב מִתְּקוֹף רוּגְזָךְ וְאָתֵיב מִן בִּשָׁתָא דְמַלֶלְתָּא לְמֶעְבַּד לְעַמָךְ:
verses.ar_en: Why should Egypt be able to say, ‘He brought them out with evil intent, to kill them in [between] the mountains, and to annihilate them from the face of the earth?’ Turn from [withdraw] Your blazing wrath, and reconsider the [intent of doing] evil to Your people.

verses.ar_he: אִדְכַּר לְאַבְרָהָם לְיִצְחָק וּלְיִשְׂרָאֵל עַבְדָיךְ דִי קַיֶמְתָּא לְהוֹן בְּמֵימְרָךְ וּמַלֶלְתָּא עִמְהוֹן אַסְגֵי יָת בְּנֵיכוֹן כְּכוֹכְבֵי שְׁמַיָא וְכָל אַרְעָא הָדָא דִי אֲמָרִית אֶתֵּן לִבְנֵיכוֹן וְיַחְסְנוּן לַעֲלָם:
verses.ar_en: Remember Avraham, Yitzchok and Yisrael, Your servants, to whom You swore by Your Self [Word], and said to them, ‘I will make your descendants as numerous as the stars of the heaven; and all this land of which I have spoken, I will give to your descendants, and they will inherit it forever.’”

verses.ar_he: וְתַב יְיָ מִן בִּישְׁתָא דִי מַלִיל לְמֶעְבַּד לְעַמֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy reconsidered the [intent of doing] evil that He had said He would do to His people.

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְפְּנֵי וּנְחַת משֶׁה מִן טוּרָא וּתְרֵין לוּחֵי סַהֲדוּתָא בִּידֵהּ לוּחֵי כְּתִיבִין מִתְּרֵין עִבְרֵיהוֹן מִכָּא וּמִכָּא אִנוּן כְּתִיבִין:
verses.ar_en: Moshe turned and went down from the mountain with the two Tablets of the Testimony in his hand. They were tablets written on both sides, the writing was [visible] from either side.

verses.ar_he: וְלוּחַיָא עוֹבָדָא דַיְיָ אִנוּן וּכְתָבָא כְּתָבָא דַיְיָ הוּא מְפָרַשׁ עַל לוּחַיָא:
verses.ar_en: The Tablets were the work of God, and the writing was the writing of God, engraved upon the Tablets.

verses.ar_he: וּשְׁמַע יְהוֹשֻׁעַ יָת קַל עַמָא כַּד מְיַבְּבִן וַאֲמַר לְמשֶׁה קַל קְרָבָא בְּמַשְׁרִיתָא:
verses.ar_en: Yehoshua heard the voice of the people rejoicing, and he said to Moshe, “There is a sound of battle in the camp.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לָא קַל גִבָּרִין דְנַצְחִין בִּקְרָבָא וְאַף לָא קַל חַלָשִׁין דְמִתַּבְּרִין קַל דִמְחַיְכִין אֲנָא שְׁמָע:
verses.ar_en: But he [Moshe] said, “It is not the sound of strength [song of victory] [the mighty who are victorious in war], nor is it the sound of weakness [song of defeat] [the weak who are broken]. It is a sound of song [the rejoicers] that I hear.”

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה כַּד קָרִיב לְמַשְׁרִיתָא וַחֲזָא יָת עֶגְלָא וְחִנְגִין וּתְקֵיף רוּגְזָא דְמשֶׁה וּרְמָא מִידוֹהִי יָת לוּחַיָא וְתַבַּר יָתְהוֹן בְּשִׁפּוֹלֵי טּוּרָא:
verses.ar_en: As he [Moshe] approached the camp, he saw the calf and the dancing. Moshe’s anger blazed, and he threw down the Tablets that were in his hands and smashed them beneath [at the bottom of] the mountain.

verses.ar_he: וּנְסֵיב יָת עֶגְלָא דִי עֲבָדוּ וְאוֹקֵד בְּנוּרָא וְשַׁף עַד דַהֲוָה דַקִיק וּזְרָא עַל אַפֵּי מַיָא וְאַשְׁקֵי יָת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל:
verses.ar_en: He took the calf that they had made, and burned it in fire, and ground it into fine powder. He then scattered it on the water, and made the B’nei Yisrael drink it.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר משֶׁה לְאַהֲרֹן מָא עֲבַד לָךְ עַמָא הָדֵין אֲרֵי אַיְתֵיתָא עֲלוֹהִי חוֹבָא רַבָּא:
verses.ar_en: Moshe then said to Aharon, “What did this people do to you that you brought upon them such a great sin?”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר אַהֲרֹן לָא יִתְקֵף רוּגְזָא דְרִבּוֹנִי אַתְּ יְדַעְתְּ יָת עַמָא אֲרֵי בְּבִישׁ הוּא:
verses.ar_en: Aharon said, “Let not the wrath of my master blaze. You know that the people are set on evil.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמָרוּ לִי עִבֵיד לָנָא דַחֲלָן דִי יְהָכָן קֳדָמָנָא אֲרֵי דֵין משֶׁה גַבְרָא דִי אַסְקָנָא מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם לָא יְדַעְנָא מָא הֲוָה לֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: They said to me, ‘Make gods for us that will lead us for this Moshe, the man who brought us up from the land of Egypt, we do not know what happened to him.’

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמָרִית לְהוֹן לְמָן דַהֲבָא פְּרִיקוּ וִיהָבוּ לִי וּרְמִיתֵהּ בְּנוּרָא וּנְפַק עֶגְלָא הָדֵין:
verses.ar_en: I said to them, ‘Who has gold?’ They removed [their gold] and gave it to me. I threw it into the fire, and this calf emerged.”

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזָא משֶׁה יָת עַמָא אֲרֵי בְטִיל הוּא אֲרֵי בָטֵילִנוּן אַהֲרֹן לַאֲסָבוּתְהוֹן שׁוּם בִּישׁ לְדָרֵיהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Moshe saw [the bad traits of] the people for they were [now] exposed [rejected]; for Aharon had allowed them to be exposed [nullified them], and now they would be disgraced among their adversaries [to make them take a bad name for themselves for their generations].

verses.ar_he: וְקָם משֶׁה בִּתְרַע מַשְׁרִיתָא וַאֲמַר מָן דַחֲלַיָא דַיְיָ יֵיתוּן לְוָתִי וְאִתְכַּנָשׁוּ לְוָתֵהּ כָּל בְּנֵי לֵוִי:
verses.ar_en: Moshe stood at the entrance of the camp and said, “Whoever is for [fears] Adonoy, [come] to me.” All the sons of Leivi gathered to him.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לְהוֹן כִּדְנַן אֲמַר יְיָ אֱלָהָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל שַׁווּ גְבַר חַרְבֵּהּ עַל יַרְכֵּהּ עִבַרוּ וְתוּבוּ מִתְּרַע לִתְרַע בְּמַשְׁרִיתָא וּקְטוּלוּ גְבַר יָת אָחוּהִי וּגְבַר יָת חַבְרֵהּ וֶאֱנַשׁ יָת קָרִיבֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: He said to them, “This is what Adonoy, God of Yisrael has said, ‘Let each man put his sword on his hip and pass through from gate to gate in the camp. Let each man kill [even] his brother, each man his friend, each man his relative.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבָדוּ בְנֵי לֵוִי כְּפִתְגָמָא דְמשֶׁה וּנְפַל מִן עַמָא בְּיוֹמָא הַהוּא כִּתְלָתָא אַלְפִין גַבְרָא:
verses.ar_en: The sons of Leivi did as Moshe said. On that day those that fell from among the people, numbered approximately three thousand men.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר משֶׁה קָרִיבוּ יֶדְכוֹן קֻרְבָּנָא יוֹמָא דֵין קֳדָם יְיָ אֲרֵי גְבַר בִּבְרֵהּ וּבְאָחוּהִי וּלְאַיְתָאָה עֲלֵיכוֹן יוֹמָא דֵין בִּרְכָן:
verses.ar_en: Moshe said, “Consecrate yourselves [Your hands have offered a sacrifice] today to [before] Adonoy—for each man killed [even] his son and brothers—that He may bestow a blessing upon you today.”

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה בְּיוֹמָא דְבַתְרוֹהִי וַאֲמַר משֶׁה לְעַמָא אַתּוּן חַבְתּוּן חוֹבָא רַבָּא וּכְעַן אֶסַק קֳדָם יְיָ מָאִים אֵכַפֵּר עַל חוֹבֵיכוֹן:
verses.ar_en: The next day Moshe said to the people, “You have committed a great sin. Now I will go up to [before] Adonoy, perhaps I will gain atonement for your sin.”

verses.ar_he: וְתַב משֶׁה לִקֳדָם יְיָ וַאֲמָר בְּבָעוּ חַב עַמָא הָדֵין חוֹבָא רַבָּא וַעֲבָדוּ לְהוֹן דַחֲלָן דִדְהָב:
verses.ar_en: Moshe returned to [before] Adonoy and said, “I beseech You! This people have committed a great sin and have made a god of gold.

verses.ar_he: וּכְעַן אִם שַׁבְקַת לְחוֹבֵיהוֹן וְאִם לָא מְחֵנִי כְעַן מִסִפְרָךְ דִי כְתַבְתָּא:
verses.ar_en: Now if You would bear [forgive] their sin, and if not, blot me out from Your book that You have written.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה מָן דִי חַב קֳדָמַי אֶמְחִנֵהּ מִסִפְרִי:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe, “Those who have sinned against [before] Me, I will blot out from My book.

verses.ar_he: וּכְעַן אִיזֵל דַבַּר יָת עַמָא לַאֲתַר דִי מַלֵלִית לָךְ הָא מַלְאָכִי יְהַךְ קֳדָמָךְ וּבְיוֹם אַסַעֲרוּתִי וְאַסְעַר עֲלֵיהוֹן חוֹבֵיהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: And now, go, lead the people to [the place] of which I have spoken to you. Behold, My angel will go before you. However on the day when I take account of them, I will take their sin into account.

verses.ar_he: וּמְחָא יְיָ יָת עַמָא עַל דִי אִשְׁתַּעְבָּדוּ לְעֶגְלָא דִי עֲבַד אַהֲרֹן:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy then struck the people with a plague because they had made [worshiped] the calf that Aharon made.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם משֶׁה אִיזֵל סַק מִכָּא אַתְּ וְעַמָא דְאַסֶקְתָּא מֵאַרְעָא דְמִצְרַיִם לְאַרְעָא דִי קַיֵמִית לְאַבְרָהָם לְיִצְחָק וּלְיַעֲקֹב לְמֵימַר לִבְנָיךְ אֶתְּנִנַהּ:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe, “Leave, go up from this [place]—you and the people you brought up from the land of Egypt—to the land of which I swore to Avraham, to Yitzchok and to Yaakov, saying, ‘To your descendants I will give it.’

verses.ar_he: וְאֶשְׁלַח קֳדָמָךְ מַלְאָכָא וְאֵתָרֵךְ יָת כְּנַעֲנָאֵי אֱמוֹרָאֵי וְחִתָּאֵי וּפְרִזָאֵי חִוָאֵי וִיבוּסָאֵי:
verses.ar_en: I will send an angel before you, and I will drive out the Canaanites, the Emorites, the Chitites, the Perizites, the Chivites, and the Yevusites.

verses.ar_he: לְאַרְעָא עַבְדָא חֲלָב וּדְבָשׁ אֲרֵי לָא אֲסַלֵק שְׁכִנְתִּי מִבֵּינָךְ אֲרֵי עַם קְשֵׁי קְדַל אַתְּ דִילְמָא אֲשֵׁצִינָךְ בְּאָרְחָא:
verses.ar_en: [You will then] enter a land flowing with [producing] milk and honey. [I am sending an angel] for I [My Shechina] will not go up among you, for you are a stiff-necked people and I may destroy you along the way.”

verses.ar_he: וּשְׁמַע עַמָא יָת פִּתְגָמָא בִישָׁא הָדֵין וְאִתְאַבָּלוּ וְלָא שַׁוִיוּ גְבַר תִּקוּן זֵינֵהּ עֲלוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: When the people heard this bad news they mourned and no man wore his ornaments [crowns].

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה אֵימַר לִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אַתּוּן עַם קְשֵׁי קְדַל שָׁעָה חֲדָא אֲסַלֵק שְׁכִנְתִּי מִבֵּינָךְ וְאֵשֵׁיצִינָךְ וּכְעַן אַעְדִי תִּקוּן זֵינָךְ מִנָךְ וּגְלֵי קֳדָמַי מָה אַעְבֵּד לָךְ:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe, “Say to the B’nei Yisrael, ‘You are a stiff-necked people. Were I [My Shechina] to go up among you for one moment, I would destroy you. Now remove your ornaments and I know [it will be revealed before Me] what to do with you.’”

verses.ar_he: וְאַעְדִיאוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל יָת תִּקוּן זֵינֵיהוֹן מִטוּרָא דְחוֹרֵב:
verses.ar_en: The B’nei Yisrael took off their ornaments that they had [worn] at Mount Chorev.

verses.ar_he: וּמשֶׁה נְסִיב יָת מַשְׁכְּנָא וּפַרְסֵהּ לֵהּ מִבָּרָא לְמַשְׁרִיתָא אַרְחֵיק מִן מַשְׁרִיתָא וְקָרֵי לֵהּ מַשְׁכַּן בֵּית אוּלְפָנָא וִיהֵי כָּל דְתָבַע אוּלְפַן מִן קֳדָם יְיָ נְפַק לְמַשְׁכַּן בֵּית אוּלְפָנָא דִי מִבָּרָא לְמַשְׁרִיתָא:
verses.ar_en: Moshe would take the tent and set it up outside the camp, a distance from the camp, and he called it [the] Tent of Meeting [the house of Instruction]. Everyone who sought [instruction from before] Adonoy, would go out to the Tent of Meeting [the house of Instruction] that was outside the camp.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה כַּד נְפַק משֶׁה לְמַשְׁכְּנָא קַיְמִין כָּל עַמָא וּמִתְעַתְּדִין גְבַר בִּתְרַע מַשְׁכְּנֵהּ וּמִסְתַּכְּלִין אֲחוֹרֵי משֶׁה עַד דְעָלֵל לְמַשְׁכְּנָא:
verses.ar_en: Whenever Moshe went out to the tent, all the people would rise, and each person would stand at the entrance of his tent; and they would gaze after Moshe, until he had gone into the tent.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה כַּד עָלֵל משֶׁה לְמַשְׁכְּנָא נָחִית עַמוּדָא דַעֲנָנָא וְקָאִים בִּתְרַע מַשְׁכְּנָא וּמִתְמַלֵל עִם משֶׁה:
verses.ar_en: When Moshe had gone into the tent, the Pillar of Cloud would descend and stand at the entrance of the tent, and [Adonoy] would speak to [Himself with] Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזָן כָּל עַמָא יָת עַמוּדָא דַעֲנָנָא קָאֵם בִּתְרַע מַשְׁכְּנָא וְקַיְמִין כָּל עַמָא וְסָגְדִין גְבַר בִּתְרַע מַשְׁכְּנֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: When all the people saw the Pillar of Cloud, standing at the entrance of the tent; all the people rose and prostrated themselves, each man at the entrance of his tent.

verses.ar_he: וּמִתְמַלֵל יְיָ עִם משֶׁה מַמְלַל עִם מַמְלַל כְּמָא דִמְמַלֵל גְבַר עִם חַבְרֵהּ וְתָב לְמַשְׁרִיתָא וּמְשׁוּמְשָׁנֵהּ יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בַּר נוּן עוּלֵימָא לָא עֲדֵי מִגוֹ מַשְׁכְּנָא:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to [Himself with] Moshe face to face [word to word], just as a man speaks to his friend. and [Moshe then] would return to the camp, but his youthful attendant, Yehoshua, son of Nun, did not leave the tent.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר משֶׁה קֳדָם יְיָ חֲזֵי דְאַתְּ אָמַר לִי אַסֵיק יָת עַמָא הָדֵין וְאַתְּ לֹא הוֹדַעְתַּנִי יָת דִי תִשְׁלַח עִמִי וְאַתְּ אָמַרְתְּ רַבִּיתָךְ בְּשׁוּם וְאַף אַשְׁכַּחְתָּא רַחֲמִין קֳדָמָי:
verses.ar_en: Moshe said to [before] Adonoy, “Behold, You say to me, ‘Lead this people up [to the land of Canaan],’ but You did not let me know whom You would send with me. You [also] said, ‘I know [exalted] you by name and you have also found favor in My eyes [before Me].’

verses.ar_he: וּכְעַן אִם כְּעַן אַשְׁכָּחִית רַחֲמִין קֳדָמָךְ הוֹדַעְנִי כְעַן יָת אוֹרַח טּוּבָךְ וְאִדַע רַחֲמָךְ בְּדִיל דְאַשְׁכַּח רַחֲמִין קֳדָמָךְ וּגְלֵי קֳדָמָךְ אֲרֵי עַמָךְ עַמָא הָדֵין:
verses.ar_en: Now, please, if I have [now] found favor in Your eyes [before You], please [now] let me know Your [the way of Your goodness] way, so that I will know You [Your love], that I may find favor in Your eyes [before You]; and [also] consider [it will be revealed before You] that this nation is [indeed] Your people.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר שְׁכִנְתִּי תְהַךְ וְאָנִיחַ לָךְ:
verses.ar_en: He [God] said, “My Presence [Shechina] will go [with you] and I will accede to you[r request].”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר קֳדָמוֹהִי אִם לֵית שְׁכִנְתָּךְ מֵהַלְכָא בֵינָנָא לָא תַסְקִינָנָא מִכָּא:
verses.ar_en: And he [Moshe] said to [before] Him, “If Your Presence [Shechina] does not go [with us] do not make us leave from this [place].

verses.ar_he: וּבַמֶה יִתְיַדַע הָכָא אֲרֵי אַשְׁכָּחִית רַחֲמִין קֳדָמָךְ אֲנָא וְעַמָךְ הֲלָא בְּמֵהַךְ שְׁכִנְתָּךְ עִמָנָא וְיִתְעַבְּדַן לָנָא פְרִישָׁן לִי וּלְעַמָךְ מְשַׁנֵי מִכָּל עַמָא דִי עַל אַפֵּי אַרְעָא:
verses.ar_en: And how will it be known [here]. that I have found favor in Your eyes [before You]—I and Your people—only if You [Your Shechina] go with us, so that we will be distinguished [wonders will be done for us]—I and Your people—[that they will be distinct] from every [other] people on the face of the earth.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה אַף יָת פִּתְגָמָא הָדֵין דִי מַלֶלְתָּא אֶעְבֵּד אֲרֵי אַשְׁכַּחְתָּ רַחֲמִין קֳדָמַי וְרַבִּיתָךְ בְּשׁוּם:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe, “I will also do this thing that you have spoken, for you have found favor in My eyes [before Me], and I know [exalted] you by name.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר אַחֲזֵינִי כְעַן יָת יְקָרָךְ:
verses.ar_en: He [Moshe] then said, “Please [Now] grant me a vision of Your Glory.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר אֲנָא אַעְבַּר כָּל טוּבִי עַל אַפָּיךְ וְאֶקְרֵי בִשְׁמָא דַיְיָ קֳדָמָךְ וְאֵחוֹן לְמָן דְאֵחוֹן וְאֵרַחֵם עַל מָן דְאֵרַחֵם:
verses.ar_en: He [God] said, “I will cause all My goodness to pass before your presence, and will proclaim the Name, Adonoy, in your presence. I will be gracious to whom I will be gracious, and I will be compassionate to whom I will be compassionate.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר לָא תִיכוּל לְמֶחֱזֵי יָת אַפֵּי שְׁכִנְתִּי אֲרֵי לָא יֶחֱזִינַנִי אֶנָשָׁא וְיִתְקַיָם:
verses.ar_en: And He said, “You cannot see [the] My Presence [of the Shechina], for no man can see My Presence and live.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ הָא אָתַר מַתְקַן קֳדָמָי וְתִתְעַתַּד עַל טִנָרָא:
verses.ar_en: And Adonoy said, “Behold there is a place with [prepared before] Me, and you shall set yourself on the rock.

verses.ar_he: וִיהֵי בְּמֵעֲבַר יְקָרִי וְאֵשַׁוִינָךְ בִּמְעָרַת טִנָרָא וְאָגֵין בְּמֵימְרִי עֲלָךְ עַד דְאֶעֱבַר:
verses.ar_en: When My Glory passes by, I will put you in a cleft [cave] of the rock, and I will cover [shelter] you with My Hand [Word] until I pass by.

verses.ar_he: וְאַעְדֵי יָת דִבְרַת יְקָרִי וְתֶחֱזֵי יָת דְבַתְרָי וְדִקֳדָמַי לָא יִתְחֲזוּן:
verses.ar_en: Then I will remove [the guidance of] My Hand [Glory], and you will see My Back [that which is behind Me], but My Face [that which is before Me] shall not be seen.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה פְּסָל לָךְ תְּרֵין לוּחֵי אַבְנַיָא כְּקַדְמָאֵי וְאֶכְתּוֹב עַל לוּחַיָא יָת פִּתְגָמַיָא דִי הֲווֹ עַל לוּחַיָא קַדְמָאֵי דִי תְבַרְתָּא:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe, “Carve out two stone tablets for yourself just like the first ones. And I will write upon these tablets the words which were on the first Tablets that you broke.

verses.ar_he: וֶהֱוֵי זַמִין לְצַפְרָא וְתִסַק בְּצַפְרָא לְטוּרָא דְסִינַי וְתִתְעַתַּד קֳדָמַי תַּמָן עַל רֵישׁ טוּרָא:
verses.ar_en: Be ready for the morning, and in the morning go up to Mount Sinai and stand there before Me on the top of the mountain.

verses.ar_he: וֶאֱנַשׁ לָא יִסַק עִמָךְ וְאַף אֱנַשׁ לָא יִתְחֲזֵי בְּכָל טוּרָא אַף עֲנָא וְתוֹרֵי לָא יִרְעוּן לָקֳבֵל טוּרָא הַהוּא:
verses.ar_en: No man shall go up with you, nor shall any man be seen on the entire mountain; even the sheep and cattle shall not graze before that mountain.”

verses.ar_he: וּפְסַל תְּרֵין לוּחֵי אַבְנַיָא כְּקַדְמָאֵי וְאַקְדֵם משֶׁה בְּצַפְרָא וּסְלֵיק לְטוּרָא דְסִינַי כְּמָא דְפַקֵד יְיָ יָתֵהּ וּנְסֵב בִּידֵהּ תְּרֵין לוּחֵי אַבְנַיָא:
verses.ar_en: He [Moshe] carved out two stone tablets just like the first ones. Moshe rose early in the morning, and went up to Mount Sinai, as Adonoy had commanded him; and he took the two stone tablets in his hand.

verses.ar_he: וְאִתְגְלִי יְיָ בַּעֲנָנָא וְאִתְעַתַּד עִמֵהּ תַּמָן וּקְרָא בִשְׁמָא דַיְיָ:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy descended [became revealed] in a cloud and it stood with him there; and he [Moshe] called out [invoked] the Name, Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְאַעְבַּר יְיָ שְׁכִנְתֵּהּ עַל אַפּוֹהִי וּקְרָא יְיָ יְיָ אֱלָהָא רַחֲמָנָא וְחַנָנָא מַרְחִיק רְגַז וּמַסְגֵי לְמֶעְבַּד טַבְוָן וּקְשׁוֹט:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy [made his Shechina pass] passed before him, and proclaimed: “Adonoy, Adonoy, Almighty, merciful and gracious, slow to [distancing] anger, and [making] abounding in kindness [goodness] and truth [abound].

verses.ar_he: נָטַר טִיבוּ לְאַלְפֵי דָרִין שָׁבֵק לַעֲוָיָן וְלִמְרוֹד וּלְחוֹבִין סָלַח לִדְתַיְבִין לְאוֹרַיְתֵהּ וְלִדְלָא תַיְבִין לָא מְזַכֵּי מַסְעַר חוֹבֵי אֲבָהָן עַל בְּנִין וְעַל בְּנֵי בְנִין מְרָדִין עַל דַר תְּלִיתָי וְעַל דַר רְבִיעָי:
verses.ar_en: He preserves kindness for thousands [of generations], bearing [forgiving] iniquity, transgression [rebellion] and sin. He clears [acquits the penitent] [forgives those who return to his Torah] and he does not clear [acquit the impenitent], visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children, and [rebellious] children’s children, [even] upon the third and fourth [generation].”

verses.ar_he: וְאוֹחִי משֶׁה וּכְרַע עַל אַרְעָא וּסְגִיד:
verses.ar_en: Moshe hastened, bowed to the ground, and prostrated himself,

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר אִם כְּעַן אַשְׁכָּחִית רַחֲמִין קֳדָמָךְ יְיָ תְּהַךְ כְּעַן שְׁכִנְתָּא דַיְיָ בֵּינָנָא אֲרֵי עַם קְשֵׁי קְדַל הוּא וְתִשְׁבּוֹק לְחוֹבָנָא וְלַחֲטָאָנָא וְתַחְסְנָנָא:
verses.ar_en: and said, “If I have found favor in Your eyes [before You] my Master, let [the Shechina of] my Master go among us; although it is a stiff-necked people, pardon our iniquity and our sins, and take us as Your own possession.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר הָא אֲנָא גְזַר קְיַם קֳדָם כָּל עַמָךְ אֶעְבֵּד פְּרִישָׁן דִי לָא אִתְבְּרִיאוּ בְּכָל אַרְעָא וּבְכָל עַמְמַיָא וְיֶחֱזֵי כָל עַמָא דִי אַתְּ בֵּינֵיהוֹן יָת עוֹבָדָא דַיְיָ אֲרֵי דָחֵל הוּא דִי אֲנָא עָבֵד עִמָךְ:
verses.ar_en: And He said, “I hereby make a covenant; before all your people I will perform wonders such as have not been created in all the earth or for any nation; and all the people in whose midst you are, will see how awesome is the deed of Adonoy which I will perform for you.

verses.ar_he: טָר לָךְ יָת דִי אֲנָא מְפַקְדָךְ יוֹמָא דֵין הָא אֲנָא מְתָרֵךְ מִן קֳדָמָךְ יָת אֱמוֹרָאֵי וּכְנַעֲנָאֵי וְחִתָּאֵי וּפְרִזָאֵי וְחִוָאֵי וִיבוּסָאֵי:
verses.ar_en: Preserve for your own sake that which I command you today. I am driving out [from] before you the Emorites, the Canaanites, the Chitites, the Perizites, the Chivities, and the Yevusites.

verses.ar_he: אִסְתַּמַר לָךְ דִילְמָא תִגְזַר קְיַם לְיָתֵב אַרְעָא דִי אַתְּ עָלֵל עֲלַהּ דִילְמָא יְהֵי לְתַקְלָא בֵּינָךְ:
verses.ar_en: For your own sake, be careful not to make a covenant with the people who live in the land to which you are coming, lest it be a trap in your midst.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי יָת אֲגוֹרֵיהוֹן תְּתַרְעוּן וְיָת קָמַתְהוֹן תְּתַבְּרוּן וְיָת אַשְׁרֵיהוֹן תְּקַצְצוּן:
verses.ar_en: Rather you must shatter their altars, break down their monuments, and cut down their asherah-trees.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי לָא תִסְגוֹד לְטַעֲוַת עַמְמַיָא אֲרֵי יְיָ קַנָא שְׁמֵהּ אֵל קַנָא הוּא:
verses.ar_en: For you must not prostrate yourselves to another god [false gods of the peoples], because Adonoy—Jealous is His Name—He is a Jealous Almighty [God].

verses.ar_he: דִילְמָא תִגְזַר קְיַם לְיָתֵב אַרְעָא וְיִטְּעוּן בָּתַר טַּעֲוַתְהוֹן וְיִדְבְּחוּן לְטַּעֲוַתְהוֹן וְיִקְרוּן לָךְ וְתֵיכוּל מִדִבְחֵיהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: [Take care] not to make a covenant with the people who live in the land, and go astray after their [false] gods [religions], and sacrifice to their [false] gods, [for he] will then call you and you will eat of his sacrifice.

verses.ar_he: וְתִסַב מִבְּנַתְהוֹן לִבְנָיךְ וְיִטְעַיָן בְּנַתְהוֹן בָּתַר טַעֲוַתְהוֹן וְיִטְעַיַן יָת בְּנָיךְ בָּתַר טַעֲוַתְהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: You will [then] accept his daughters [as wives] for your sons. His daughters will stray after their [false] gods, and they will lead your sons to stray after their [false] gods.

verses.ar_he: דַחֲלַן דְמַתְּכָא לָא תַעְבֵּד לָךְ:
verses.ar_en: You must not make molten gods for yourselves.

verses.ar_he: יָת חַגָא דְפַטִּירַיָא תִּטַר שַׁבְעָא יוֹמִין תֵּיכוֹל פַּטִירָא כְּמָא דִי פַקֵדִתָּךְ לִזְמַן יַרְחָא דְאַבִּיבָא אֲרֵי בְּיַרְחָא דְאַבִּיבָא נְפַקְתָּא מִמִצְרָיִם:
verses.ar_en: Preserve the Festival of Matzos. Eat matzos for seven days as I commanded you, at the appointed time in the month of ripening [grain]; for in the month of ripening [grain] you went out of Egypt.

verses.ar_he: כָּל פָּתַח וַלְדָא דִילִי וְכָל בְּעִירָךְ דִכְרִין תַּקְדֵשׁ בְּכוֹר תּוֹר וְאִימָר:
verses.ar_en: All that opens the womb [the first-born] is Mine, and of all your livestock that is male [you shall sanctify], that open [the womb] [the first-born] both cattle and sheep.

verses.ar_he: וּבוּכְרָא דַחֲמָרָא תִּפְרוֹק בְּאִימְרָא וְאִם לָא תִפְרוֹק וְתַנְקְפֵהּ כָּל בּוּכְרָא דִבְנָיךְ תִּפְרוֹק וְלָא יִתְחֲזוּן קֳדָמַי רֵיקָנִין:
verses.ar_en: The [first-born] donkey that opens the womb shall be redeemed with a sheep, and if it is not redeemed, you must break its neck. [You must] redeem all first-born of your sons, and you must not appear before Me empty-handed.

verses.ar_he: שִׁתָּא יוֹמִין תִּפְלָח וּבְיוֹמָא שְׁבִיעָאָה תְּנוּחַ בִּזְרוֹעָא וּבַחֲצָדָא תְּנוּחַ:
verses.ar_en: Six days you shall work but on the Seventh day you must cease; you must cease plowing [sowing] and harvesting.

verses.ar_he: וְחַגָא דְשָׁבוּעַיָא תַּעְבֵּד לָךְ בִּכּוּרֵי חֲצַד חִטִין וְחַגָא דִכְנָשָׁא בְּמִפְקָא דְשַׁתָּא:
verses.ar_en: Make the Festival of Shavuos, [with bringing] the first crops of the wheat harvest; [also] the Festival of the Harvest at the turn of the year.

verses.ar_he: תְּלַת זִמְנִין בְּשַׁתָּא יִתְחֲזוּן כָּל דְכוּרָךְ קֳדָם רִבּוֹן עָלְמָא יְיָ אֱלָהָא דְיִשְׂרָאֵל:
verses.ar_en: Three times a year all your males shall appear before the Presence of the Master [of the world], Adonoy, God of Yisrael.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי אֲתָרֵךְ עַמְמִין מִן קֳדָמָךְ וְאַפְתֵּי יָת תְּחוּמָךְ וְלָא יַחְמֵד אֱנַשׁ יָת אַרְעָךְ בְּמִסְקָךְ לְאִתְחַזָאָה קֳדָם יְיָ אֱלָהָךְ תְּלַת זִמְנִין בְּשַׁתָּא:
verses.ar_en: For I will drive out the nations before you, and I will expand your boundaries; and no man will covet your land when you go up to appear before Adonoy, your God, three times a year.

verses.ar_he: לָא תִכּוֹס עַל חֲמִיעַ דַם פִּסְחִי וְלָא יְבִיתוּן לְצַפְרָא בַּר מִמַדְבְּחָא תַּרְבֵּי נִכְסַת חַגָא דְפִסְחָא:
verses.ar_en: Do not slaughter [the Pesach-offering to offer] the blood of My sacrifice [Pesach-offering] while there is chometz; and do not allow to remain overnight until morning [off the Altar] any [fats] of the offering of the Pesach Festival.

verses.ar_he: רֵישׁ בִּכּוּרֵי אַרְעָךְ תַּיְתֵי לְבֵית מַקְדְשָׁא דַיְיָ אֱלָהָךְ לָא תֵיכְלוּן בְּשַׂר בַּחֲלָב:
verses.ar_en: The first fruits of your land, you shall bring to the House [of the Sanctuary] of Adonoy, your God. You must not cook a kid in its mother’s milk [eat meat with milk].

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר יְיָ לְמשֶׁה כְּתַב לָךְ יָת פִּתְגָמַיָא הָאִלֵין אֲרֵי עַל מֵימַר פִּתְגָמַיָא הָאִלֵין גְזָרִית עִמָךְ קְיַם וְעִם יִשְׂרָאֵל:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy said to Moshe, “Write these words down for yourself, for with [regarding the expression of] these words I have made a covenant with you and with [the B’nei] Yisrael.”

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה תַמָן קֳדָם יְיָ אַרְבְּעִין יְמָמִין וְאַרְבְּעִין לֵילָוָן לַחְמָא לָא אֲכַל וּמַיָא לָא שְׁתֵי וּכְתַב עַל לוּחַיָא יָת פִּתְגָמֵי קְיָמָא עַשְׂרָא פִּתְגָמִין:
verses.ar_en: He [Moshe] remained there with [before] Adonoy for forty days and forty nights. He did not eat bread nor drink water, and He wrote on the tablets the words of the covenant, the Ten Words [commandments.]

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה כַּד נְחַת משֶׁה מִטוּרָא דְסִינַי וּתְרֵין לוּחֵי סַהֲדוּתָא בִּידָא דְמשֶׁה בְּמֵחֲתֵהּ מִן טוּרָא וּמשֶׁה לָא יְדַע אֲרֵי סְגֵי זִיו יְקָרָא דְאַפּוֹהִי בְּמַלָלוּתֵהּ עִמֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: And when Moshe came down from Mount Sinai, and the two Tablets of the Testimony were in Moshe’s hand when he came down from the Mountain. Moshe did not know that the skin [splendor of the glory] of his face had become radiant [increased] when He [God] spoke to him.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזָא אַהֲרֹן וְכָל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל יָת משֶׁה וְהָא סְגֵי זִיו יְקָרָא דְאַפּוֹהִי וּדְחִילוּ מִלְאִתְקְרְבָא לְוָתֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: When Aharon and all the B’nei Yisrael saw Moshe, and beheld that the skin [splendor of the glory] of his face had become radiant [increased], they were afraid to come close to him.

verses.ar_he: וּקְרָא לְהוֹן משֶׁה וְתָבוּ לְוָתֵהּ אַהֲרֹן וְכָל רַבְרְבַיָא בִּכְנִשְׁתָּא וּמַלֵל משֶׁה עִמְהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Moshe called to them and they returned to him—Aharon and all the leaders of the congregation—and Moshe spoke to them.

verses.ar_he: וּבָתַר כֵּן אִתְקְרִיבוּ כָּל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וּפַקֵדִנוּן יָת כָּל דִי מַלֵל יְיָ עִמֵהּ בְּטוּרָא דְסִינָי:
verses.ar_en: After that, all the B’nei Yisrael came close [to him] and he commanded them [regarding] all that Adonoy had spoken with him on Mount Sinai.

verses.ar_he: וְשֵׁיצֵי משֶׁה מִלְמַלָלָא עִמְהוֹן וִיהַב עַל אַפּוֹהִי בֵּית אַפֵּי:
verses.ar_en: When Moshe finished speaking with them, he placed a [face] cover[ing] over his face.

verses.ar_he: וְכַד עָלֵל משֶׁה לִקֳדָם יְיָ לְמַלָלָא עִמֵה אַעְדִי יָת בֵּית אַפּוֹהִי עַד מִפְקֵהּ וְנָפֵק וּמְמַלֵל עִם בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל יָת דִי מִתְפַּקָד:
verses.ar_en: [But] when Moshe came before Adonoy, to speak to Him; he removed the [face] cover[ing] until he was ready to leave. and he would then go out and speak to the B’nei Yisrael, [telling them] what he had been commanded.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזָן בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל יָת אַפֵּי משֶׁה אֲרֵי סְגֵי זִיו יְקָרָא דְאַפֵי משֶׁה וַאֲתֵב משֶׁה יָת בֵּית אַפֵּי עַל אַפּוֹהִי עַד דְעָלֵל לְמַלָלָא עִמֵהּ: ססס:
verses.ar_en: The B’nei Yisrael saw Moshe’s face, that the skin [splendor of the glory] of Moshe’s face had become radiant [increased], and Moshe replaced the [face] cover[ing] over his face until he would come in to speak to Him [Adonoy].

verses.ar_he: וְאַכְנֵשׁ משֶׁה יָת כָּל כְּנִשְׁתָּא דִבְנֵי יִשְרָאֵל וַאֲמַר לְהוֹן אִלֵין פִּתְגָמַיָא דִי פַקֵד יְיָ לְמֶעְבַּד יָתְהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Moshe assembled the entire congregation of the B’nei Yisrael, and said to them, “These are the words that Adonoy has commanded you to do.

verses.ar_he: שִׁתָּא יוֹמִין תִּתְעֲבֵד עִבִדְתָּא וּבְיוֹמָא שְׁבִיעָאָה יְהֵי לְכוֹן קוּדְשָׁא שַׁבָּא שַׁבְּתָא קֳדָם יְיָ כָּל דְיַעֲבֵד בֵּה עִבִדְתָּא יִתְקְטֵל:
verses.ar_en: Work may be done six days, but the seventh day must be holy to you, it is a Shabbos of Shabbos to [before] Adonoy. Whoever does work on it shall be put to death.

verses.ar_he: לָא תְבַעֲרוּן אֶשָׁתָא בְּכֹל מוֹתְבָנֵיכוֹן בְּיוֹמָא דְשַׁבְּתָא:
verses.ar_en: You must not kindle a fire in all your dwelling places on the day of Shabbos.”

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר משֶׁה לְכָל כְּנִשְׁתָּא דִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְמֵימָר דֵין פִּתְגָּמָא דִי פַקֵד יְיָ לְמֵימָר:
verses.ar_en: Moshe said to the entire congregation of the B’nei Yisrael, saying, “This is the word that Adonoy has commanded:

verses.ar_he: סָבוּ מִנְכוֹן אַפְרָשׁוּתָא קֳדָם יְיָ כֹּל דְיִתְרְעֵי לִבֵּהּ יַיְתֵי יָת אַפְרָשׁוּתָא קֳדָם יְיָ דַהֲבָא וְכַסְפָא וּנְחָשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: Take [collect] from among yourselves a terumah-offering to [before] Adonoy. Every man who is generous of heart shall bring a terumah-offering to [before] Adonoy: gold, silver and copper,

verses.ar_he: וְתִכְלָא וְאַרְגְוָנָא וּצְבַע זְהוֹרִי וּבוּץ וּמֵעַזֵי:
verses.ar_en: And greenish-blue wool, dark red wool, crimson [colored] wool, fine linen, and goat’s hair,

verses.ar_he: וּמַשְׁכֵי דְדִכְרֵי מְסַמְקֵי וּמַשְׁכֵי דְסַסְגוֹנָא וְאָעֵי שִׁטִין:
verses.ar_en: and red-[dyed] rams’ skins, tachash [multicolored] skins, and accacia wood,

verses.ar_he: וּמִשְׁחָא לְאַנְהָרוּתָא וּבוּסְמַיָא לִמְשַׁח רְבוּתָא וְלִקְטֹרֶת בּוּסְמַיָא:
verses.ar_en: and oil for the light, spices for annointing oil, and for the incense of aromatic spices,

verses.ar_he: וְאַבְנֵי בוּרְלָא וְאַבְנֵי אַשְׁלָמוּתָא לְשַׁקָעָא בְּאֵפוֹדָא וּבְחוּשְׁנָא:
verses.ar_en: and onyx stones, and stones for setting into the ephod and the breastplate.

verses.ar_he: וְכָל חַכִּימֵי לִבָּא בְּכוֹן יֵיתוּן וְיַעְבְדוּן יָת כָּל דִי פַקֵד יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: All those who are wise in heart among you shall come and make all that Adonoy has commanded.

verses.ar_he: יָת מַשְׁכְּנָא יָת פְּרָסֵהּ וְיָת חוֹפָאֵהּ יָת פּוּרְפוֹהִי וְיָת דַפּוֹהִי יָת עַבְרוֹהִי יָת עַמוּדוֹהִי וְיָת סַמְכוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: The mishkon, its tent and its cover, its clasps, and its planks, its bars, its pillars and its sockets.

verses.ar_he: יָת אֲרוֹנָא וְיָת אֲרִיחוֹהִי יָת כַּפֻּרְתָּא וְיָת פָּרֻכְתָּא דִפְרָסָא:
verses.ar_en: The ark and its poles, its cover and the partition screen.

verses.ar_he: יָת פָּתוֹרָא וְיָת אֲרִיחוֹהִי וְיָת כָּל מָנוֹהִי וְיָת לְחֵם אַפַּיָא:
verses.ar_en: The table and its poles, and all its vessels, and the show breads.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת מְנַרְתָּא דְאַנְהוֹרֵי וְיָת מָנָהָא וְיָת בּוֹצִינָהָא וְיָת מִשְׁחָא דְאַנְהָרוּתָא:
verses.ar_en: The menorah for light, and its vessels, and its lamps and the oil for the light.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת מַדְבְּחָא דִקְטוֹרֶת בּוּסְמַיָא וְיָת אֲרִיחוֹהִי וְיָת מִשְׁחָא דִרְבוּתָא וְיָת קְטֹרֶת בּוּסְמַיָא וְיָת פְּרָסָא דְתַרְעָא לִתְרַע מַשְׁכְּנָא:
verses.ar_en: The incense [spices] altar, and its poles, and the annointing oil, and the incense of aromatic spices, and the screen for the entrance, at the entrance of the mishkon.

verses.ar_he: יָת מַדְבְּחָא דַעֲלָתָא וְיָת סְרָדָא דִנְחָשָׁא דִילֵהּ יָת אָרִיחוֹהִי וְיָת כָּל מָנוֹהִי יָת כִּיוֹרָא וְיָת בְּסִיסֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: The altar for burnt-offerings, with its copper grate, its poles and all its vessels, the laver and its base.

verses.ar_he: יָת סְרָדֵי דַרְתָּא יָת עַמוּדוֹהִי וְיָת סַמְכָהָא וְיָת פְּרָסָא דִתְרַע דַרְתָּא:
verses.ar_en: The curtains for the enclosure, its pillars and its sockets, and the screen for the entrance of the enclosure.

verses.ar_he: יָת סִכֵּי מַשְׁכְּנָא וְיָת סִכֵּי דְדַרְתָּא וְיָת אַטוּנֵיהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: The stakes of the mishkon, and the stakes of the enclosure and their ropes.

verses.ar_he: יָת לְבוּשֵׁי שִׁמוּשָׁא לְשַׁמָשָׁא בְקוּדְשָׁא יָת לְבוּשֵׁי קוּדְשָׁא לְאַהֲרֹן כַּהֲנָא וְיָת לְבוּשֵׁי בְנוֹהִי לְשַׁמָשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: The covering cloths [of service] for the holy articles [to serve in the Sanctuary], and the sacred garments for Aharon the kohein, and the garments for his sons to wear when they serve.

verses.ar_he: וּנְפָקוּ כָּל כְּנִשְׁתָּא דִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מִן קֳדָם משֶׁה:
verses.ar_en: The entire congregation of the B’nei Yisrael departed from the presence of Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתוֹ כָּל גְבַר דְאִתְרְעֵי לִבֵּהּ וְכֹל דִי אַשְׁלֵמַת רוּחֵהּ יָתֵהּ אַיְתִיאוּ יָת אַפְרָשׁוּתָא קֳדָם יְיָ לַעֲבִידַת מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וּלְכָל פֻּלְחָנֵהּ וְלִלְבוּשֵׁי קוּדְשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: Every man whose heart lifted him up came—and every one whose generous spirit inspired [filled] him brought a terumah-offering to [before] Adonoy, for the work of the Tent of Meeting, and for all [that was needed for] its service, and for the sacred garments.

verses.ar_he: וּמַיְתַן גֻבְרַיָא עַל נְשַׁיָא כֹּל דְאִתְרְעֵי לִבֵּהּ אַיְתִיאוּ שֵׁירִין וְשִׁבְכִין וְעִזְקַן וּמָחוּךְ כָּל מָן דִדְהַב וְכָל גְּבַר דִי אֲרֵים אֲרָמוּת דַהֲבָא קֳדָם יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: And they came—both men and [brought—men in addition to] woman—all who were generous of heart brought bracelets, nose rings, finger rings, and buckles—all kinds of golden vessels—and every man that offered a wave-offering of gold unto [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וְכָל גְבַר דְאִשְׁתְּכַח עִמֵהּ תִּכְלָא וְאַרְגְוָנָא וּצְבַע זְהוֹרִי וּבוּץ וּמֵעַזֵי וּמַשְׁכֵי דְדִכְרֵי מְסַמְקֵי וּמַשְׁכֵי סַסְגוֹנָא אַיְתִיאוּ:
verses.ar_en: Every man who had with him greenish-blue wool, dark red wool, crimson [colored] wool, fine linen, goats’ hair, red dyed rams’ skins, and tachash [multicolored] skins brought them.

verses.ar_he: כָּל דַאֲרֵים אֲרָמוּת כְּסַף וּנְחַשׁ אַיְתִיאוּ יָת אַפְרָשׁוּתָא קֳדָם יְיָ וְכֹל דִי אִשְׁתְּכַח עִמֵהּ אָעֵי שִׁטִין לְכָל עִבִידַת פֻּלְחָנָא אַיְתִיאוּ:
verses.ar_en: Everyone who did lift up a terumah-offering of silver or copper, brought the terumah-offering to [before] Adonoy; and everyone who had with him acacia wood for use in the work of the service, brought it.

verses.ar_he: וְכָל אִתְּתָא חַכִּימַת לִבָּא בִּידָהָא מְעַזְלָא וּמַיְתַן כַּד עָזֵל יָת תִּכְלָא וְיָת אַרְגְוָנָא יָת צְבַע זְהוֹרִי וְיָת בּוּצָא:
verses.ar_en: And every wise-hearted woman spun with her hands; and they brought the spun yarn of greenish-blue wool, dark red wool, crimson [colored] wool and fine linen.

verses.ar_he: וְכָל נְשַׁיָא דְאִתְרְעֵי לִבְּהֶן עִמְהֶן בְּחָכְמָא עַזְלַן יָת מֵעַזְיָא:
verses.ar_en: And all the women whose hearts inspired them with wisdom, spun the goat’s hair.

verses.ar_he: וְרַבְרְבַיָא אַיְתִיאוּ יָת אַבְנֵי בוּרְלָא וְיָת אַבְנֵי אַשְׁלָמוּתָא לְשַׁקָעָא בְאֵפוֹדָא וּבְחוּשְׁנָא:
verses.ar_en: And the leaders [of the tribes] brought onyx stones, and stones for setting into the ephod and breastplate.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת בּוּסְמָא וְיָת מִשְׁחָא לְאַנְהָרוּתָא וּלְמִשְׁחָא דִרְבוּתָא וְלִקְטוֹרֶת בּוּסְמַיָא:
verses.ar_en: And the spices, and the oil for the light, and the anointing oil, and the incense of aromatic spices.

verses.ar_he: כָּל גְבַר וְאִתְּתָא דְאִתְרְעֵי לִבְּהוֹן עִמְהוֹן לְאַיְתָאָה לְכָל עִבִדְתָּא דִי פַקֵד יְיָ לְמֶעְבַּד בִּידָא דְמשֶׁה אַיְתִיאוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל נְדַבְתָּא קֳדָם יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: Every man and woman whose generous heart inspired them to bring something for all the work that Adonoy had commanded to be done through Moshe [did so]. The B’nei Yisrael brought a free-will gift to [before] Adonoy.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמַר משֶׁה לִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל חֲזוֹ דְרַבִּי יְיָ בְּשׁוּם בְּצַלְאֵל בַּר אוּרִי בַר חוּר לְשִׁבְטָא דִיהוּדָה:
verses.ar_en: Moshe said to the B’nei Yisrael, “See, Adonoy has designated [exalted] by name, Betzalel, son of Uri, son of Chur, of the tribe of Yehudah.

verses.ar_he: וְאַשְׁלֵם עִמֵהּ רוּחַ נְבוּאָה מִן קֳדָם יְיָ בְּחָכְמְתָא בְּסוּכְלְתָנוּ וּבְמַדַע וּבְכָל עִבִידָא:
verses.ar_en: And He endowed him with Divine [the] spirit [of prophecy from before Adonoy], with wisdom, with understanding, with knowledge and with [the skill to perform] all types of crafting.

verses.ar_he: וּלְאַלָפָא אוּמַנְוָן לְמֶעְבַּד בְּדַהֲבָא וּבְכַסְפָא וּבִנְחָשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: And to devise [plans] [teach craftsmanship] with ingenuity, to execute [those plans] in gold, in silver and in copper.

verses.ar_he: וּבְאוּמָנוּת אֶבֶן טָבָא לְאַשְׁלָמָא וּבְנַגָרוּת אָעָא לְמֶעְבַּד בְּכָל עִבִידַת אוּמַנְוָן:
verses.ar_en: And in masonary [to cut precious stones] for settings, and in carpentry, to execute all kinds of clever tasks [of craftsmanship].

verses.ar_he: וּלְאַלָפָא יְהַב בְּלִבֵּהּ הוּא וְאָהֳלִיאָב בַּר אֲחִיסָמָךְ לְשִׁבְטָא דְדָן:
verses.ar_en: And the ability to instruct he instilled in his heart, he (Betzalel) and Oholiov, the son of Achisomoch of the tribe of Dan.

verses.ar_he: אַשְׁלֵם עִמְהוֹן חַכִּימוּת לִבָּא לְמֶעְבַּד כָּל עִבִידַת נַגָר וְאָמָן וְצַיָר בְּתִכְלָא וּבְאַרְגְוָנָא בִּצְבַע זְהוֹרִי וּבְבוּצָא וּמַחֵי עָבְדֵי כָּל עֲבִידָא וּמַלְפֵי אוּמַנְוָן:
verses.ar_en: He filled them with wisdom of the heart, to execute all the tasks of the engraver [carpenter], the craftsman, and the embroiderer of greenish-blue wool, dark red wool, crimson [colored] wool, fine linen, and the [the tasks of] weaver, [also] that of laborers and planners [those who teach craftsmanship].

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד בְּצַלְאֵל וְאָהֳלִיאָב וְכָל גְבַר חַכִּים לִבָּא דִיהַב יְיָ חָכְמָא וְסוּכְלְתָנוּתָא בְּהוֹן לְמִדַע לְמֶעְבַּד יָת כָּל עִבִידַת פָלְחַן קוּדְשָׁא לְכֹל דִי פַקֵד יְיָ:
verses.ar_en: And they shall execute—Betzalel and Oholiov—and every wise-hearted man whom Adonoy had endowed with wisdom and insight to know (how) to execute in all of the holy work—all that Adonoy had commanded.

verses.ar_he: וּקְרָא משֶׁה לִבְצַלְאֵל וּלְאָהֳלִיאָב וּלְכָל גְּבַר חַכִּים לִבָּא דִיהַב יְיָ חָכְמְתָא בְּלִבֵּה כָּל דְאִתְרְעֵי לִבֵּהּ לְמִקְרַב לְעִבִדְתָּא לְמֶעְבַּד יָתַהּ:
verses.ar_en: Moshe called to Betzalel and to Oholiov, and to every wise-hearted man whom Adonoy had endowed with wisdom in his heart, everyone whose heart moved him to approach the task—to execute it.

verses.ar_he: וּנְסִיבוּ מִן קֳדָם משֶׁה יָת כָּל אַפְרָשׁוּתָא דִי אַיְתִיאוּ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל לְעִבִידַת פָּלְחַן קוּדְשָׁא לְמֶעְבַּד יָתַהּ וְאִנוּן מַיְתַן לֵהּ עוֹד נְדַבְתָּא בִּצְפַר בִּצְפָר:
verses.ar_en: And they took from before Moshe, all the terumah-offering which the B’nei Yisrael brought for the tasks of the holy work, to execute it. And they continued to bring gifts each and every morning.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲתוֹ כָּל חַכִּימַיָא דְעָבְדִין יָת כָּל עִבִידַת קוּדְשָׁא גְבַר גְבַר מֵעִבִדְתֵּהּ דְאִנוּן עָבְדִין:
verses.ar_en: All the wise men came—who were executing all the holy tasks—each and every man from the task in which he was engaged.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲמָרוּ לְמשֶׁה לְמֵימַר מַסְגַן עַמָא לְאַיְתָאָה מִסַת פָּלְחָנָא לְעִבִדְתָּא דְפַקֵד יְיָ לְמֶעְבַּד יָתַהּ:
verses.ar_en: They said the following to Moshe: the people are bringing too much—more than is needed for the tasks which Adonoy has commanded to execute.

verses.ar_he: וּפַקֵד משֶׁה וַאַעֲבַרוּ כְרוֹזָא בְּמַשְׁרִיתָא לְמֵימַר גְבַר וְאִתְּתָא לָא יַעַבְדוּן עוֹד עִבִדְתָּא לְאַפְרָשׁוּת קוּדְשָׁא וּפְסַק עַמָא מִלְאַיְתָאָה:
verses.ar_en: Moshe commanded—and they proclaimed throughout the encampment saying, “Let no man or woman bring any more material for the sacred offering.” And the people stopped bringing.

verses.ar_he: וְעִבִדְתָּא הֲוַת מִסַת לְכָל עִבִדְתָּא לְמֶעְבַּד יָתַהּ וִיתָרָת:
verses.ar_en: The material was enough for all the work that had to be done, and some was left over.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבָדוּ כָל חַכִּימֵי לִבָּא בְּעָבְדֵי עִבִדְתָּא יָת מַשְׁכְּנָא עֲשַׂר יְרִיעָן דְבוּץ שְׁזִיר וְתִכְלָא וְאַרְגְוָנָא וּצְבַע זְהוֹרִי צוּרַת כְּרוּבִין עוֹבַד אֳמָן עֲבַד יָתְהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: All craftsmen with the spirit of wisdom made the mishkon out of ten drapes, (consisting of) twined fine linen, greenish blue wool, dark red wool and crimson [colored] wool, figures of Cherubim, the work of a craftsman.

verses.ar_he: אֻרְכָּא דִירִעֲתָא חֲדָא עַסְרִין וּתְמַנְיָא אַמִין וּפוּתְיָא אַרְבַּע אַמִין דִירִיעֲתָא חֲדָא מְשַׁחְתָּא חֲדָא לְכָל יְרִיעָתָא:
verses.ar_en: The length of each drape was twenty eight amohs, and each drape was four amohs wide. All drapes had the same measure.

verses.ar_he: וְלָפֵף יָת חָמֵשׁ יְרִיעָן חֲדָא עִם חֲדָא וְחָמֵשׁ יְרִיעָן לָפֵף חֲדָא עִם חֲדָא:
verses.ar_en: He joined (sewed) five of these drapes together, and the other five drapes he joined (sewed) together.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד עֲנוּבִין דְתִכְלָא עַל סִפְתָא דִירִעֲתָא חֲדָא מִסִטְרָא בֵּית לוֹפֵי כֵּן עֲבַד בְּסִפְתָא דִירִיעֲתָא בְּסִטְרָא בֵּית לוֹפֵי תִּנְיֵתָא:
verses.ar_en: He made loops of greenish blue wool on the edge of the drape which was at the (innermost) end of the (first) group. He did the same on the edge of the drape which was the innermost end of the second group.

verses.ar_he: חַמְשִׁין עֲנוּבִין עֲבַד בִּירִיעֲתָא חֲדָא וְחַמְשִׁין עֲנוּבִין עֲבַד בְּסִטְרָא דִירִיעֲתָא דְבֵית לוֹפֵי תִּנְיֵתָא מְכַוְנָן עֲנוּבַיָא חֲדָא לָקֳבֵל חֲדָא:
verses.ar_en: He made fifty loops on (the edge of) one drape and he made fifty loops on the edge of the drape which was on the second group. The loops were opposite one another.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד חַמְשִׁין פּוּרְפִין דִדְהַב וְלָפֵף יָת יְרִיעֲתָא חֲדָא עִם חֲדָא בְּפוּרְפַיָא וַהֲוָה מַשְׁכְּנָא חָד:
verses.ar_en: He made fifty golden clasps and he joined the drapes (of each group) together with the clasps. The mishkon was thus one unit.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד יְרִיעָן דִמְעַזֵי לִפְרָסָא עַל מַשְׁכְּנָא חַד עֲשַׂר יְרִיעָן עֲבַד יָתְהֶן:
verses.ar_en: He made drapes of goats’ hair for a covering over the mishkon. He made eleven such drapes.

verses.ar_he: אֻרְכָּא דִירִיעֲתָא חֲדָא תְּלָתִין בְּאַמִין וְאַרְבַּע אַמִין פּוּתְיָא דִירִיעֲתָא חֲדָא מְשַׁחְתָּא חֲדָא לְחַד עֲשַׂר יְרִיעָן:
verses.ar_en: The length of each drape was thirty amohs, and the width of each drape was four amohs. The eleven drapes were of the same measure.

verses.ar_he: וְלָפֵף יָת חָמֵשׁ יְרִיעָן לְחוֹד וְיָת שִׁית יְרִיעָן לְחוֹד:
verses.ar_en: And he joined together five drapes by themselves, and six drapes by themselves.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד עֲנוּבִין חַמְשִׁין עַל סִפְתָא דִירִיעֲתָא בְּסִטְרָא בֵּית לוֹפֵי וְחַמְשִׁין עֲנוּבִין עֲבַד עַל סִפְתָא דִירִיעֲתָא דְבֵית לוֹפֵי תִּנְיֵתָא:
verses.ar_en: He made fifty loops on the edge of one drape which was the innermost end of the (first) group and he made fifty loops on the edge of the drape which was on the second group.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד פּוּרְפִין דִנְחָשָׁא חַמְשִׁין לְלַפָּפָא יָת מַשְׁכְּנָא לְמֶהֱוֵי חָד:
verses.ar_en: He made fifty copper clasps to join the tent together making it one.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד חוֹפָאָה לְמַשְׁכְּנָא מַשְׁכֵי דְדִכְרֵי מְסַמְקֵי וְחוֹפָאָה מַשְׁכֵי דְסַסְגוֹנָא מִלְעֵלָא:
verses.ar_en: He made a covering for the tent out of red dyed rams’ skins, and a covering of tachash [multicolored] skins above that.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד יָת דַפַּיָא לְמַשְׁכְּנָא דְאָעֵי שִׁטִין קָיְמִין:
verses.ar_en: He made planks for the mishkon out of acacia wood; (these planks) stood upright (vertically).

verses.ar_he: עֲשַׂר אַמִין אֻרְכָּא דְדַפָּא וְאַמְתָא וּפַלְגוּת אַמְתָא פּוּתְיָא דְדַפָּא חָד:
verses.ar_en: Each plank was ten amohs long, and one and one half amohs was the width of each plank.

verses.ar_he: תַּרְתֵּין צִירִין לְדַפָּא חַד מְשַׁלְבִין חֲדָא לָקֳבֵל חֲדָא כֵּן עֲבַד לְכֹל דַפֵּי מַשְׁכְּנָא:
verses.ar_en: Each plank had two (square) pegs, exactly parallel to each other. In this manner he made all the planks of the mishkon.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד יָת דַפַּיָא לְמַשְׁכְּנָא עֶסְרִין דַפִּין לְרוּחַ עֵבַר דָרוֹמָא:
verses.ar_en: He made these planks for the mishkon, twenty planks for the southern side.

verses.ar_he: וְאַרְבְּעִין סַמְכִין דִכְסַף עֲבַד תְּחוֹת עֶסְרִין דַפִּין תְּרֵין סַמְכִין תְּחוֹת דַפָּא חַד לִתְרֵין צִירוֹהִי וּתְרֵין סַמְכִין תְּחוֹת דַפָּא חַד לִתְרֵין צִירוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: He made forty silver sockets, (and placed them) under the twenty planks. There were two sockets under one plank (one) for each of the two pegs, and two sockets under the other plank, (one) for each of the two pegs.

verses.ar_he: וְלִסְטַר מַשְׁכְּנָא תִּנְיֵתָא לְרוּחַ צִפּוּנָא עֲבַד עֶסְרִין דַפִּין:
verses.ar_en: For the second wall of the mishkon, to the northern side, he made twenty planks.

verses.ar_he: וְאַרְבְּעִין סַמְכֵיהוֹן דִכְסָף תְּרֵין סַמְכִין תְּחוֹת דַפָּא חַד וּתְרֵין סַמְכִין תְּחוֹת דַפָּא חָד:
verses.ar_en: (He made) their forty silver sockets, two sockets under each plank, two sockets under each plank.

verses.ar_he: וְלִסְיָפֵי מַשְׁכְּנָא מַעַרְבָא עֲבַד שִׁתָּא דַפִין:
verses.ar_en: For the western end of the mishkon he made six planks.

verses.ar_he: וּתְרֵין דַפִין עֲבַד לְזָוְיַת מַשְׁכְּנָא בְּסוֹפֵיהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: He made two planks for the corners of the mishkon at the rear side [their ends].

verses.ar_he: וַהֲווֹ מְכַוְנִין מִלְרַע וְכַחֲדָא הֲווֹ מְכַוְנִין עַל רֵישֵׁהּ לְעִזְקָתָא חֲדָא כֵּן עֲבַד לְתַרְוֵיהוֹן לִתְרֵין זָוְיָן:
verses.ar_en: They were coupled together on the bottom, and they were coupled together evenly on the top with one (square) ring. In this manner he made the two (planks) which were at the two corners.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲווֹ תְּמַנְיָא דַפִּין וְסַמְכֵיהוֹן דִכְסַף שִׁתָּא עֲשַׂר סַמְכִין תְּרֵין סַמְכִין תְּרֵין סַמְכִין תְּחוֹת דַפָּא חָד:
verses.ar_en: There were eight planks, and their silver sockets, totaling sixteen sockets, two sockets, two sockets under each plank.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד עַבְּרֵי דְאָעֵי שִׁטִין חַמְשָׁא לְדַפֵּי סְטַר מַשְׁכְּנָא חָד:
verses.ar_en: He made bars out of acacia wood, five for the planks of one wall,

verses.ar_he: וְחַמְשָׁא עַבְּרִין לְדַפֵּי סְטַר מַשְׁכְּנָא תִּנְיֵתָא וְחַמְשָׁא עַבְּרִין לְדַפֵּי מַשְׁכְּנָא לְסוֹפֵיהוֹן מַעַרְבָא:
verses.ar_en: and five bars for the planks of the second wall of the mishkon, and five bars for the planks of the western (back) wall of the mishkon.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד יָת עַבְּרָא מְצִיעָאָה לְאַעְבָּרָא בְּגוֹ דַפַּיָא מִן סְיָפֵי לִסְיָפֵי:
verses.ar_en: He made the middle (center) bar to go through the planks, [reinforcing the planks] from one end to the other.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת דַפַּיָא חֲפָא דַהֲבָא וְיָת עִזְקָתְהוֹן עֲבַד דַהֲבָא אַתְרָא לְעַבְּרַיָא וַחֲפָא יָת עַבְּרַיָא דַהֲבָא:
verses.ar_en: He overlaid the planks with gold, and made their rings out of gold to hold the bars. He (also) overlaid the bars with gold.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד יָת פָּרֻכְתָּא תִּכְלָא וְאַרְגְוָנָא וּצְבַע זְהוֹרִי וּבוּץ שְׁזִיר עוֹבַד אֳמָן עֲבַד יָתַהּ צוּרַת כְּרוּבִין:
verses.ar_en: He made the paroches (partition) out of greenish blue wool, dark red wool, crimson [colored] wool, and fine, twined linen, the work of a craftsman, with figures of Cherubim (woven into it).

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד לַהּ אַרְבְּעָא עַמוּדֵי שִׁטִין וַחֲפָנוּן דַהֲבָא וָוֵיהוֹן דַהֲבָא וְאַתִּיךְ לְהוֹן אַרְבְּעָא סַמְכִין דִכְסָף:
