verses.ar_en: He made for it (the paroches) four acacia-wood pillars and he overlaid them with gold. Their hooks were also of gold. He cast for them four silver sockets.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד פְּרָסָא לִתְרַע מַשְׁכְּנָא תִּכְלָא וְאַרְגְוָנָא וּצְבַע זְהוֹרִי וּבוּץ שְׁזִיר עוֹבַד צַיָר:
verses.ar_en: He made a screen for the entrance of the tent, of greenish blue wool, dark red wool, crimson [colored] wool, and fine twined linen. It was the work of an embroiderer.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת עַמוּדוֹהִי חַמְשָׁא וְיָת וָוֵיהוֹן וַחֲפָא רֵישֵׁיהוֹן וְכִבּוּשֵׁיהוֹן דַהֲבָא וְסַמְכֵיהוֹן חַמְשָׁא נְחָשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: (He made) five pillars (to hold the screen), along with their hooks and he overlaid their caps and bands with gold. Their five sockets (he made of) copper.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד בְּצַלְאֵל יָת אֲרוֹנָא דְאָעֵי שִׁטִין תַּרְתֵּין אַמִין וּפַלְגָא אֻרְכֵּהּ וְאַמְתָא וּפַלְגָא פְתָיֵהּ וְאַמְתָא וּפַלְגָא רוּמֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: Betzalel made the ark of acacia wood, two and one-half amohs long, one and one-half amohs wide, and one and one-half amohs high.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲפָהִי דְהַב דְכֵי מִגָּו וּמִבָּרָא וַעֲבַד לֵהּ דֵיר דִדְהַב סְחוֹר סְחוֹר:
verses.ar_en: He covered it with pure gold from inside and out. He made for it a golden crown-like rim around (its top).

verses.ar_he: וְאַתִּיךְ לֵהּ אַרְבַּע עִזְקַן דִדְהַב עַל אַרְבַּע זִוְיָתֵהּ וְתַרְתֵּין עִזְקַן עַל סִטְרֵהּ חַד וְתַרְתֵּין עִזְקַן עַל סִטְרֵהּ תִּנְיֵתָא:
verses.ar_en: He cast four gold rings on its (the ark’s) four corners, two rings on one side and two rings on the other side.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד אֲרִיחֵי דְאָעֵי שִׁטִין וַחֲפָא יָתְהוֹן דַהֲבָא:
verses.ar_en: He made two poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with gold.

verses.ar_he: וְאָעֵיל יָת אֲרִיחַיָא בְּעִזְקָתָא עַל סִטְרֵי אֲרוֹנָא לְמִטָל יָת אֲרוֹנָא:
verses.ar_en: He placed the poles in the rings on the sides of the ark, so that the ark can be carried with them.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד כַּפֻּרְתָּא דְהַב דְכֵי תַּרְתֵּין אַמִין וּפַלְגָא אֻרְכַּהּ וְאַמְתָא וּפַלְגָא פְתָיַהּ:
verses.ar_en: He made a cover (for the ark) of pure gold, two and one-half amohs long, and one and one-half amohs wide.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד תְּרֵין כְּרוּבִין דִדְהָב נְגִיד עֲבַד יָתְהוֹן מִתְּרֵין סִטְרֵי כַפֻּרְתָּא:
verses.ar_en: He made two golden Cherubim. He hammered them out of the two ends of the (ark) cover.

verses.ar_he: כְּרוּבָא חַד מִסִטְרָא מִכָּא וּכְרוּבָא חַד מִסִטְרָא מִכָּא מִן כַּפֻּרְתָּא עֲבַד יָת כְּרוּבַיָא מִתְּרֵין סִטְרוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: One Cherub out of one end [side], and one Cherub out of the other end [side]. From the (same piece of gold as the) cover itself, he made the Cherubim on its two ends [sides].

verses.ar_he: וַהֲווֹ כְרוּבַיָא פְּרִיסָן גַדְפֵיהוֹן לְעֵלָא נָטְלִין בְּגַדְפֵיהוֹן עַל כַּפֻּרְתָּא וְאַפֵּיהוֹן חַד לָקֳבֵל חַד לָקֳבֵל כַּפֻּרְתָּא הֲווֹ אַפֵּי כְרוּבַיָא:
verses.ar_en: The Cherubim had their wings spread upward, sheltering the cover with their wings, and they faced one another, the Cherubim’s faces were (inclined) toward the cover.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד יָת פָּתוֹרָא דְאָעֵי שִׁטִין תַּרְתֵּין אַמִין אֻרְכֵּהּ וְאַמְתָא פְתָיֵהּ וְאַמְתָא וּפַלְגָא רוּמֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: He made a table out of acacia wood, two amohs long, one amoh wide, and one and one-half amohs high.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲפָא יָתֵהּ דְהַב דְכֵי וַעֲבַד לֵהּ דֵיר דִדְהַב סְחוֹר סְחוֹר:
verses.ar_en: He overlaid it with pure gold, and he made a crown-like rim around it.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד לֵהּ גְדַנְפָא רוּמֵהּ פּוּשְׁכָא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר וַעֲבַד דֵיר דִדְהַב לִגְדַנְפֵהּ סְחוֹר סְחוֹר:
verses.ar_en: He made a ledge of a tefach [high] around (the table), and he made a gold crown-like rim around the ledge.

verses.ar_he: וְאַתִּיךְ לֵהּ אַרְבַּע עִזְקַן דִדְהָב וִיהַב יָת עִזְקֳתָא עַל אַרְבַּע זִוְיָתָא דִי לְאַרְבַּע רַגְלוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: He cast for it (the table) four gold rings, and placed the rings on the four corners that are on its four legs.

verses.ar_he: לָקֳבֵל גְדַנְפָא הֲווֹ עִזְקָתָא אַתְרָא לַאֲרִיחַיָא לְמִטַל יָת פָּתוֹרָא:
verses.ar_en: The rings were against the ledge as houses (receptacles) for the poles with which to carry the table.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד יָת אֲרִיחַיָא דְאָעֵי שִׁטִּין וַחֲפָא יָתְהוֹן דַהֲבָא לְמִטַל יָת פָּתוֹרָא:
verses.ar_en: He made the poles out of acacia wood, and overlaid them with gold with which to carry the table.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד יָת מָנַיָא דִי עַל פָּתוֹרָא יָת מָגִיסוֹהִי וְיָת בָּזִיכּוֹהִי וְיָת מְכִילָתֵהּ וְיָת קַשְׂוָתָא דִי יִתְנַסַךְ בְּהוֹן דְהַב דְכֵי:
verses.ar_en: He made the vessels that were on the table, its dishes (bread shapes), its spoons (incense bowls), its supports, and its half-hollow tubes by which they (the breads) are covered, out of pure gold.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד יָת מְנַרְתָּא דְהַב דְכֵי נְגִיד עֲבַד יָת מְנַרְתָּא שִׁידַהּ וּקְנַהּ כַּלִידָהָא חֵזוּרָהָא וְשׁוֹשַׁנָהָא מִנַהּ הֲווֹ:
verses.ar_en: He made the menorah (out) of pure gold. The menorah was made by hammering (its form out of a solid piece of gold). Its base, its shaft, its cups, its knobs, and its flowers were of it (the same piece of gold).

verses.ar_he: וְשִׁתָּא קְנִין נָפְקִין מִסִטְרָהָא תְּלָתָא קְנֵי מְנַרְתָּא מִסִטְרַהּ חַד וּתְלָתָא קְנֵי מְנַרְתָּא מִסִטְרַהּ תִּנְיָנָא:
verses.ar_en: Six branches extended from its sides, three branches of the menorah from one of its sides, and three branches of the menorah from the second side.

verses.ar_he: תְּלָתָא כַלִידִין מְצַיְרִין בְּקַנְיָא חַד חֵזוּר וְשׁוֹשָׁן וּתְלָתָא כַלִידִין מְצַיְרִין בְּקַנְיָא חַד חֵזוּר וְשׁוֹשָׁן כֵּן לְשִׁתָּא קְנִין דְנָפְקִין מִן מְנַרְתָּא:
verses.ar_en: Three cups were engraved in almond-shaped patterns, on one branch with a knob and a flower, and three cups were engraved in almond-shaped patterns, on one branch with a knob and a flower. So was (the form) of each of the six branches that extended from (the shaft) of the menorah.

verses.ar_he: וּבִמְנַרְתָּא אַרְבְּעָא כַלִידִין מְצַיְרִין חֵזוּרָהָא וְשׁוֹשַׁנָהָא:
verses.ar_en: The (shaft of the) menorah had four cups, engraved in almond shaped patterns, with their knobs and their flowers.

verses.ar_he: וְחֵזוּר תְּחוֹת תְּרֵין קְנִין מִנַהּ וְחֵזוּר תְּחוֹת תְּרֵין קְנִין מִנַהּ וְחֵזוּר תְּחוֹת תְּרֵין קְנִין מִנַהּ לְשִׁתָּא קְנִין דְנַפְקִין מִנַהּ:
verses.ar_en: There was a knob under the two branches extending from it, and a (second) knob under the (second) two branches extending from it, and a (third) knob under the (third) two branches extending from it. (This held true) for the six branches that extended from it (the menorah’s shaft).

verses.ar_he: חֵזוּרֵיהוֹן וּקְנֵיהוֹן מִנַהּ הֲווֹ כֻּלַהּ נְגִידָא חֲדָא דְהַב דְכֵי:
verses.ar_en: Their knobs and their branches were made out of (the menorah) itself. It was all made of a single hammered work of pure gold.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד יָת בּוֹצִינָהָא שִׁבְעָא וְצִבְיְתָהָא וּמַחְתְּיָתָהָא דְהַב דְכֵי:
verses.ar_en: He made seven lamps (for the menorah), and its tongs and its (ash) scoops, of pure gold.

verses.ar_he: כִּכְּרָא דְהַב דְכֵי עֲבַד יָתַהּ וְיָת כָּל מָנָהָא:
verses.ar_en: He made it out of a kikar of pure gold, together with all its vessels.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד יָת מַדְבְּחָא דִקְטֹּרֶת בּוּסְמַיָא דְאָעֵי שִׁטִין אַמְתָא אֻרְכֵּהּ וְאַמְתָא פְתָיֵהּ מְרַבַּע וְתַרְתֵּין אַמִין רוּמֵהּ מִנֵהּ הֲווֹ קַרְנוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: He made the [spice] incense altar out of acacia wood, one amoh long and one amoh wide, it was square, and two amohs high. Its horn-like elevations were of one piece with it.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲפָא יָתֵהּ דְהַב דְכֵי יָת אִגָרֵה וְיָת כָּתְלוֹהִי סְחוֹר סְחוֹר וְיָת קַרְנוֹהִי וַעֲבַד לֵהּ דֵיר דִדְהַב סְחוֹר סְחוֹר:
verses.ar_en: He overlaid it with pure gold, on its top, its walls all around, and its horn-like elevations. He made a gold crown-like rim all around it.

verses.ar_he: וְתַרְתֵּין עִזְקַן דִדְהַב עֲבַד לֵהּ מִלְרַע לְדֵירֵהּ עַל תַּרְתֵּין זִוְיָתֵהּ עַל תְּרֵין סִטְרוֹהִי לְאַתְרָא לַאֲרִיחַיָא לְמִטַל יָתֵהּ בְּהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: He made two gold rings for it under its crown-like rim on two of its corners, on its two opposite sides, to house the poles with which to carry it.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד יָת אֲרִיחַיָא דְאָעֵי שִׁטִין וַחֲפָא יָתְהוֹן דַהֲבָא:
verses.ar_en: He made the poles out of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד יָת מִשְׁחָא דִרְבוּתָא קוּדְשָׁא וְיָת קְטֹרֶת בּוּסְמַיָא דְכֵי עוֹבַד בּוּסְמָנוּ:
verses.ar_en: He made the sacred anointing oil and the pure perfumed incense, according to the work of the perfumer.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד יָת מַדְבְּחָא דַעֲלָתָא דְאָעֵי שִׁטִין חֲמֵשׁ אַמִין אֻרְכֵּהּ וַחֲמֵשׁ אַמִין פְּתָיֵהּ מְרַבַּע וּתְלָתָא אַמִין רוּמֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: He made the burnt-offering altar out of acacia wood. It was five amohs long and five amohs wide, it was square, and three amohs high.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד קַרְנוֹהִי עַל אַרְבַּע זִוְיָתֵהּ מִנֵהּ הֲווֹ קַרְנוֹהִי וַחֲפָא יָתֵהּ נְחָשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: He made its raised projections on its four corners. Its raised projections were one piece with it, and he overlaid it with copper.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד יָת כָּל מָנֵי מַדְבְּחָא יָת פְּסַכְתְּרָוָתָא וְיָת מַגְרוֹפְיָתָא וְיָת מִזְרְקָתָא יָת צִנוֹרְיָתָא וְיָת מַחְתְּיָתָא כָּל מָנוֹהִי עֲבַד נְחָשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: He made all the vessels of the altar, its pots, its scoops, its basins, its flesh-hooks, and its fire pans. He made all of its vessels out of copper.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד לְּמַדְבְּחָא סְרָדָא עוֹבַד מְצַדְתָּא דִנְחָשָׁא תְּחוֹת סוֹבָבֵהּ מִלְרַע עַד פַּלְגֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: He made for the altar a grate of copper netting, under its rim extending downward, (so that the grate reached) to the middle of the altar.

verses.ar_he: וְאַתִּיךְ אַרְבַּע עִזְקָתָא בְּאַרְבַּע סִטְרָתָא לִסְרָדָא דִנְחָשָׁא אַתְרָא לַאֲרִיחַיָא:
verses.ar_en: He cast four rings on the four corners [sides]of the copper grating to house the poles.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד יָת אֲרִיחַיָא דְאָעֵי שִׁטִין וַחֲפָא יָתְהוֹן נְחָשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: He made the poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with copper.

verses.ar_he: וְאָעֵיל יָת אֲרִיחַיָא בְּעִזְקָתָא עַל סִטְרֵי מַדְבְּחָא לְמִטַל יָתֵהּ בְּהוֹן חֲלִיל לוּחִין עֲבַד יָתֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: He placed the poles into the rings that were on the (two) sides of the altar to carry it with them. He made it a hollow structure constructed from boards.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד יָת כִּיוֹרָא נְחָשָׁא וְיָת בְּסִיסֵהּ נְחָשָׁא בְּמֶחְזְיַן נְשַׁיָא דְאָתְיָן לְצַלָאָה בִּתְרַע מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא:
verses.ar_en: He made the basin out of copper and its base out of copper, from the mirrors of the women who had gathered [come to pray] at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד יָת דַרְתָּא לְרוּחַ עֵבַר דָרוֹמָא סְרָדֵי דַרְתָּא דְבוּץ שְׁזִיר מְאָה בְאַמִין:
verses.ar_en: He made the enclosure (for the mishkon). On the south side the curtains for the enclosure were made of fine, twined linen, one hundred amohs long.

verses.ar_he: עַמוּדֵיהוֹן עֶסְרִין וְסַמְכֵיהוֹן עֶסְרִין נְחָשָׁא וָוֵי עַמוּדַיָא וְכִבּוּשֵׁיהוֹן דִכְסָף:
verses.ar_en: It had twenty pillars and twenty copper sockets. The hooks and bands of the pillars were of silver.

verses.ar_he: וּלְרוּחַ צִפּוּנָא מְאָה אַמִין עַמוּדֵיהוֹן עֶסְרִין וְסַמְכֵיהוֹן עֶסְרִין נְחָשָׁא וָוֵי עַמוּדַיָא וְכִבּוּשֵׁיהוֹן דִכְסָף:
verses.ar_en: On the north side, (its length was) one hundred amohs. It had twenty pillars and twenty copper sockets. The hooks and bands of the pillars were of silver.

verses.ar_he: וּלְרוּחַ מַעַרְבָא סְרָדִין חַמְשִׁין בְּאַמִין עֲמוּדֵיהוֹן עַסְרָא וְסַמְכֵיהוֹן עַסְרָא וָוֵי עַמוּדַיָא וְכִבּוּשֵׁיהוֹן דִכְסָף:
verses.ar_en: On the west side, the curtains were of fifty amohs. It had ten pillars and ten sockets. The hooks and bands of the pillars were of silver.

verses.ar_he: וּלְרוּחַ קִדוּמָא מָדִינְחָא חַמְשִׁין אַמִין:
verses.ar_en: (The width of the enclosure) on the east side was fifty amohs.

verses.ar_he: סְרָדִין חֲמֵשׁ עֶסְרֵי אַמִין לְעִבְרָא עַמוּדֵיהוֹן תְּלָתָא וְסַמְכֵיהוֹן תְּלָתָא:
verses.ar_en: Curtains fifteen amohs long were on one flank (of the entrance). They had three pillars and three sockets.

verses.ar_he: וּלְעִבְרָא תִנְיֵתָא מִכָּא וּמִכָּא לִתְרַע דַרְתָּא סְרָדִין חֲמֵשׁ עֶסְרֵי אַמִין עַמוּדֵיהוֹן תְּלָתָא וְסַמְכֵיהוֹן תְּלָתָא:
verses.ar_en: The other flank, on either side of the gate to the enclosure (there also were) curtains fifteen amohs long. They (too) had three pillars and three sockets.

verses.ar_he: כָּל סְרָדֵי דְדַרְתָּא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר דְבוּץ שְׁזִיר:
verses.ar_en: All curtains around the enclosure were made of twined, fine linen.

verses.ar_he: וְסַמְכַיָא לְעַמוּדַיָא נְחָשָׁא וָוֵי עַמוּדַיָא וְכִבּוּשֵׁיהוֹן דִכְסַף וְחִפּוּי רֵישֵׁיהוֹן דִכְסָף וְאִנוּן מְכַבְּשִׁין דִכְסָף כָּל עַמוּדֵי דַרְתָּא:
verses.ar_en: The sockets for the pillars were of copper, the hooks and bands of the pillars were of silver, and the covering of their tops was of silver. All pillars of the enclosure had silver bands.

verses.ar_he: וּפְרָסָא דִתְרַע דַרְתָּא עוֹבַד צַיָר תִּכְלָא וְאַרְגְוָנָא וּצְבַע זְהוֹרִי וּבוּץ שְׁזִיר וְעֶסְרִין אַמִין אֻרְכָּא וְרוּמָא בְּפוּתְיָא חֲמֵשׁ אַמִין לָקֳבֵל סְרָדֵי דַרְתָּא:
verses.ar_en: The screen at the entrance of the enclosure was the work of an embroiderer. It was made of greenish blue wool, dark red wool, crimson [colored] wool, and twined, fine linen. It was twenty amohs long and the height in the width was five amohs, corresponding to the curtains of the enclosure.

verses.ar_he: וְעַמוּדֵיהוֹן אַרְבְּעָא וְסַמְכֵיהוֹן אַרְבְּעָא נְחָשָׁא וָוֵיהוֹן דִכְסַף וְחִפּוּי רֵישֵׁיהוֹן וְכִבּוּשֵׁיהוֹן דִכְסָף:
verses.ar_en: (The screen) had four pillars and four copper sockets, silver hooks, and their tops and bands were overlaid with silver.

verses.ar_he: וְכָל סִכַּיָא לְמַשְׁכְּנָא וּלְדַרְתָּא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר דִנְחָשָׁא: ססס:
verses.ar_en: All the stakes of the mishkon and the surrounding enclosure were made of copper.

verses.ar_he: אִלֵין מִנְיָנֵי מַשְׁכְּנָא מַשְׁכְּנָא דְסַהֲדוּתָא דִי אִתְמְנֵי עַל מֵימְרָא דְמשֶׁה פָּלְחַן לֵיוָאֵי בִּידָא דְאִיתָמָר בַּר אַהֲרֹן כַּהֲנָא:
verses.ar_en: These are the accounts of the mishkon, the mishkon of Testimony, that were drawn up by Moshe’s order; for the work of the Levites under the direction of Isamar, son of Aharon the kohein.

verses.ar_he: וּבְצַלְאֵל בַּר אוּרִי בַר חוּר לְשִׁבְטָא דִיהוּדָה עֲבַד יָת כָּל דִי פַקֵיד יְיָ יָת משֶׁה:
verses.ar_en: Betzalel, son of Uri, son of Chur, of the tribe of Yehudah, made all that Adonoy commanded Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וְעִמֵהּ אָהֳלִיאָב בַּר אֲחִיסָמָךְ לְשִׁבְטָא דְדָן נַגָר וָאֳמָן וְצַיָר בְּתִכְלָא וּבְאַרְגְוָנָא וּבִצְבַע זְהוֹרִי וּבְבוּצָא:
verses.ar_en: With him was Oholiav, son of Achisamach, of the tribe of Dan, sculptor [carpenter] and craftsman, and embroiderer in greenish-blue wool, dark red wool, crimson [colored] wool, and fine linen.

verses.ar_he: כָּל דַהֲבָא דְאִתְעֲבֵד לְעִבִידָא בְּכֹל עִבִידַת קוּדְשָׁא וַהֲוָה דְהַב אֲרָמוּתָא עֶסְרִין וּתְשַׁע כִּכְּרִין וּשְׁבַע מְאָה וּתְלָתִין סִלְעִין בְּסִלְעֵי קוּדְשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: All the gold that was used for the work in all the work of the Sanctuary. The gold donated as a wave offering amounted to twenty-nine kikar and seven hundred and thirty shekel [selaim], (measured) by the [selaim of the] Sanctuary standard.

verses.ar_he: וּכְסַף מִנְיָנֵי כְנִשְׁתָּא מְאָה כִכְּרִין וְאֶלֶף וּשְׁבַע מְאָה וְשִׁבְעִין וְחַמְשָׁא סִלְעִין בְּסִלְעֵי קוּדְשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: The silver (collected) by the community census (amounted to) one hundred kikar, and one thousand seven hundred and seventy-five shekel [selaim], (measured) by the [selaim of the] Sanctuary standard,

verses.ar_he: תִּקְלָּא לְגֻלְגַלְתָּא פַלְגוּת סִלְעָא בְּסִלְעֵי קוּדְשָׁא לְכֹל דְעָבַר עַל מִנְיָנַיָא מִבַּר עֶסְרִין שְׁנִין וּלְעֵלָא לְשִׁית מְאָה וּתְלָתָא אַלְפִין וַחֲמֵשׁ מְאָה וְחַמְשִׁין:
verses.ar_en: one beka per person, (the equivalent of) a half-shekel[sela], (measured) by the [selaim of the] Sanctuary standard, from each one included in the census, from the age of twenty years and up, for six hundred and three thousand five hundred and fifty (men).

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה מְאָה כִכְּרִין דִכְסַף לְאַתָּכָא יָת סַמְכֵי קוּדְשָׁא וְיָת סַמְכֵי דְפָרֻכְתָּא מְאָה סַמְכִין לִמְאָה כִכְּרִין כִּכְּרָא לְסַמְכָא:
verses.ar_en: One hundred kikar of this silver was (used) to cast the sockets for the mishkon and the sockets for the paroches (partition). One hundred sockets (were cast) from one hundred kikar, one kikar for each socket.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת אַלְפָא וּשְׁבַע מְאָה וְשִׁבְעִין וְחַמְשָׁא עֲבַד וָוִין לְעַמוּדַיָא וְחִפָּא רֵישֵׁיהוֹן וְכַבֵּשׁ יָתְהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Of the (remaining) one thousand seven hundred and seventy-five (shekel) he made hooks for the pillars, overlaid their caps and made bands for them.

verses.ar_he: וּנְחָשָׁא דַאֲרָמוּתָא שִׁבְעִין כִּכְּרִין וּתְרֵין אַלְפִין וְאַרְבַּע מְאָה סִלְעִין:
verses.ar_en: The copper (donated as) a wave offering (amounted to) seventy kikar, and two thousand four hundred shekel [selaim],

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד בַּהּ יָת סַמְכֵי תְּרַע מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וְיָת מַדְבְּחָא דִנְחָשָׁא וְיָת סְרָדָא דִנְחָשָׁא דִי לֵהּ וְיָת כָּל מָנֵי מַדְבְּחָא:
verses.ar_en: from which he made sockets for the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, the copper altar with its copper grate, all the altar’s vessels,

verses.ar_he: וְיָת סַמְכֵי דְדַרְתָּא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר וְיָת סַמְכֵי תְּרַע דַרְתָּא וְיָת כָּל סִכֵּי מַשְׁכְּנָא וְיָת כָּל סִכֵּי דַרְתָּא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר:
verses.ar_en: the sockets around the enclosure, the sockets for the entrance of the enclosure, all the stakes for the mishkon, and all the stakes around the enclosure.

verses.ar_he: וּמִן תִּכְלָא וְאַרְגְוָנָא וּצְבַע זְהוֹרִי עֲבָדוּ לְבוּשֵׁי שִׁמוּשָׁא לְשַׁמָשָׁא בְּקוּדְשָׁא וַעֲבָדוּ יָת לְבוּשֵׁי קוּדְשָׁא דִי לְאַהֲרֹן כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָת משֶׁה:
verses.ar_en: From the greenish-blue wool, dark red wool, and crimson [colored] wool, they made garments of distinction [service] for service in the Sanctuary, and they made sacred garments for Aharon, just as Adonoy commanded Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד יַת אֵפוֹדָא דַהֲבָא תִּכְלָא וְאַרְגְוָנָא וּצְבַע זְהוֹרִי וּבוּץ שְׁזִיר:
verses.ar_en: He made the eiphod out of gold, greenish-blue wool, dark red wool, crimson [colored] wool, and twisted, fine linen.

verses.ar_he: וְרַדִידוּ יָת טַסֵי דַהֲבָא וְקַצִיצוּ חוּטִין לְמֶעְבַּד בְּגוֹ תִּכְלָא וּבְגוֹ אַרְגְוָנָא וּבְגוֹ צְבַע זְהוֹרִי וּבְגוֹ בוּצָא עוֹבַד אֳמָן:
verses.ar_en: They beat the plates of gold and cut (them) into threads to work them into the greenish-blue wool, into the dark red wool, into the crimson [colored] wool, and into the fine linen, the work of a craftsman.

verses.ar_he: כַּתְפָּן עֲבָדוּ לֵהּ מְלַפְּפָן עַל תְּרֵין סִטְרוֹהִי יִתְלָפֵף:
verses.ar_en: They made shoulder straps attached to it, attached at its two corners [sides].

verses.ar_he: וְהֶמְיַן תִּקוּנֵהּ דִי עֲלוֹהִי מִנֵהּ הוּא כְּעוֹבָדוֹהִי דַהֲבָא תִּכְלָא וְאַרְגְוָנָא וּצְבַע זְהוֹרִי וּבוּץ שְׁזִיר כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָת משֶׁה:
verses.ar_en: The eiphod’s belt [that enhances it] which was on it, was woven with it in the same manner (as the eiphod) (with) gold, greenish-blue wool, dark red wool, crimson [colored] wool, and twined, fine linen. just as Adonoy commanded.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבָדוּ יָת אַבְנֵי בוּרְלָא מְשַׁקְעָן מְרַמְצָן דִדְהָב גְלִיפָן כְּתַב מְפָרַשׁ עַל שְׁמָהַת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל:
verses.ar_en: They placed the shoham stones in gold settings, They (the stones) were engraved like the engraving of a signet (ring) [with script that is clear], with the names of the B’nei Yisrael.

verses.ar_he: וְשַׁוִי יָתְהוֹן עַל כִּתְפָא דְאֵפוֹדָא אַבְנֵי דוּכְרָנָא לִבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָת משֶׁה:
verses.ar_en: He set them on the shoulder straps of the eiphod, as remembrance stones for the B’nei Yisrael, just as Adonoy commanded Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד יָת חוּשְׁנָא עוֹבַד אֳמָן כְּעוֹבְדֵי אֵפוֹדָא דַהֲבָּא תִּכְלָא וְאַרְגְוָנָא וּצְבַע זְהוֹרִי וּבוּץ שְׁזִיר:
verses.ar_en: He made the breastplate the work of a craftsman, in the same manner the eiphod was made, (out of) gold, greenish-blue wool, dark red wool, crimson [colored] wool and twined, fine linen.

verses.ar_he: מְרַבַּע הֲוָה עֵיף עֲבָדוּ יָת חוּשְׁנָא זֶרְתָּא אֻרְכֵּהּ וְזֶרְתָּא פְתָיֵהּ עֵיף:
verses.ar_en: They made the breastplate a doubled square, a span in its length and a span in its width.

verses.ar_he: וְאַשְׁלִימוּ בֵהּ אַרְבְּעָא סִדְרֵי אֶבֶן טָבָא סִדְרָא קַדְמָאָה סַמְקָן יַרְקָן וּבַרְקָן סִדְרָא חָד:
verses.ar_en: They filled them (the breastplate settings) with four rows of [precious] stones: The first row: An odem (ruby), pitda (topaz), and barekes (emerald), (was placed on) the first row [one].

verses.ar_he: וְסִדְרָא תִּנְיָנָא אִזְמָרַגְדִין שַׁבְזִיז וְסַבְהֲלוֹם:
verses.ar_en: The second row: nofech (carbuncle), sapphire, and yahalom (diamond).

verses.ar_he: וְסִדְרָא תְּלִיתָאָה קַנְכֵּרֵי טַרְקְיָא וְעֵין עֶגְלָא:
verses.ar_en: The third row: leshem (opal), shevo (agate), and achlomo (amethyst).

verses.ar_he: וְסִדְרָא רְבִיעָאָה כְּרוּם יַמָּא וּבוּרְלָא וּפַנְטֵּרֵי מְשַׁקְעָן מְרַמְצָן דִדְהַב בְּאַשְׁלָמוּתְהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: The fourth row: tarshish (chrysolite), shoham (onyx), and yoshfei (jasper). (They were) placed in gold settings in their fullness.

verses.ar_he: וְאַבְנַיָא עַל שְׁמָהַת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אִנוּן תַּרְתֵּי עֶסְרֵי עַל שְׁמָהַתְהוֹן כְּתַב מְפָרַשׁ כִּגְלוֹף דְעִזְקָא גְבַר עַל שְׁמֵהּ לִתְרֵין עֲסַר שִׁבְטִין:
verses.ar_en: These stones had the names of the B’nei Yisrael, twelve of them by their names, each one’s name [written in script that is clear like they engrave in a signet ring] engraved as on a signet (ring), representing the twelve tribes.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבָדוּ עַל חוּשְׁנָא תִּכִּין מְתַחְמָן עוֹבַד גְדִילוּ דְהַב דְכֵי:
verses.ar_en: They made twisted end-chains for the breastplate, braided work of pure gold.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבָדוּ תַּרְתֵּין מְרַמְצָן דִדְהַב וְתַרְתֵּין עִזְקָן דִדְהָב וִיהָבוּ יָת תַּרְתֵּין עִזְקָתָא עַל תְּרֵין סִטְרֵי חוּשְׁנָא:
verses.ar_en: They made two gold settings, and two gold rings. They set the two gold rings at the two (upper) corners [sides] of the breastplate.

verses.ar_he: וִיהָבוּ תַּרְתֵּין גְדִילָתָא דִדְהַב עַל תַּרְתֵּין עִזְקָתָא עַל סִטְרֵי חוּשְׁנָא:
verses.ar_en: They put (attached) the two gold-braided chains on the two rings, at the corners [sides] of the breastplate.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת תַּרְתֵּין גְדִילָן דְעַל תַּרְתֵּין סִטְרוֹהִי יְהָבוּ עַל תַּרְתֵּין מְרַמְצָתָא וִיהָבֻנוּן עַל כַּתְפֵּי אֵפוֹדָא לָקֳבֵל אַפּוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: The two ends of the two braided chains [that are on its two sides] they put (attached) to the two settings, and placed them on the shoulder straps of the eiphod toward the front.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבָדוּ תַּרְתֵּין עִזְקַן דִדְהַב וְשַׁוִיאוּ עַל תְּרֵין סִטְרֵי חוּשְׁנָא עַל סִפְתֵהּ דִי לְעִבְרָא דְאֵפוֹדָא מִלְגָיו:
verses.ar_en: They made two gold rings and set them on the two (lower) corners [sides] of the breastplate, on its edge that was on the inner side of the eiphod.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבָדוּ תַּרְתֵּין עִזְקַן דִדְהַב וִיהָבֻנוּן עַל תַּרְתֵּין כִּתְפֵי אֵפוֹדָא מִלְרַע מִלָקֳבֵל אַפּוֹהִי לָקֳבֵל בֵּית לוֹפֵי מֵעִלָוֵי לְהֶמְיַן אֵפוֹדָא:
verses.ar_en: They made two gold rings and placed them on the two shoulder straps of the eiphod, on the bottom, toward the front, against where they were joined, above the eiphod’s belt.

verses.ar_he: וְיַחֲדוּן יָת חוּשְׁנָא מֵעִזְקְתֵהּ לְעִזְקָתָא דְאֵפוֹדָא בְּחוּטָּא דִתְכֶלְתָּא לְמֶהֱוֵי עַל הֶמְיַן אֵפוֹדָא וְלָא יִתְפָּרֵק חוּשְׁנָא מֵעִלָוֵי אֵפוֹדָא כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָת משֶׁה:
verses.ar_en: They bound the (lower) rings of the breastplate to the (lower) rings of the eiphod with a cord of greenish-blue wool, so that it (the breastplate) remained against the eiphod’s belt, so that the breastplate did not move from the eiphod, just as Adonoy commanded Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד יָת מְעִילָא דְאֵפוֹדָא עוֹבַד מָחֵי גְמִיר תִּכְלָא:
verses.ar_en: He made the robe of the eiphod of woven work, completely out of greenish-blue wool.

verses.ar_he: וּפוּם מְעִילָא כָּפִיל לְגַוֵהּ כְּפוּם שִׁרְיָן תּוֹרָא מַקַף לְפוּמֵהּ סְחוֹר סְחוֹר לָא יִתְבְּזָע:
verses.ar_en: The opening of the robe was turned inward like the opening around a coat of armor, with a border [encircling] all around the opening so that it did not tear.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבָדוּ עַל שִׁפּוֹלֵי מְעִילָא רִמוֹנֵי תִּכְלָא וְאַרְגְוָנָא וּצְבַע זְהוֹרִי שְׁזִיר:
verses.ar_en: They made on the robe’s (lower) hem, pomegranates of greenish-blue wool, dark red wool, crimson [colored] wool, (that were) twined together.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבָדוּ זַגַיָא דְהַב דְכֵי וִיהָבוּ יָת זַגַיָא בְּגוֹ רִמוֹנַיָא עַל שִׁפּוֹלֵי מְעִילָא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר בְּגוֹ רִמוֹנַיָא:
verses.ar_en: They made pure gold bells, and put the bells between the pomegranates, on the (lower) hem of the robe all around, between the pomegranates.

verses.ar_he: זַגָא וְרִמוֹנָא זַגָא וְרִמוֹנָא עַל שִׁפּוֹלֵי מְעִילָא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר לְשַׁמָשָׁא כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָת משֶׁה:
verses.ar_en: A bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, on the (lower) hem of the robe all around, for performing (Divine) service, just as Adonoy commanded Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבָדוּ יָת כִּתּוּנִין דְבוּצָא עוֹבַד מָחֵי לְאַהֲרֹן וִלִבְנוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: They made fine linen undershirts, of woven work, for Aharon and his sons.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת מִצְנֶפְתָּא דְבוּצָא וְיָת שְׁבַח כּוֹבָעַיָא דְבוּצָא וְיָת מִכְנְסֵי בוּצָא דְבוּץ שְׁזִיר:
verses.ar_en: (They made) a fine linen turban, and the slendor of the fine linen turban-hats, and the linen pants, (all out of) fine, twined linen,

verses.ar_he: וְיָת הֶמְיָנָא דְבוּץ שְּׁזִיר וְתִכְלָא וְאַרְגְוָנָא וּצְבַע זְהוֹרִי עוֹבַד צַיָר כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָת משֶׁה:
verses.ar_en: (They made) the sash-belt of fine, twined linen, and greenish-blue wool, dark red wool, and crimson [colored] wool, the work of an embroiderer, just as Adonoy commanded Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבָדוּ יָת צִיצָא כְלִילָא דְקוּדְשָׁא דְהַב דְכֵי וּכְתָבוּ עֲלוֹהִי גְלִיפָן כְּתַב מְפָרַשׁ קֹדֶשׁ לַיְיָ:
verses.ar_en: They made a diadem—a holy crown, of pure gold. They wrote upon it a writing in the manner of a signet (ring) [an engraving in script that is clear], “Holy unto Adonoy.”

verses.ar_he: וִיהָבוּ עֲלוֹהִי חוּטָא תְכֶלְתָּא לְמִתַּן עַל מִצְנֶפְתָּא מִלְעֵלָא כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָת משֶׁה:
verses.ar_en: They put (fastened) on it a greenish-blue wool cord, to fasten it to the turban from above, just as Adonoy commanded Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וּשְׁלִים כָּל פָּלְחַן מַשְׁכְּנָא מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וַעֲבָדוּ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל כְּכֹל דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָת משֶׁה כֵּן עֲבָדוּ:
verses.ar_en: Thus was completed all the work of the mishkon of the Tent of Meeting. B’nei Yisrael did everything just as Adonoy commanded Moshe, so they did.

verses.ar_he: וְאַיְתִיוּ יָת מַשְׁכְּנָא לְמשֶׁה יָת מַשְׁכְּנָא וְיָת כָּל מָנוֹהִי פוּרְפוֹהִי דַפּוֹהִי עַבְּרוֹהִי וְעַמוּדוֹהִי וְסַמְכוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: They brought the mishkon to Moshe—the Tent and all its vessels, its clasps, planks, bars, pillars, and sockets,

verses.ar_he: וְיָת חוֹפָאָה מַשְׁכֵי דְדִכְרֵי מְסַמְקֵי וְיָת חוֹפָאָה מַשְׁכֵי דְסַסְגוֹנָא וְיָת פָּרֻכְתָּא דִפְרָסָא:
verses.ar_en: the covering of the red dyed rams’ skins, and the covering of the tachash [multicolored] skins, and the paroches (partition)-screen,

verses.ar_he: יָת אֲרוֹנָא דְסַהֲדוּתָא וְיָת אֲרִיחוֹהִי וְיָת כַּפֻּרְתָּא:
verses.ar_en: the ark of the Testimony, its poles, its cover,

verses.ar_he: יָת פָּתוֹרָא יָת כָּל מָנוֹהִי וְיָת לְחֵם אַפַּיָא:
verses.ar_en: the table, all its vessels, the showbread,

verses.ar_he: יָת מְנַרְתָּא דָכִיתָא יָת בּוֹצִינָהָא בּוֹצִנֵי סִדְרָא וְיָת כָּל מָנָהָא וְיָת מִשְׁחָא דְאַנְהָרוּתָא:
verses.ar_en: the pure Menorah, its lamps, the lamps to be set in order, all its vessels, oil for light,

verses.ar_he: וְיָת מַדְבְּחָא דְדַהֲבָא וְיָת מִשְׁחָא דִרְבוּתָא וְיָת קְטֹרֶת בּוּסְמַיָא וְיָת פְּרָסָא דִתְרַע מַשְׁכְּנָא:
verses.ar_en: the golden altar, the anointing oil, the incense of spices, the screen for the entrance of the Tent,

verses.ar_he: יָת מַדְבְּחָא דִנְחָשָׁא וְיָת סְרָדָא דִנְחָשָׁא דִילֵהּ יָת אֲרִיחוֹהִי וְיָת כָּל מָנוֹהִי יָת כִּיוֹרָא וְיָת בְּסִיסֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: the copper altar and its copper grate, along with its poles and all its vessels, the laver and its base,

verses.ar_he: יָת סְרָדֵי דְדַרְתָּא יָת עַמוּדָהָא וְיָת סַמְכָהָא וְיָת פְּרָסָא לִתְרַע דַרְתָּא יָת אֲטוּנוֹהִי וְסִכָּהָא וְיָת כָּל מָנֵי פָּלְחַן מַשְׁכְּנָא לְמַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא:
verses.ar_en: curtains for the enclosure, its pillars and its sockets, the screen for the entrance to the enclosure, its cords and its stakes, all the vessels for the service of the mishkon of the Tent of Meeting,

verses.ar_he: יָת לְבוּשֵׁי שִׁמוּשָׁא לְשַׁמָשָׁא בְקוּדְשָׁא יָת לְבוּשֵׁי קוּדְשָׁא לְאַהֲרֹן כַּהֲנָא וְיָת לְבוּשֵׁי בְנוֹהִי לְשַׁמָשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: the garments of distinction [service] for service in the Sanctuary, the sacred garments for Aharon the kohein, and the garments of his sons for priestly service.

verses.ar_he: כְּכֹל דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָת משֶׁה כֵּן עֲבָדוּ בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל יָת כָּל פָּלְחָנָא:
verses.ar_en: According to all that Adonoy commanded Moshe, so did B’nei Yisrael do all the work.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲזָא משֶׁה יָת כָּל עִבִדְתָּא וְהָא עֲבָדוּ יָתַהּ כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ כֵּן עֲבָדוּ וּבָרִיךְ יָתְהוֹן משֶׁה:
verses.ar_en: Moshe saw the entire work, and behold, they did it just as Adonoy commanded, so had they done, and Moshe blessed them.

verses.ar_he: וּמַלִיל יְיָ עִם משֶׁה לְמֵימָר:
verses.ar_en: Adonoy spoke to Moshe saying.

verses.ar_he: בְּיוֹמָא יַרְחָא קַדְמָאָה בְּחַד לְיַרְחָא תְּקִים יָת מַשְׁכְּנָא מַשְּׁכַּן זִמְנָא:
verses.ar_en: “On the first day of the first month, you should set up the mishkon of the Tent of Meeting.

verses.ar_he: וּתְשַׁוֵי תַמָן יַת אֲרוֹנָא דְסַהֲדוּתָא וְתַטֵּל עַל אֲרוֹנָא יָת פָּרֻכְתָּא:
verses.ar_en: Place the ark of Testimony there, and spread [cover] the paroches (partition) over the ark.

verses.ar_he: וְתָעֵל יָת פָּתוֹרָא וְתַסְדַר יָת סִדְרֵהּ וְתָעֵל יָת מְנַרְתָּא וְתַדְלֵק יָת בּוֹצִינָהָא:
verses.ar_en: Bring in the table and set it in order. Bring in the menorah and light its lamps.

verses.ar_he: וְתִתֵּן יָת מַדְבְּחָא דְדַהֲבָא לִקְטֹּרֶת בּוּסְמַיָא קֳדָם אֲרוֹנָא דְסַהֲדוּתָא וּתְשַׁוֵי יָת פְּרָסָא דְתַרְעָא לְמַשְׁכְּנָא:
verses.ar_en: Place the golden altar for burning incense [of spices], before the ark of Testimony. Place the screen at the mishkon’s entrance.

verses.ar_he: וְתִתֵּן יָת מַדְבְּחָא דַעֲלָתָא קֳדָם תְּרַע מַשְׁכְּנָא מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא:
verses.ar_en: Place the burnt-offering altar in front of the entrance of the mishkon of the Tent of Meeting.

verses.ar_he: וְתִתֵּן יָת כִּיוֹרָא בֵּין מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וּבֵין מַדְבְּחָא וְתִתֵּן תַּמָן מַיָא:
verses.ar_en: Place the laver between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and put water into it.

verses.ar_he: וּתְשַׁוֵי יָת דַרְתָּא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר וְתִתֵּן יָת פְּרָסָא דִתְרַע דַרְתָּא:
verses.ar_en: Put up the enclosure all around, and set up the screen for the enclosure’s entrance.

verses.ar_he: וְתִסַב יָת מִשְׁחָא דִרְבוּתָא וּתְרַבֵּי יָת מַשְׁכְּנָא וְיָת כָּל דִי בֵהּ וּתְקַדֵשׁ יָתֵהּ וְיָת כָּל מָנוֹהִי וִיהֵי קוּדְשָׁא:
verses.ar_en: Take the anointing oil, and anoint the mishkon and everything in it. Sanctify it and all its vessels so that it will become holy.

verses.ar_he: וּתְרַבֵי יָת מַדְבְּחָא דַעֲלָתָא וְיָת כָּל מָנוֹהִי וּתְקַדֵשׁ יָת מַדְבְּחָא וִיהֵי מַדְבְּחָא קֹדֶשׁ קוּדְשִׁין:
verses.ar_en: Anoint the burnt-offering altar and all its vessels. Sanctify the altar so that the altar becomes holy of holies.

verses.ar_he: וּתְרַבֵּי יָת כִּיוֹרָא וְיָת בְּסִיסֵהּ וּתְקַדֵשׁ יָתֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: Anoint the laver and its base and sanctify it.

verses.ar_he: וּתְקָרֵב יָת אַהֲרֹן וְיָת בְּנוֹהִי לִתְרַע מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וְתַסְחֵי יָתְהוֹן בְּמַיָא:
verses.ar_en: Bring Aharon and his sons to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and immerse them in a mikveh.

verses.ar_he: וְתַלְבֵּשׁ יָת אַהֲרֹן יָת לְבוּשֵׁי קוּדְשָׁא וּתְרַבֵּי יָתֵהּ וּתְקַדֵשׁ יָתֵהּ וִישַׁמֵשׁ קֳדָמָי:
verses.ar_en: Clothe Aharon with the sacred garments. Anoint him and sanctify him so that he may serve as a kohein to [before] Me.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת בְּנוֹהִי תְּקָרֵב וְתַלְבֵּשּׁ יָתְהוֹן כִּתּוּנִין:
verses.ar_en: Bring his sons and clothe them with undershirts.

verses.ar_he: וּתְרַבִּי יָתְהוֹן כְּמָא דִי רַבִּיתָא יָת אֲבוּהוֹן וִישַׁמְשׁוּן קֳדָמָי וּתְהֵי לְמֶהֱוֵי לְּהוֹן רְבוּתְהוֹן לְכַהֲנוּת עֲלָם לְדָרֵיהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Anoint them as you anointed their father, so that they may serve as kohanim to [before] Me. This should be done so that their anointing will make them an eternal kehunah throughout their generations.”

verses.ar_he: וַעֲבַד משֶׁה כְּכֹל דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָתֵהּ כֵּן עֲבָד:
verses.ar_en: Moshe did according to all that Adonoy commanded him—so he did.

verses.ar_he: וַהֲוָה בְּיַרְחָא קַדְמָאָה בְּשַׁתָּא תִנְיֵתָא בְּחַד לְיַרְחָא אִתָּקַם מַשְׁכְּנָא:
verses.ar_en: It was in the first month of the second year, on the first day of the month, that the mishkon was set up.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲקֵם משֶׁה יָת מַשְׁכְּנָא וִיהַב יָת סַמְכוֹהִי וְשַׁוִי יָת דַפּוֹהִי וִיהַב יָת עַבְרוֹהִי וַאֲקֵם יָת עַמוּדוֹהִי:
verses.ar_en: Moshe set up the mishkon, placed its sockets, put up its boards, put in its bars, and set up its pillars.

verses.ar_he: וּפְרַס יָת פְרָסָא עַל מַשְׁכְּנָא וְשַׁוִי יָת חוֹפָאָה דְמַשְׁכְּנָא עֲלוֹהִי מִלְעֵלָא כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָת משֶׁה:
verses.ar_en: He spread the tent over the mishkon and placed the tent’s covering above it, just as Adonoy commanded Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וּנְסִיב וִיהַב יָת סַהֲדוּתָא לַאֲרוֹנָא וְשַׁוִי יָת אֲרִיחַיָא עַל אֲרוֹנָא וִיהַב יָת כַּפֻּרְתָּא עַל אֲרוֹנָא מִלְעֵלָא:
verses.ar_en: He took the Testimony and placed it into the ark, put the poles on the ark, and put the cover on top of the ark.

verses.ar_he: וְאָעֵלּ יָת אֲרוֹנָא לְמַשְׁכְּנָא וְשַׁוִי יָת פָּרֻכְתָּא דִפְרָסָא וְאַטֵל עַל אֲרוֹנָא דְסַהֲדוּתָא כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָת משֶׁה:
verses.ar_en: He brought the ark into the mishkon and fastened the paroches (partition)-screen so that it covered the ark of Testimony, just as Adonoy commanded Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וִיהַב יָת פָּתוֹרָא בְּמַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא עַל צִדָא דְמַשְׁכְּנָא צִפוּנָא מִבָּרָא לְפָרֻכְתָּא:
verses.ar_en: He placed the table in the Tent of Meeting on the north side of the mishkon, outside the paroches (partition).

verses.ar_he: וְסַדַר עֲלוֹהִי סִדוּר דִלְחֵם קֳדָם יְיָ כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָת משֶׁה:
verses.ar_en: He set upon it an arrangement of bread before Adonoy, just as Adonoy commanded Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וְשַׁוִי יָת מְנַרְתָּא בְּמַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא לָקֳבֵל פָּתוֹרָא עַל צִדָא דְמַשְׁכְּנָא לְדָרוֹמָא:
verses.ar_en: He placed the Menorah in the Tent of Meeting, opposite the table, on the south side of the mishkon.

verses.ar_he: וְאַדְלֵק בּוֹצִינָהָא קֳדָם יְיָ כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָת משֶׁה:
verses.ar_en: He lit the lamps before Adonoy, just as Adonoy commanded Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וְשַׁוִי יָת מַדְבְּחָא דְדַהֲבָא בְּמַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא קֳדָם פָּרֻכְתָּא:
verses.ar_en: He placed the golden altar inside the Tent of Meeting, in front of the paroches.

verses.ar_he: וְאַקְטַּר עֲלוֹהִי קְטֹרֶת בּוּסְמִין כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָת משֶׁה:
verses.ar_en: He burned the incense of spices upon it, just as Adonoy commanded Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וְשַׁוִי יָת פְּרָסָא דְתַרְעָא לְמַשְׁכְּנָא:
verses.ar_en: He set up the screen at the mishkon’s entrance.

verses.ar_he: וְיָת מַדְבְּחָא דַעֲלָתָא שַׁוִי בִּתְרַע מַשְׁכְּנָא מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וְאַסֵק עֲלוֹהִי יָת עֲלָתָא וְיָת מִנְחָתָּא כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָת משֶׁה:
verses.ar_en: He placed the burnt-offering altar at the entrance of the mishkon of the Tent of Meeting. He sacrificed on it a burnt-offering and a meal-offering, just as Adonoy commanded Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וְשַׁוִי יָת כִּיוֹרָא בֵּין מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וּבֵין מַדְבְּחָא וִיהַב תַּמָן מַיָא לְקִדוּשׁ:
verses.ar_en: He set the laver between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and put water into it for washing [sanctification].

verses.ar_he: וּמְקַדְשִׁין מִנֵהּ משֶׁה וְאַהֲרֹן וּבְנוֹהִי יָת יְדֵיהוֹן וְיָת רַגְלֵיהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: Moshe, Aharon and his sons washed [would sanctify] their hands and feet from it,

verses.ar_he: בְּמֵעַלְהוֹן לְמַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וּבְמִקְרָבְהוֹן לְמַדְבְּחָא יְקַדְשׁוּן כְּמָא דִי פַקִיד יְיָ יָת משֶׁה:
verses.ar_en: when they came to the Tent of Meeting and when they approached the altar they would wash [sanctify themselves], just as Adonoy commanded Moshe.

verses.ar_he: וַאֲקֵם יָת דַרְתָּא סְחוֹר סְחוֹר לְמַשְׁכְּנָא וּלְמַדְבְּחָא וִיהַב יָת פְּרָסָא דִתְרַע דַרְתָּא וְשֵׁיצֵי משֶׁה יָת עִבִידָא:
verses.ar_en: He set up the enclosure around the mishkon and the altar, and put up the screen at the enclosure’s entrance, and thus Moshe completed the work.

verses.ar_he: וַחֲפָא עֲנָנָא יָת מַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא וִיקָרָא דַיְיָ אִתְמְלֵי יָת מַשְׁכְּנָא:
verses.ar_en: The cloud covered the Tent of Meeting, and the glory of Adonoy filled the mishkon.

verses.ar_he: וְלָא יָכִיל משֶׁה לְמֵיעַל לְמַשְׁכַּן זִמְנָא אֲרֵי שְׁרָא עֲלוֹהִי עֲנָנָא וִיקָרָא דַיְיָ אִתְמְלִי יָת מַשְׁכְּנָא:
verses.ar_en: Moshe was unable to enter the Tent of Meeting because the cloud rested on it, and the glory of Adonoy filled the mishkon.

verses.ar_he: וּבְאִסְתַּלָקוּת עֲנָנָא מֵעִלָוֵי מַשְׁכְּנָא נָטְלִין בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּכֹל מַטְלָנֵיהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: When the cloud rose up from over the mishkon, the B’nei Yisrael would set out in all their travels.

verses.ar_he: וְאִם לָא יִסְתַּלַק עֲנָנָא וְלָא נָטְלִין עַד יוֹמָא דְאִסְתַּלָקוּתֵהּ:
verses.ar_en: If the cloud did not rise, they would not set out until the day that it rose.

verses.ar_he: אֲרֵי עֲנָנָא יְקָרָא דַיְיָ עַל מַשְׁכְּנָא בִּימָמָא וְחֵיזוּ אֶשָׁתָא הֲוֵי בְלֵילְיָא בֵּהּ לְעֵינֵי כָל בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּכָל מַטְלָנֵיהוֹן:
verses.ar_en: For the cloud of [the Glory of] Adonoy was upon the mishkon by day, and there was a [vision of] fire in it by night, before the eyes of the entire Beis Yisrael, in all their travels.
